text: Can't believe it's taken my husband and me so long to try this place.  I'll admit that the name had me thinking it was traditional bar food with more pork than chicken or beef.  Boy were we wrong, and pleasantly surprised. It's truly fabulous! The atmosphere is casual and easy going, but the food is sophisticated and delicious, and the price is seriously reasonable for the quality.  I had the pork shank and my husband had the skirt steak.  The flavors were savory and delicious, and beautifully combined with the sides on each entree. Mine was so large, I took 1/2 of it home. But I'm getting ahead of myself... you must try the fried brussel sprouts appetizer with a fried egg on top... amazing! And we had to have the bacon bourbon bread pudding for dessert... makes my mouth water thinking about it. My only complaint is that they don't have decaf coffee... I mean who doesn't serve decaf??  I hope the management fixes this glitch so that the dining experience is perfect.  And ask for Lotti as your server... she's wonderfully helpful and attentive without hovering.  Enjoy!
Gina is the best hostess ever!! She greeted us with the best customer service ever!!  Her happy spirit and warmth made us feel so welcomed. The food is great! We will be back!!!   Thank you Gina!!!!
Stopped by for brunch during the marathon. The food was alright; they really push the booze, however. Good for some, less for others.

Love this place ever since it opened. The food is unique and the cocktails trendy. Service has been good to very good. It could waiver depending on what time/day you go. It's a funky joint and meant to be. Just hope they can keep things steady in their future. Fun place to take out of town guests. Try different things and share. If Cat is still there, she's your server. Eat and enjoy the Cuban Sandwich... best this side of Miami.... Florida!
Great service and even greater burger... will be going back to try some other things on the menu. The service was quite good... she even found us some regular yellow mustard...Thanks!

Reserved the private room for a Christmas party for 16 people.  It was perfect.  The menu selections were excellent and the manager was a pleasure to work with to plan the party.   The huge hit of the night was the pork tostadas - it was served as an appetizer but I could have been satisfied just eating that for my whole dinner.    Service was great.  House made cocktails were delicious.

My wife and I stopped in for a Sunday dinner with our daughters, their husbands and children. Our reserved table for 8 was set and ready for us. The wait staff was friendly and knowledgeable. The menu was unique and so delicious. My duck breast had crispy skin and meat that was tender and seasoned perfectly. My wife's shrimp and grits made her feel like she was back on Bourbon street and the boys' steaks were tender and perfectly grilled. The bar was well-stocked and with creative offerings from a skilled mixologist. We all agreed, this was a place that will see us again.

Really cool little spot. I'm in town for business and found this place through Yelp. Jake greeted me as soon as I came in and was also my server. Very friendly and attentive...thanks, Jake! The bartender, whose name I didn't catch was just as attentive.   Good selection of craft beers and even a few classic offerings, like Hamms. I ordered the Cuban Pickle Crisis sandwich, which had chopped pork and ham, tasted really great. I also had the tatie tots, which were more like hush puppies than the tots we all grew up with.   This is a cool spot that is definitely worth your time.

This is a great neighborhood restaurant.  They have one of the yummiest brunches I've ever had. I've been there for brunch, happy hour and dinner. The food is always great and the service is normally great too.

Mediocre service and food seems to be hit or miss. Our server was quite rude and lazy. Most of the staff hang out by the front of the kitchen chatting which isn't neccesarily bad, but when you are there with family it was hard to hear our conversation over the boisterous wait staff. Our food was ok at best. I had the ratatouille, which had potential...but was so over salted it was like eating spoonfuls of salt from the mortons container.  My daughter had the shrimp with grits, sauce and grits were good, but the shrimp was way over cooked and rubbery. Other daughter had hanger steak which was absolutely fantastic. Staff didn't seem to care that food wasn't satisfactory. Never saw a manager after telling server about the problems. Left 80% of my food uneaten....it was that bad. Won't be going back.

I just had lunch here for the first time and it was fantastic!  I had the cuban sandwich and it was stacked with pulled pork, ham, pickles and a wonderful zesty locally produced mustard.  I upgraded from fries to the tater tots which were stuffed with ham and cheese.  I would highly recommend Pig and Pickle to anyone wanting a good spot to eat.  Although I was there for lunch, I also saw they have a great selections of draft and bottled beers, as well as a great liquor selection.  The staff and proprietor are extremely friendly.  I will definitely be back!

If you feel like you are a pig yourself go ahead and eat there cuz they'll bring out the slop. When I ate there I felt like I was a pig and they brought slop for me to eat, it was nothing what I expected the people aren't that friendly except for the cashier in the manager. They have some weird twisted view of barbecue food that well, I can only describe as Upper Crust Scottsdale nouveau-riche which is nothing like I imagined it. If this is what rich people eat I don't want to be rich. An overall bad experience.

The best frois gras ... but don't ask me to spell it! Sat at the bar and started with a yummy Templeton rye drink Skot made us with orange zest on top.   Tyler, the bartender,  suggested the pork belly (delicious!!) Cheddar soup and then we had mussels with fennel. We even took the carrot cake home... OMG p & p you should sell rooms for rent for food coma. Thanks Tyler for such a great time - would recommend to anyone who appreciates food and good service. Always,   T&A

The Croque Madam and Tot of the day are an absolute MUST!!!!  Perfectly poached egg on top of ham with a fantastic Mornay sauce. You will not be disappointed! And the staff is all very friendly and fun to talk to.
Amazing service, amazing food, new favorite local joint. Ladidadida, yelp wants me to say more but all you need to know is this place is super legit.

Great sandwiches, better cocktails. A little pricey, but worth it for a good drink. The dim lighting is easy on the eyes. Perfect place to take someone for a laid-back date.  I love the apocalypse sow. It is definitely my go-to.

One of my favorite watering holes. Scot and Zack are great at the bar and give excellent choices. Some great food too. Try the bone marrow and take a whiskey pour through the salty bone. You will like it ;)

I ate here Sunday 8/4/2013  I've debated writing reviews and decided to go ahead and start, as I find many useful.  I want to give this a 3.5 but it's not an option.  I had porkbelly with heirloom tomatoes as an appetizer over boston bibb,  and Mussel with Creme fraiche and chorizo for the main coarse.  My waiter was a little out to lunch, however, the guy who brought the water was very attentive and checked in on me.  I wish he got the entire tip.  The food.  The tomatoes and dressing were awesome, the pork belly on it's own was decent but the tomato brought out the flavor.  It was like a fancy blt without the bread.  I like the chorizo because it seemed like it was locally sourced.  Not like the fatty chorizo at the buttcher shop in Charlotte.  The muscles seemed a tad overdone.  Overall, the combination was about $40 and the 3.5 rating reflects it was good, priced about right for what I would expect.  But  I wasn't wowed, which I want for any price point-  i.e. a $10 cubano for for lunch I'm trying to objectively compare it to the same price point and rate the flavor accordingly.  So it was good.  I may try them again on my visit as the ribeye infused with truffles sounds pretty good, but I hope to be impressed on a second visit.

Had the greatest experience at the pig and pickle! Was there a couple weeks back, my dad had heard about this place from a co-worker, he went with his employees and had the best experience so he had to take me there while I was visiting!  And what a treat it was!!! The service was outstanding, and the food was just phenomenal! We had the Brussels sprouts, pork shanks, BLT and raspberry vinegar pie. We left extremely full but that was only because we couldn't help but lick our plates clean! I would hands down recommend this restaurant! Oh and I can't forget the cilantragon margarita...if you like a drink with a kick you must try it!

Night owl alert: serving a late night menu that is really quite nice from 10pm-1am. So many major cities shut down the kitchens at 11, if not earlier. Great beer selection, they know how to curate a tap list even if it's not huge (plenty of bottles and cans to supplement and great taste on all fronts).  Five star service, laid back vibe, clean and comfortable.

He Who must Eat suggested we have brunch at P&P so he had the huevos rancheros I had the rainbow valley farmers cheese blintz... I loved mine but I really craved his! Tasty - rancheros, just right spice with the chorizo the eggs melded all together. So the bloody sconnie was blended to perfection - not too spicy but a good kick.  Not to mention the best service ever!!!

Service is bad, menu is a moving target, the have enough salt in every dish to make you swell up like sponge bob square pants, the service staff is rude, they don't understand boundaries or social cues and the vinegar pie could be good but it's a coin flip...so if that sounds like fun, give it a go

Went there twice during a recent visit to Scottsdale.  Food was delicious and very family friendly for an upscale restaurant.  They even gave our one year old a toy to play with!  Try the tots, they are amazing!  The house made charcuterie plate is great, and huge!  Plenty to share.  The beer and cocktail selection is also top notch!
Yelp is a swindle! You can ad every review you want they choose them for THEIR restaurants! Don't waste time with that site!

Have been here several times, mostly for happy hour. Lots of fun cocktails, a great craft beer selection. Happy hour specials. Very creative with flavors/textures. Especially like the chicken with curry dipping sauce, the charcuterie board which comes with meats they cure/make in house and pickles they also make in house. Lots of picked things on the board and delicious breads. Had a carrot soup there recently that was delicous. Very much like the liver smear on toast. It would be fun to have a table with my name on it if my work schedule allowed me more happy hours...the artwork is very fun and they sell it, also prints. They have special beer dinners that I haven't been to yet but look like fun. Love the dump truck salad, creative use of cauliflower.
Very unique place, all of the food on the menu is very original and something that blends well and is very good.

I have never left a review on yelp until now because I have never eaten at a place that blew my mind the way Pig & Pickle has. I have lived in Phoenix since 2004 and this place is hands down the best place in Arizona I have ever eaten. My husband and I were here for the late night menu after seeing a show at Pub Rock. Pickled things was delicious. We also had the buffalo pork shanks, awesome! We shared the burger and it has to be one of the best burgers I have ever tasted. Their chocolate chip cookie nutella ice cream thing was fabulous. I plan on coming back plenty of times.

I thought the four star average that I saw ahead of time was fair, though I would give it 3.5 stars.  It met my expectations.  There were some great things that were awesome and there were some good ideas that were slight misses.    Several of us were stopping through the area after a spring training game.  Several had the sow burger. I had the pork belly BLT.  The sandwiches were huge.  The tator tots were a fun thing.  Everyone had a pretty good meal.  I was surprised at their beer selection - they give the impression that they are really into beer but the taps were a bit disappointing.    The pickles were unique, but I didn't really think they were good.  I really thought they should have been much more significant given the inclusion in the name.
You must come here for Sunday Brunch. Everything we had today was mind blowing!

Awesome food, brunch on Sundays is the best around, and they have a special waffle every Sunday!  The pork belly is spot on, and so is the hanger steak. Great prices for especially for the quality of food.   The service is top notch too!
Very tastey meal.  The Nancy sandwich is awesome an so is the Pork Belly.  Sevice is prompt and attentive.

I was a first timer here for dinner and was less than thrilled with the service and flavor and texture of the food. We were generally left to our own devices, which is fine because this was a new restaurant and  they were busy and understaffed. The waiter attempted to make up for it by making small take, asking if I got the reference to the name of one of their 'hipsterfied' cocktails; but it was an awkwardly failed attempt. There was an audible and obvious miscommunication concerning our appetizers. We were seating next to order pick up, and our waiter called the chef 'such a fuckin bitch.' Working in a career where others determine your outcome can be frustrating, but really bruh? A fucking bitch in front of the customers and babies??? He apologized to the chef, who also declined his apology. The food was 'hipstered' up...cool name/description, lack of depth of flavor and odd textures. We orders the 'fried' Brussel sprouts and added bacon. The Brussels sprouts were clearly pan seared and the bacon was the only flavor. Our pork belly came out 40 min later, and the texture was odd. It was accompanied by collard greens that were very acidic and surprisingly delicious pomegranate seeds. The pomegranate seeds were the best thing we ate here. For my main course, I had the shrimp and grits. The shrimp were nice sized, but over cooked and chewy. The grits were hidden under some orange broth and they absorbed the liquid and became very wet. The andouille sausage was overlooked and hard. Atmosphere could be fun, but not worth returning to.
Amazing happy hour. I love how this place gives such a great farm to table vibe. I'm not a huge meat eater, but surprisingly the bone marrow appetizer was quite delicious.

The only reason for 4 stars versus 5 is the atmosphere. It's not bad, just not anything fabulous.  However, now that we have that out of the way, let's discuss what's really important here.. the food. The food is AMAZING. We began our meal with the pork belly appetizer. WOW.  Pork belly cooked to perfection, resting on top of mashed parsnips with an beautiful apple butter, with sliced apple, almonds, and frise. UNREAL. Was sad when the plate was licked clean, and there was no more. Moved next to the entrees. I had the duck leg, on the yam and faro risotto with blueberries gastric, while my fiance had the pot roast sandwich with havarti, onions, and an add on of more pork belly, and the mac and cheese tator tots. Let's start with mine..the duck. Absolute perfection on every level. The duck did not die in vain, I'll tell you that. Each bite better than the next, until my plate was empty, and my stomach was full. The pot roast sandwich was so enormous, and delicious, my fiance struggled to finish it... and lost the battle.. I've never ever seen this before. EVER. Incredibly sophisticated, yet completely approachable dishes, for no where near what you'd expect to pay for quality like this. Our hats off to the chefs.  These men know their meats, and what to pair with that perfectly cooked meat, to make your dinner an incredible experience. BRAVO Pig & Pickle. We will be back. at $65 for an appetizer, two entrees, and quite a few drinks, this was money very well spent. Oh, and I'd be remiss not to mention, our waiter was absolutely terrific. He was very knowledgeable about the menu, and super helpful helping us choose between the many options that had us stuck on which way to go.   Don't hesitate. Go. Enjoy. Eat the Pig....and a Pickle.

The pork tostada came highly recommended by the manager. Turned out to be pretty soggy and bland. I still see decent menu potential. I have high hopes, I will visit again to see if they deliver on the next try.

Over-priced....you pay $11 for a 1/2 lb burger (which sounds super satisfying) and you get a burger on a  plate with little toppings and no fries.  It was not an $11 meal.  Drinks were good but the food is not really much to write home about.

Every pork dish here is amazing, but there are a lot of vegetarian dishes as well like the shepherd's beany pie and and the nancy sammie. The prices are very fair as well this place is going to do really well!
This place is awesome. Love the creative/unique drinks and the food is always good. If you are a bacon fan- this place is a must!!!

Amazing food & great location. Would recommend this place for brunch, lunch or dinner! Everything is homemade and tastes just perfect. The service is fast, friendly and we got some great recommendations. Our servers name was Eric. I'll definitely come back here if I ever find myself in Scottsdale again.
Amazing food and ambience, can't wait to make this a regular experience!
Very good. A lil Ma's day brunch. Buffet style goodness. Bloody Mary yes please. Not the normal routine. I am very pleased can't wait to have some more.
The crispy skin trout was awesome. I'd come back for that. Comes with a potato pancake and green beans.  Added on a side of pork belly. Yummmmmm.

Never coming back. Our monthly supper club decided to meet here for my birthday celebration. Twelve of us came to have a good time and order lots of drinks and food. My wonderful friends brought cupcakes to celebrate and when we brought them out they told us that we couldn't have them and that they would have to charge us $4 a cupcake to bring them in the back, add a scoop of ice cream and bring them back out to us. The problem wasn't so much that they wouldn't allow us to have them, the problem came when my husband tried to reason with the manager and he was a complete $@#. The manager literally said he had to charge us and serve them to us because it was a health code violation. Ummmmm, pretty sure you manhandling my cupcakes and adding ice cream to it has NOTHING to do with health code violations. That sad, pathetic excuse was all we needed to seal the deal.  Needless to say we said thanks but no thanks and ate them in the parking lot. Sad for them because we would have ordered a few more round of drinks and spent a lot more than $4 a cupcake! Our supper club will never come back and we would recommend to anyone celebrating a special day NOT to show up here. Ridiculous!

I love this place for the unique foods and friendly wait staff and bar tenders. I keep going back to my Monsier Coque  (sp) since it is my late night over indulged food with chicken pot pie tatter tots. YUM.  I have tried a few other things like the steak salad and udong noodles are very tasty and really worth sharing.  I love music which is only Friday nights. Unfortunately the room with concrete floors make a little hard to hear at the tables. Maybe just the guitar without the drums could be a suggestion   Otherwise this is must go!!

What a great place. The food was delicious. I had the slow cooked pork sandwich and fries, which was a very yummy dish. The table had the pork belly appetizer with the heirloom tomatoes and bib lettuce, as well as the foie gras. I had never had foie gras paired with strawberries, but it was an amazing compliment. But truly the best part of the meal was the service. We let them know in advance that we were bringing in a couple to celebrate a special occasion, and they went out of their way to make that couple feel special. We will definitely be back!

My finacee and I went here one night to celebrate a promotion. We didn't even make it off the starter menu (we had 5 items from it) and we were blown away! Every item is crafted with care.   In addition to the excellent food, we had very nice drinks. The bartenders and staff were very warm and truly seem to care about their establishment.  We are planning on hosting our rehearsal dinner for our wedding here now as well.

We were visiting some friends in Phoenix and went out as a group to Pig & Pickle for dinner. The place was great and the food was also very good. Because we had a larger group we all got to try bites of a lot of different dishes. All of the dishes I tried were great and some were very unique as well. None of the dishes blew me away but I could definitely suggest Pig & Pickle for a great meal.

Pig & Pickle is a great new restaurant! My husband and I stopped here before heading to a concert and we could not have picked a better spot.   We sat at the bar and Jen, our bartender, was amazing. She let me sample several of the happy hour draft beers before deciding on a pilsner while my husband chose a Mexican beer off of the canned beer list. We loved the variety of beer choices, you aren't going to find Bud Light here but you'll be happy with the alternatives!   We started with the beer cheese app served with a variety of fresh baked breads which was outstanding. The tot of the day was pancetta(?), cheese and jalapeño and my husband loved these. For my dinner I ordered the vegan burger with the dump truck salad and both were delicious. Vegan burgers are hard to do but P & P got this right! My husband had the pot roast sandwich with French fries which were fantastic & he raved about the sandwich.   We loved the atmosphere-open kitchen, lots of light shining in, pig figurines everywhere, if you get the chance, GO!

Wife and I drove up from Tucson to visit a friend. Being we had time to kill and hungry we decided to try something new. Pig and Pickle came up and had great reviews so we decided to give it a shot.  Pulled into the strip mall it's located in and walked in. We were promptly greeted and seated by the hostess, she had a pleasant attitude but the clothes she wore reminded me of a Marilyn Manson video which didn't fit the ambiance of the restaurant.    Waters came to our table quick while we perused the lunch menu. Offerings seemed hifalutin, and a little on the high side for what you get. Read the menu thoroughly and the only thing that sounded good was the P & P Club, so my wife and I ordered one a piece and upgraded to the tots, the bartender/server highly recommended, so we took her advice.   Food came out in a decent amount of time. First glance the presentation was nice. So here goes nothing,  picked up a half of the sandwhich and took a bite, had a fishy taste but none the less ok at best. On to the tots, which I really looked forward to. Took a bite and I went from excited to extremely disappointed, they were extremely bland, tasted like breaded fried mashed potatoes. Ok next thing on the plate was the pickle, the place has pickle in their name so I thought it would be a no brainer and would be the best part of the meal and again was disappointed,  tasted like a under fermented pickle dunked in Apple cider vinegar,  not impressed at all.    We had to wait a bit for our check due to our server tending bar as well. All in all it has a nice interior and is capable of a lot.  But in the end we were highly disappointed at the food we received,  especially for the prices they are asking. If you should go I highly recommend you ask for an onion sandwich with their bread because out of the whole meal those were the 2 best ingredients in our meals. Needless to say we came, we saw, we left disappointed.

Unbelievable! Easily the best and most well rounded bar I accidentally been to. Reasonably priced, top notch service. I haven't had the food but I imagine it's life changing. Strange location but extremely convenient, right off the 101.

Perfect place for beer snobs! I was a bit intimidated by the menu, but the waitress was knowledgeable and helped me choose something my picky, vegetable loving self would eat. P.S. The art on the walls is on point!
My Sow Burger was AMAZING ... The best burger I have ever had !!! and the dump salad was very nice ... We also had the Cuban Pickle Crises ..!! lol taste is as inventive as the name ...

So hit and miss.  Happy hour drinks barely have any booze. Our server was horrible, our neighbor's was great.  The flank steak is fantastic.  The pot roast sandwich is just ok. Garbage salad is just ok as well.  I expected more. Maybe just a bad night.

Exquisite menu made from food that is all grown local. Excellent service, extensive local beer selection. Ever-changing menu based on what is locally available and in season, and unique flavor combinations. Everyone will love it on the first try. My friend and I keep bringing our friends and everyone we bring is blown away by the food, and loves it their first time.

Food/drinks/staff/music on Friday night were great and worth 5 stars. Only subtracted a star based on location. This place is too good to be in a strip mall with its patio beside a busy road. To the food... Pork belly and gator bites were excellent but a little over priced at $12 a pop. Hanger steak was great and cooked to a perfect medium rare. Great drink selection and if ordering dessert make sure to get the seared carrot cake. Mississippi mud pie was good too but carrot cake was GREAT.

I really like this place.  They have new, interesting concept dishes and everything Ive tried has been really, really good.  The bartenders (who I think may be owners too) were super personable, and when they asked my friend and I to come back for dessert after the event we were going to, we did.   I hope this place does insanely well and stays open a long time.
I have only been here once, which really is a shame. If I lived closer I would be there all the time! Great food, great service. It doesn't get much better.

Celebrated a birthday there on Thursday and everything was awesome! From the moment I made the reservation to the moment we left, they reserved an awesome part of the patio! Our drinks were always filled and the food was amazing! Thank you so much for a wonderful time!! The k9 guest enjoyed his treats thoroughly as well. Have always loved pig and pickle and now will be a lifetime fan! :)

First and foremost I have been here many times and it wasn't until now I have felt compelled to write a review. To sum it up in one word...awesome.  Secondly, each time I have been here the food has been delicious, and that's a huge understatement. The food is very unique and the flavored are amazing and mesh well. They have these items called Tots which are filled with something new daily, one time it was this pineapple mixed with something exquisite served with a dipping sauce (this time was nacho cheese dipping sauce.)  Side note, try the seared carrot cake with bacon on top, only if you want the best thing you have ever indulged on in your life. The food alone deserves five stars but I will not end there.   Lastly, the service is beyond five star. Every time, no exaggeration, every time I have been here the service is amazing. Unbelievably helpful staff, very accommodating and knowledgeable about their food. I brought my dog on the most recent visit (Great Dane/Lab mix) which is a large dog, and the staff was very welcoming of him. From feeding him homemade dog treats to moving heaters around to ensure our comfortability.  All in all one of my favorite places to visit in Scottsdale.  I just stumbled upon this amazing place one night and now I frequently cost because it's as close to perfect as perfect can get.

What a great surprise, the menu is great and lots of fun drinks.  Order the grilled brussels sprouts - even if you don't like them you will.  The shrimp and grits held up to New Orleans standards.  Large servings and great service.  Can't wait to eat my leftovers.
Don't get it. For a carne-based gastropub, the best menu item was our salad (which was much too large... over-compensating?).  Everything else was quite forgetable. Much better food at Salty Sow.

We decided to try out this spot since it is close to our house and we drive past it all the time.  Not really knowing what to expect...the menu was a nightmare. When you look at it and try to read it, you feel like its a completely different language.  There are no descriptions or pictures to even help you out.  Basically this is a place for people who like to eat every single part of a pig...including belly and bone marrow.  Just a little too different for us. We tried a few things but the only thing we ended up liking was just plain old macaroni and cheese and tater tots. If you like Guinness beer then you will want to try the Nitro Milk Stout...it was delicious. We can't see ourselves ever going here again.
First timer.  Saw it on Yelp.  Gave it a go.  Got small salad + pork belly ribs alternative.  They tasted ok.  Stringy.... not a 4 star imo.
Another great Yelp recommendation. Dump Truck and Udon (delightfully spicy). Don't get a second Mai Tai if you plans post lunch.
Food is amazing! Wait staff is hit or miss, some are really nice some are kinda snobby. Decent drinks too.

This little joint boats a surprisingly good menu for an unexpected location. Great craft beer menu with good food to follow!  Since I'm a vegetarian I have to put the disclaimer out that it isn't your most friendly spot for the non meat eater. However, they do have an absolutely amazing vegetarian polenta pie. I mean this dish is seriously wonderful. The polenta is creamy and the baked vegetables are perfect with raisins added for a surprising sweetness. The shrimp and grits are equally fantastic if you partake in seafood and the meat dishes all sounded creative.   Don't be taken aback by the unexpected location, pig and pickle is a must try. Next time I plan on trying a dessert. The four stars is mostly due to that not all dishes are created equal and you may be more satisfied with one than another. Our service was very good except that it took longer than I'd prefer after our meal to receive the check. I have to be nit picky for my five stars.
This place is pretty damn good ... Definitely have to try the tots so so good . You definitely won't be disappointed ;)

Food is good. Definitely a lot of pig. I'm not huge on bacon, but I know most people are. However, they do some unique dishes that have been tasty. The prices are a bit high, but this is some nice dining even though it is in a strip mall. You feel like you're downtown when in this place. The menu does change sometimes, but never had anything bad here. They also got a nice small bar set up if you just want to grab a drink. I'm sure I'll keep going back.

First time here. We originally order take out but decide to eat it here when we arrived. The place is cute. Food was great. Our service sucked. This girl had a sour attitude and really ruined our experience. She had no personality or manners to be in the customer service industry AT ALL! Did even tell us bye have a nice day.
What a great experience! Food and staff were better than amazing! Can't wait to go back!!!! Thx guys!!

I am a Scottsdale native and Pig is easily my favorite restaurant in the Valley. From the amazing owners (Clayton is one of the best guys to exist) to my favorite bartenders in Scottsdale (Skot and Tyler will become yours too just in one night) to the heavenly food (pork shanks) P&P should be your favorite too. One of the only restaurants to be open super late, Pig is home to a regular crowd of industry people which should say something when a bunch of servers and bartenders want to hang out there after a hellish shift. I promise if you go there once it will become one of your favorites over night.

We have lived near Pig and Pickle for awhile and never went in thinking it was barbecue. Oh, how I regret not checking them out sooner.  This is, by far, the best restaurant meal I've had in years. Inventive, different, beautiful presentation and absolutely delicious food.  The chicharrones are amazing and the pork liver schmear was delicious. Crispy skinned trout - oh my goodness. Every bite was a mouth-watering delight.  Shrimp and grits had the perfect heat and loads of shrimp.  My husband loved his bacon burger with havarti and said it was perfectly cooked.  And desert was strawberry vinegar pie. Sounds weird, tastes wonderful.  This will be our new neighborhood favorite!   If you like inventive food with a twist you must try Pig and Pickle.

Pig & Pickle is a must try! The food is original and top notch. They have some menu items that are on the exotic side, such as the bone marrow, and for the less adventurous items as simple as burgers. I have ordered menu items on both ends of the spectrum and was equally impressed with them. The Steaks I have tried have been perfectly cooked and seasoned and even the greens they are served with are fancy and delicious. I ordered the burger on another occasion and would say that it was one of the better burgers I've had in the city. The fried egg on top of the burger really hit the spot. Pig & Pickle has been busy every time I've been there and has great ambiance, great service, and most importantly great food.

Let me start by saying that my husband and I have been big fans of Pig & Pickle for quite a while now. The food is always delicious and we love how they change things up from time to time. I would normally give this restaurant 5 stars. However, our last few visits have been for a night cap and dessert, ordered at the bar, and a specific bartender (whose name we do not know, but he has shoulder-length blonde hair), has been so condescending, sarcastic and almost rude to us the last two times we have been there, that I doubt we will ever be back. It's sad because this was one of our favorite and go-to places, but this one bartender has ruined it for us. The management at Pig & Pickle needs to recognize when one of their staff is treating customers with disrespect, especially customers who frequent regularly.

Let start with the fact that if I could I'd give 3.5 stars but since I cannot, I have to go with 3 as it defiantly wasn't a 4 star experience. Came here last night for a birthday dinner. We were in their private room which was actually quite large and very nice to be able to have everyone at one large table. We had one waiter, Anthony, who was on point- constantly filling up glasses, bringing extra things we needed right away, and giving great dessert recommendations. I knocked off 2 stars because I was completely underwhelmed with the food I ordered. We started with the beef marrow and crostini and it was very tasty; first time having it and won't be my last. However I ordered the 'apocalypse sow' burger and it was a bad combination of flavors. Essentially it was a pork, sausage flavored, patty with sambal aioli, wwaaaaayyy to sharp white cheddar, some lettuce, and three strips of bacon. All the flavors were competing with each other too much and created an overall unpleasant flavor. I wasn't the only one who felt this way either, 3 other guest ordered the same thing and didn't enjoy it. We got the seared carrot cake and bread pudding to share with everyone for dessert, the bread pudding was Anthony's recommendation. The carrot cake was seriously lacking in the carrot flavor department but the whipped goat cheese frosting on top was okay. Surprisingly, the bread pudding was probably the stand out as the best thing I tried there last night.  I will go back to try their happy hour or late night menus but I most likely won't be dinning off their dinner menu again. Overall- Service-5 Decor/Space-5 Price-4 Food-3
What a place. Get the Brussel sprouts app with pork belly. Amazing. The shrimp plate was great as well. Nice spot In an usual location (strip mall)
Food was great but the dinning room was not inviting and the staff was not that inviting either.  Go there for the food not the experience.

Ate here with friends who suggested it during our visit to Scottsdale, so glad they did, everything was amazing. We started with the charcuterie plate with an awesome selection of house made items, loved it!! Next was the pork belly with apple butter and creamy radish purée= piggy heaven! The four of us then shared 3 entrees. Lamb chop with perfect char with med-rare center. Tri-tip with polenta cakes and a rich and delicious bleu cheese sauce. And my favorite, the Duck with picked mustard seed sauce and a wonderful, nutty tasting millet risotto! Yum!!  Our service was great, knowledgeable and welcoming. The owner, who was expoing at the line right next to our table came over a few times and talked with us. We left happy and full and for 4 people and over 6 dishes and drinks only spent $150. For those complaining about price, get real! Love this place and will look forward to coming back next time I'm in town.

I had an early dinner here on 8/21. It was awesome. There was really fun music at a level that I could hear, but it didn't overwhelm me. There are televisions going, but I kept forgetting they were there. The staff is super friendly without me wanting to puke, and they are really knowledgable about the food. It's good to see that the people who work there, eat there. Really good sign.   However, I hope that they don't eat there every day. The food is so rich! I'm going to make this a once a month stop. I'll get as big as a house if I try that.   The beer? INCREDIBLE. If they have the Yeti- drink it.   The food? Shut your whore mouth. It was SO good. They asked me if I had room for more, and I shed a single tear while asking for the check.

Wow! This place was awesome. Drinks were so well crated and delicious. We had the 'William Joel', barrel aged drink. My husband and I didn't have dinner here but the dinner looked promising and if the dinner was anything like the prom shoulder appetizer we tried then I'm sure it would be good too. Definitely will return to this place when we are in the area. Also forgot to mention the very creative and tasty strawberry chocolate Rice Krispie cake, yum!'
Love the tostadas!!! Yummy! The tots are my favorities, there are new ones every day. Also the drinks are amazing

Pig and Pickle! Before I dined in, I thought hmm...what a unique name for a restaurant! However after eating their one of a kind dish called, buffalo pork shank I was sold on the place!!!! The pork shank was packed with flavor as well as a nice spicy buffalo sauce that kept you licking your fingers for more!   My girlfriend and I went for their late night menu and was blown away by their menu for "happy hour"! We will definitely come back and try a new dish to rave about! Last but not least try the DUCK fat fries!!!!! They're delicious!!!!

I don't think I even know where to start.  The staff was excellent and the food even better.  I had bone marrow for the first time....but definitely not the last.  This will definitely be somewhere I will frequent.  Porchetta was the bomb!
These little piggies waddled all the way home...only after savoring the pork tostadas, shrimp and grits, apocalypse sow,  and "the nancy". Try the tots too. Holy pig! This place is good!
Great service! 'Okay' food... Bacon is bomb! But the pork burgers are gross and I hate the pickles.
My bf and I are here on a weekly basis. Always good food and service. We love that there are always new thing to try on the menu, and course the tots!

This place. THIS. PLACE. So good. Casual atmosphere, live music on occasion, excellent liquor/beer/wine selection of unique options (don't expect to order the usual Jack/Jim/Goose here! Embrace the chance to try something new- we've had some great finds here!), the specialty cocktail list is probably one of my favorites, the whole place has a great laid back feel, with local artist's work on the walls (for sale! Cool of them to support the local artists!). Staff is always personable, funny, and very knowledgeable- chatting with them is part of the fun experience for us when we go there (we always end up with the tall guy with the tattoos- love him!!!). Appreciate that the menu always has new things to try, and every item we've ever had is great- such good flavor and unique combinations in each menu item. Try the tasso, and the pork carnitas! It's nice that they have some vegetarian options, too- the entire menu is a good variety, something for every (adult) palate! Don't leave without ordering dessert- the vinegar pie is to die for (just try it!!).
This place is fantastic, fresh food w/ excellent service and outstanding drinks. Nothing else needs to be said...

The food was good. The beers are pretty overpriced. Our server was suuuuuper weird and acted like I was dumb when I asked him where something came from (everything is locally made or made in house, so I just wanted to know which of the two). Luckily my friend and I don't care and just thought it was funny. I'd go back, hoping I didn't get the same server. I've had other friends that have had awful experiences and refuse to come here, but I'd try it again. The beers are pretty overpriced though.

Met a friend for dinner here about a week ago. Wasn't sure what to expect food/atmosphere wise. It is much more of a casual vibe but the food is definitely not your average bar food. I was pleasantly surprised with the trout dinner. It had this brown sugar butter sauce and once I tasted that with trout and fingerling potatoes... I was a fan! Dessert was great. Great atmosphere and food.

The food was very good. I ordered the pot roast sandwich and my sister had the vegan burger. The ambiance in the restaurant was good.  The server not so much!  He was very slow getting our order and had major attitude.

This place really delivered a great mix of excellent flavors on a wide variety of dishes, but I want to highlight the crispy skin trout dish.   A ton of great flavors, the almonds, the brown butter and crunch of the green beans.  Skin was exceptional.  I'll admit they called my bluff, as I was thrown off by seeing this on the menu.   Duck breast was really tasty too (w/ the cherries, feta, wild rice, etc.)  A good, thoughtful beer menu, and a waitstaff and bar that knows the beer they are serving.

Pretty sure I've never seen a menu that is so unique, diverse, while being delicious. Do not go here expecting your "run-of-the-mill" menu. It's all a new experience, and a delicious one. A lot of care and thought has gone into the menu, however, if the standard "meat and potatoes" is your thing, you should probably hit McDonald's. The tots are not really tots and change every day. It's always a treat to go to the Pig & Pickle.

If you want to lose weight eat here. One bite and your done. All the other reviews are friends and family... has to be. Too over priced, for low quality grub. My fries were cold, my burger way under cooked. The best part of my meal was the beer. First time I was so unhappy with a place I actually posted to warn others. Plus no happy hour?

This place is amazing the ambiance is really laid back the drinks are really good and strong! The pork belly is sooo good it's cooked perfect!! The shrimp and grits with homemade sausage and slices of pork belly soooo good!! We will definitely come here again our waiter was very nice as well!

My wife and I brought our dog because of all the amazing things we had heard about the dog friendly patio here at pig and pickle. They did not disappoint! Before we were even able to ask, the server brought out a water dish for our dog and a surprise dog treat! On top of that the food here is amazing, I highly recommend the Cuban missile crisis. Will definitely be coming back to try more of this amazing looking menu and treat our dog to some more of their homemade doggy biscuits.

Met a group here for dinner, expecting to try the vegan burger but opting instead for the vegetarian chili. The "vegetarian chili" arrived in an enormous bowl (think mini crockpot) and consisted of a thick layer of cheddar cheese, mixture of mashed potatoes, scallions, and more cheese, with a light layer of pinto beans on the bottom. This combination was every bit as delicious as it sounds, but I was floored that anyone would attempt to pass this dish off as "chili." Whatever the name of the dish, I was delighted with the 1/4 of it that I was able to finish!   We also ordered the Tots as an appetizer and they were absolutely delicious. Everyone in the group enjoyed their meals; there were nothing but positive remarks all around. As the name of the restaurant implies, this is the place to go if you're in the mood for comfort food. I think everyone we were there with would agree that this place counts as an indulgence.   Definitely go.

We came here around 10.30pm on a Sunday night after a 7 hour hike in the Grand Canyon.  We read good reviews about it and to be honest it was one of the few, if not the only pretty good reviewed place open at that time of the night. The plaza itself was empty and when we arrived the restaurant/bar only had a few people in it.  We liked the whole pig theme, it was well put together.  We were welcome promptly and advised we could sit wherever we wanted.  Unfortunately we just missed the regular menu cut off, as after 10pm they serve a much smaller late night menu, which we were a little disappointed about.  We ended up ordering the bone marrow, fries, lettuce wraps with kalbi beef, pork burger and sweet and chilli chicken wings.  Although we noticed only 1 person in the open kitchen, the food came out quickly.  The bone marrow was ok, normally I love it, but this was a little too oily for my liking.  The chicken wings were good, hubby finished them all. The burger patty was a little dry.  The lettuce wraps were pretty good.  The fries were good too.  It was pretty much just pub grub, nothing out of the ordinary although they make a mean Old Fashion! Overall we weren't particularly satisfied, it was ok, given we had such as a full on tiring day we thought everything would taste good but we were a little disappointed.   Unlikely we would go back but if we did we'd hope to try the food from the main menu.  The service was great, we can't complain about that.
A date restaurant for that steady partner.  The foods good, good service, drinks are awesome.   My girlfriend love's this place.

Holy foodgasm!  That's a direct quote from dinner here with my friends last week.  We went on a Friday, which I would NOT recommend; the was quite a long wait to get seated.  Service was good, but a little blatantly one sided.  Maybe the server could actually address then entire table, and not just the hot chick....not so subtle my friend, I'm just sayin.    The food here was good.  They didn't reinvent the wheel, or even try to. The menu is a random assortment of someone's favorite foods, each one seemingly executed well.  There is a note on the menu that substitutions will be politefully declined.  I was concerned about this, as with my food allergies, eating out can be tricky.  They were more than willing to serve me a custom grind burger sans bun, with extra lettuce for wrapping.  It came out deconstructed on the plate, with a bowl of fries.  I was disappointed at first that I wasn't offered any dipping options for my fries, but once I tasted them, I understood why.  These fries were excellent. They stood alone, and anything to dip them in would have been an injustice.  Then I tasted my burger. One of my friends also had a burger with the bun and 2 hilariously large tots, and the other had a vegetable casserole? (If I remember correctly). There was a collective silence at the table as we all had our first bite, and stared at each other in disbelief.  No one could believe how simplistically good the food was, and the fact that we all thought so, that's an almost impossible feat.  As a group. We rarely agree on anything food related.    I think the drinks were overhyped a bit.  I had a Moscow mule, which was ok, but not exceptional by any means.  The waiter helped my friend select a beer which she seemed to enjoy.  This place is more Scottsdale than I expected, but that wouldn't stop me from returning; I'd just pick a different night to avoid the wait.

My husband and I heard great things about Pig & Pickle but we were not impressed by the food. The place has a great atmosphere and is nicely decorated. I loved that the kitchen was somewhat open. The staff members were all great, but again the food we were not impressed with. I ordered the brie sandwich- it was not warmed up and there was a LOT of brie. Now I like brie, don't get me wrong, but it was way too much. I thought it would be warmed up at least. I will say that the salad I had was fresh, so this was a plus! My husband got sandwich which he felt was ok. He also got a side of the "tots" which we both were not impressed by. Cool idea to use mashed potatoes but it was very paste like and just not good.

This the first time my wife and i had been here, we really enjoyed the food. I had the mussels in white wine, herbs & tomato with crème fraiche and my wife had pork shoulder tostadas, we were pleased with how the food tasted and the prices are not to bad, only thing is it took a little longer then usual to get our food even with little customers there.

Was excited to check this place out since it seemed rather unique for the area, but the run of the mill food could not save the poor service. This place definitely reminds me of a person who thinks that they are wayyyyy hotter than they really are.   Food was a 3, service and overall experience was a 1, so landed on a 2 rating. Would not recommend. Full review below -   Earlier in the week, my wife called to ask a question about our reservation. She was promptly told we didn't have one (we did) and was hung up on. Delightful. Should have been red flag #1.  When we walked in and the hostess seated our party (spoiler - the reservation we actually had), the atmosphere and I really enjoyed the modified wine bottles that were used as drinking glasses.  Drinks - Beer list was solid and definitely above average for the area. I settled on Dogfish's Festina Peche which seemed refreshing given the recent heat/humidity combo. Going rate for the beer was $7. When it came back from the bar, I noticed that I received it in a beer snifter glass which holds about 10oz. Looked around and noticed that other people in my party had the same pour. Now, I have no problem paying (and have more than I should) $7, $10, $12 for a 10oz pour of a higher alcohol by volume or rare seasonal beer. But $7 for a 10oz (really 8oz since mine was short poured and spilled on the table) fairly standard seasonal that has an ABV of 4.5%? The blatant money grab on the drinks is not a good look.  Food - As happy hour was ending, I decided to order the Chef's Charcuterie board. This was easily the best thing I had. Seemed like an assortment of pickled veggies and an egg with bread, jam and 3 kinds of meat. I can't tell you exactly what was on the board because the waiter just dropped it off in front of me with zero explanation and walked away. For the main course, there really wasn't anything innovative or unique on the menu, so I settled on the pot roast because I was craving it for some reason. Tots were easily the best thing on the plate. Pot roast was kinda bland, definitely needed salt. Aioli didn't really add much and didn't really make all that much sense from a flavor profile in my opinion.  A group of us (11) try a new place every month. This month happened to fall on a birthday. So, we brought some cupcakes as is the tradition. Waiter tells us that in order to serve them in the restaurant, we have to pay $4 a head. When we protest to the manager, he tells us it is a health code violation. So...it's a food safety risk unless we pay you $4 a head? Word of advice, the money grab is bad for business. 11 people who had been there for 2 hours now will not order another $7-12 drink ($77 is more than $44, shocking I know) and will leave with a bad feeling about your place. Not smart.  Overall, food is ok, service is bad, drink situation will make you feel like you need a shower. Spend your time and money somewhere else and thank me later. Perhaps over a normal sized beer?

We had a rehearsal dinner here at the end of March for our son and his fiancee. It was a little nerve-wracking because we live in Portland OR and made all the plans long-distance. As soon as we got into town for the wedding and walked in the door, we knew it was going to be great. Turned out there were about 35 of us and it went really well. The food was amazing and everyone at the restaurant was very helpful and accommodating, especially Chris who set everything up. We'll definitely be back next time we are in the Phoenix area visiting our newlyweds.

This Place is Ahhh Mazing. The successfully bring upper end bistro style food down to a price point where the average person could eat there weekly. Great atmosphere, nice service, and accomplished Chefs make for a place that is easily one of the best eateries I have been to period.

I came here with a group of friends to send off one of our friends back home. I've been told that everything here was fantastic. Food drinks and character. Well all of that was beyond FALSE. I was very disappointed with everything that came with this restaurant. The food sucked. I had the some Daddy burger which was disgusting( don't know the name because the menu was cut off). Not fully cooked with the cow still kicking inside of it. Anthony our server was HORRIBLE. Took him 20 mins to just fill up my water. 45 mins for my food to come out when there is nobody here. Just the worse food and worse experience I've had with a restaurant in my lifetime.
Delicious!  Duck, Duck, Pig and Apocalypse Sow were out of this world with flavors!  The Mai Tais were the best we've had outside of Maui! Cool decor and friendly staff.

Thought this place quite pretentious and overpriced. Went in on a whim, not having heard anything about it. Difficult to interpret the menu, guess we weren't sophisticated enough.  The wait staff seemed insulted when ask to discribe the offerings. Had the tapas which were average, broccoli cheese soup which was more like potato soup and mussles and clams with chorizo in creme fraiche. The portion was large but odd juxtaposition of flavors was only initially interesting and half the serving was left on the table. Add one draft and one bottle of beer and the tab was over $60. We won't be back and won't recommend

This place is amazing. One of the few places in the valley that I will drive 15 miles to spend money on amazing food and drinks. As a foodie I cannot get enough. Bone marrow, amazing. Pork shanks, amazing. Fried Brussels, duck fries, pork tostadas, I can keep going. I'll spend 50$ on food and still want to order more, and I don't have a lot of money.  In a nutshell, this place is the tits. Shout to the late night guys, they're awesome.

Absolutely love this place!! I have always had awesome service and my food has always been on point. Such a great little jem!  Love that it's open late and serves food late. Great for a date or just to go grab some drinks and good food! I highly recommend the duck fat fries :)
Had a chance to chat with one of the owners -- super nice guy.  Food was delicious and appropriately priced.  Only con: would have liked bigger selection.

Decided to eat here for lunch after a long bike ride. Immediately I knew something was wrong when the waiter stated that they were "out of chicken". Steak was ordered medium, came out with COLD center. Wouldn't even qualify for rare. Another party member ordered a sandwich, had extremely soggy bread. Yet another problem with the peanut and noodle dish--was essentially a soup-like mess.   Waited 10 minutes for check. Will never visit again.   Bottom line: EXTREMELY overpriced, subpar food, and snooty service.
Delicious pork shoulder tostadas!! Cocktails were unique and yummy. Pretzel chicken was verrrrry tasty too! Will definitely be back!!

Decent service but the food is not so good. Was expecting something different than designer pork that's difficult to chew and even more difficult to choke down.   Even the vegetarian sandwich my friend ordered was hard to swallow because of the tough grilled bread.

I don't have a lot of reviews but I've eaten A LOT fantastic food. I had literally one of the best meals I've had in a long time and amongst a lot of trendy foodie oriented places. dump truck salad + charcuterie + bahn mi+ seared carrot cake= heaven! everything was great but the carrot cake is not just the best dessert I've ever had but a fantastic dish sweet or savory . oh did I say the service was perfect?

Amazing food amazing service lovely craft beer options we will be back every time we are in Scottsdale. Kudos to you guys you are doing it right  As a side note we had the  shredded pork tostada added pork belly smoked salmon  brussel sprouts  pot roast sandwich  Friday night fish fry  Nancy sandwich  burger  and several beers all of which was amazing

I had another restaurant cancel on me last minute, but Pig & Pickle came to my rescue. I was able to bring in 8 staff members for a team meeting, utilize our projector for presentations, AND feed everyone a delicious meal. The food was amazing!! I'm not a vegetarian dish, but I had their veggie casserole and it was one of the best veggie dishes I've ever had! (I may have added some bacon to the top per my server's suggestion when I mentioned I love meat.)   Plus, the staff went above and beyond to help me. They coordinated the space, helped me unload my car, and even asked me if I needed an extension cord for my projector! Good people and great food! I will be coming back!!

My wife and I went there after we saw their restaurant featured on "Check Please, Arizona". The food was amazing along with the drinks which they switch out and change on a regular basis.  What most impressed me was the service.  The wait staff was great and the owner gave us a drink on the house after stopping by our table to chat for a while. Total class act.  If you like good food, good drinks, good service - and want to support local business versus chains - then please stop by Pig and Pickle.

Worst experience at a restaurant. We had to leave without eating as the majority of the menu was "unavailable " - information which was sporadically passed onto us by the poor waitress on an as needed basis. Drinks were good though...if you don't mind waiting. Do not waste your time!!!

I don't understand what everyone is raving about.  After watching Detour's Tavern die a quick death I had really high hopes for Pig and Pickle as it is close to my house.    Went there Saturday night and were underwhelmed.  When we walked in the hostess seemed confused and a waiter was trying to seat us.  There was no structure to how the place was running right from the start.  It is over priced too.  We ordered a 1 sandwich, 1 appetizer and 1 salad.  Add 1 draft beer and 1 Margarita...$60 after tip.  We left hungry because the portions were so small.  The food did taste decent, there just simply wasn't much there.  We got the pork belly appetizer and there were 3 small pieces...it was $10.  We got one of the Sammie's and it was 80% bread with a small amount of pork inside of it.  At one point, I was eating just bread.  The dump truck salad was simply a bowl of mixed green's with hardly any salad dressing...$11.  On top of being underwhelmed by the food, the service was poor at best.  We got our salad before our appetizer and sat around for stretches of 10-15 minutes with no food or drinks.  When we asked for the check, we sat for another 15 minutes waiting.  Keep in mind, this place is small and our server literally had 3 tables to worry about.  I went into the Detour's Tavern one time and thought, "Wow, this place has so much potential but it won't last here based on this experience."  Same thought I had at Pig and Pickle.  It will be gone in 6 months.  It's a place you will walk in to try out and never return to because it is pricey and you don't get much.  There is no reason to go back there.  For $60 I can think of 10 other places I would rather eat that are way better.  I wish someone would just put in a nice sports bar or good pizza joint in this location.  Stop trying to make it something it isn't.  In North Scottsdale this place might survive with better service, but not in South Scottsdale.

We had the fried brussel sprouts, the pork tostados and the shrimp and grits.  Very good on all three. Topped it off with the carrot cake that will make even the fussiest eater learn to love carrots! We were there for Happy Hour and were pleased that HH applied on Saturdays, too!  Servers were helpful, polite and accommodating. Really enjoyed the whole experience and plan to return!

This is a neighborhood restaurant and I have always loved the place. The food is great and the customer service has always been excellent. With that said I'm writing this review because my wife and I went for a drink and bite to eat this past Saturday evening. P&P was celebrating their third birthday and it was fairly busy, but not to the point of out of control. Drinks were good like always and our server was friendly, like always. My concern was more about a comment he made and this is why I'm writing a review. My wife wanted a simple salad but it wasn't on the menu. Our server said he would ask the cooks to do something and then said they probably won't. He came back to the table and said they wouldn't do anything. He then called them princesses. Well listen princesses, the whole reason you are able to cook is because customers come in and spend their money. I hope you never forget that because as soon as you do the P&P will have issues like all the places there before it.... It's a slow slide and you won't notice right away... I will be back because I like the place but I say something now because I left with a bad taste in my mouth and I'd hate to see that become the norm.... I'm not sure why but the dessert menu was also limited to one type of cake that was not very good... One of the things I love most is going there late and having some home made ice cream... This may have been due to the event but I was surprised there were no other options... It wasn't even late. Got there around 9pm....

What you're about to read is NOT an exaggeration! First let me say that I don't eat pork so I can't speak to their "specialty"; however, this place was chosen for a celebration which is why I attended. Anyway, I ordered the fish tacos because it was one of the two items (on the late night menu) that were non-pork/beef and was MORTIFIED! As soon as our waiter placed my plate in front of me my nose was insulted by the scent of (and I will keep this a G-rated as possible) the "undercarriage" of a street walker after a very looong day! I CANNOT make this up! I passed the plate around to the entire party so they could "smell" that I was not making it up. They took the plate back and I ordered the Udon noodles (very good BTW). However, when my check arrived they tried to charge me an automatic gratuity of 20% that included the cost of the fish tacos in the gratuity! Needless to say I will not be back.

I love the Sunday morning brunch here...   The wait staff any time of day has always been top notch and friendly.  I find that while the food is priced well for what you get the drinks are a bit expensive.  Not a good place to go if you are about the drinks- but food wise?? Chow down!!

Overall it was decent, but nothing special to warrant a return visit.  I got the Albondigas to start.  It was pretty good but only had 2 tiny meatballs.  The BLT was fine but nothing spectacular.  My fiancee got the crispy skin trout which she liked.  The vinegar pie was extremely sweet, but the taste was good.  Like I said, it was good.  Not great, not bad.

5 stars is easy, the unbelievable selection of beer, wines & whiskey makes this an automatic. Selections you are going to have a lot of trouble finding elsewhere. Limited food menu but should please anyone. Wife was worried, but Shawn suggested the Monte Cristo and it was the best one she ever had. They make their own bread. I had the Apocalypse sandwich, nothing you can compare it to but the world's best burger, and this one is made with pork. If you are a night owl, this is the only place to go.
Absolutely amazing carrot cake! Chip the Waiter was awesome...! We will be back...!.......... ....... .....  .....   ........
Great service and great food!!  Pork tostadas were amazing. Salty dogs were delish. All fresh juice. Total mixologist.
Very different menu from what I expected.   I had the Cuban pickle crises and it was excellent and the service was good.  Worth a try!

This was my second time at P&P...I returned because I remember enjoying the food and the atmosphere from the first time.  This time was a disappointment. I had a table out on the patio and my server took my drink order (a soda) and forgot me for 25 min. They comped me the soda, but I was freezing my tushy off by then. I ordered the veggie supper, which was good but unfortunately, had some issues. The asparagus ends weren't cut off completely, so there were woody bits and the turnip was undercooked and extremely bitter.  I hope that P&P kicks it up a notch to maintain such a good standing. The place is great and the concept awesome, so hopefully this review will help!

Just returned from a much anticipated visit to Pig and Pickle...much to my disappointment I write this in hope that those antiicipating thier own visit heed the warning.Following a long day as a bartender addressing the needs of others I eagerly awaited enjoying some new vittles and a new local place .When arriving I was greeted by a very pleasant and joviall bartender Scott...quite a treat. Ordered the croquet sammie and a glass of vino. Asked for house wine and was informed that a pinot noir was the only option....so noir it was. I texted a friend and informed her I was at P n P and feel free to come over and have a drink/nibble. My friend arrived and was literally not acknowledged for 10 minutes. Scott was no where in site. There was a man who we later found out was one of the owners behind the bar...not friendly...not attentitive ...certainly not a reason to visit. Earlier when he asked how was my food I stated the food was good but the temp was lukewarm and I would prefer hotter.Clearly he was NOT interested in my feedback and opinions as he scurried off and remained aloof and unavailable. Scott returns and we share  our disappointment with him...he is gracious and apologetic.....we press on, When presenting our check the owner bartender informs us that he has given us the industry discount( awesome) until my friend realizes that she has been charged 12$ for whatshe hoped to be a cheap glass of house wine....much to our shegrin the noir was not . All in all here it is....nice location...nice ambiance, food was flavorful, Scott was a consumate pro, the prices food wise were reasonable...they need a more affordable wine selection for  the working class. I am sad ...I had high hopes. I was  not at all impressed with the surly arrogance of the "owner bartender" .He alone,was a deterrent to wanting to return regardless of the food and or drinks. Thumbs down on this experience~ Perhaps wait a minute...let them figure out the error of thier ways and this place maystand a chance-

Went here for first time a month ago, astonishing! The menu, service and beer were great. I'm a huge whiskey enthusiast and they have a great selection. I enjoyed this place and I will be going back for more pot roast sandwich.....for sure!!!

I have passed this place several times and always thought it wouldn't make it because of the kind of out of the way location. A chef buddy of mine had me meet him there for a drink and I can say now I wish I started coming earlier. The food is great and the beer selection is awesome. I'm a big fan of the gourmet tots that change daily. I've now tried things here that I never would have other places since the chef will occasionally surprise us. I love sitting at the bar and talking to the staff. A buddy recently ordered some sort of whisky tea drink that came with a french press I think and the bartender did a heck of a presentation and she was super friendly. It is safe to say I now know when other Chefs tell you to go somewhere it is worth listening. This is basically an unpretentious gastro pub that takes chances on the food and beer list and does it well. I crave those tots at least once a week and always wonder what hard to find new beer will be on tap. Great place.

Meat Sweats! Started with fried brussel sprouts - starters are always a good indicator of the meal quality. Shared the Apocalypse Sow - pork burger that crumbled during the first knife cut, it was that freshly prepared. The best part was the pickled pickle - fennel and vinegar - a bite at the back of your throat! The server has been there since the opening, very knowledgeable Irishman. Planning to go again for lunch - while not full of pork, I want to try Brie, avocado and tomato sandwich!

Some hits and some misses. We had a big party for dinner, but not an unreasonable amount of food was ordered. Service was fine, but we did feel rushed a bit.  The Hits: - Pork belly was really outstanding - cooked beautifully with a nice side of bok choy. - Brussel sprouts were also fantastic as an appetizer. - The duck we had was really well cooked and extremely flavorful.  The Misses: - The pork tostadas were INCREDIBLY salty. Couldn't taste anything but salted meat in there. - The marscapone risotto was pretty bad... very creamy, but woefully undercooked and almost flavorless. - The steaks were tough and really lacked flavor and seasoning. - The pork tenderloin was very, very pink in the middle and didn't have much flavor to it at all. - None of the desserts were particularly impressive - all seemed store-bought.  We probably wouldn't return on our next trip to Scottsdale.

I'm gonna go ahead and give this place five stars. Stopped in after wife (Kelly C.) got a tip from you nice folks on Yelp. Took her and the two kids for a mid day meal. We arrived as they opened for dinner. Immediately we were greeted warmly. The waiter was awesome, gave good advice and was very attentive without being overbearing. The kids fish and chips were awesome! I had the ratatouille which was awesome!  One of the best meals I've ever eaten. They bake their own bread which was some of the best! The price was a bit more than i was expecting, but in the end it was worth it. The food was excellent the staff was awesome!
Breakfast burrito and waffle were good but when the name of the restaurant is "pig" and they serve RAW bacon and call it crispy that is not a good sign.

Great food. Mussels were perfect, bread basket was really nice as well. Only issue was the service which was extremely slow in spite of it not being very busy but the waitress was pleasant so its not like it really ruined anything.

Love this place! Great food, very large beer selection and a nice atmosphere. The wait staff is always super friendly, attentive and know their menus. Pricea re very fair too for the quality of food you get, I highly recommend this place!

Fantastic, food, service, and drinks. Cat is amazing. She is like the Superwoman of Pig and Pickle. Cat is always working hard, and taking care of the customers. She is the manager, and is so sweet everytime I dine there. The servers are very professional, and treat their customers like gold. I live so close, that I can even have a cocktail or two and just walk home. :P I had my first Mai-Tai there, and the bartender was so honored to make it for me. It is rare to meet such sincere people! The beany pie, and their tots are so good! I'd like to try their dessert soon, and their other vegetarian dishes. The food is reasonably priced, too! Obviously this is not a fast food joint, so it is going to be more expensive, because it is REAL food-(and fresh at that)! Your taste buds will definitely thank you for eating at Pig and Pickle!

Came in on Sunday evening, Zack was our bartender. Super nice guy and knows his drinks. Great menu selections for food and drinks. I had the fizzy pickle from the cocktail menu -- very refreshing and delicious. From the late night menu I tried the ghostface tekilla cocktail ($5), was nervous bc I'm not a fan of grapefruit, but it was very delicious and great blend of flavors.

Dang this place is great!   The pig and pickle is a perfect addition to the neighborhood. I went recently we my husband and we had  great experience in every way possible. I love when you can clearly see the respect the chef has for his ingredients. While the menu is very creative it is just simple food done really well.   During our visit we started with the chef's feature oysters and pork shoulder tostadas. I had always been anti-oyster but tried these and loved them! They were small and delicate with a meaty texture, and the citrus on top was a delicious compliment. The tostadas were a nice portion, tender pork with kimchi and a nice aioli. They were very tasty.   For our entrees I had the mussels with chorizo and the husband had the pork trio(Braised snout, pickled nose and cracklins.) The mussels were amazing, I loved the smokiness of the chorizo with the delicate broth,  a really superb dish. Mu husband really enjoyed his pig bits. Especially the flavor of the root vegetable puree.   It also worth noting they have great cocktails and a fantastic beer selection. On this visit we stuck with cocktails, a Moscow mule and Manhattan. Simple, unpretentious and great quality.   Pig and Pickle is an instant favorite and we will be making many visits.

After reading about this place on yelp I've been eager to try this place. It's nearby and the reviews had me certainly intrigued.   We showed up about 20 minutes before they opened which we spent looking the pictures of the dishes on yelp, salivating and mentally choosing our early dinner. When I sat down I told myself no cocktails... Until the drink menu arrived. With a full list of hand crafted cocktails at your fingertips, how do you not go for it? Especially during happy hour? I couldn't and you shouldn't either. Mine was so refreshing I'm not even sorry.   I ordered the clams served in wine and essence of heaven. I loved every bite. It was a little spicy for my sensitive pallet but it was worth it. The bread, that they bake themselves, was incredible. Our waiter was very kind and patient, giving lots of great advice. Not only did I love my meal but I can't wait to go back and try something new! Pig and Pickle, I love you.

Oh my goodness,  that was a culinary experience.    It's our last night in Scottsdale and after 10 pm. My husband says,  "I'm going to go get some food"  I told him that I wasn't hungry and to not get anything for me and I might just take a few bites of whatever he gets. Well, he knows me better than that, and brought home four boxes of food.   We got the tot of the day which was a very good start to the meal followed by 1 order of the tongue pastrami sandwich and one order of the pork burger. The burger is called apocalypse sow. Hehe.   I'm not really a fan of tongue so pastrami sandwich, while very good isn't something that I would order myself. The burger, however, was freaking fantastic! I have to say, I've never had a more balanced or better burger. It wasn't even beef! How can I dare say this? It was just that damn good. Soft bread, delicious caramelized onions, homemade bacon, that itself was to die for, and a deliciously seasoned patty. The best.  I would actually consider coming back to Scottsdale just eat this burger.

What a great find! We started with two mega tater tots - which were awesome and a pickle plate. The pickle plate had everything on it from actual pickles to onions, eggs, beets and mushrooms. Very yummy.   I had a "dump truck" salad - I guess they call it that because everything is dumped in it. Delicious. For the main course I ordered the pot roast sammy minus the bread, so they served it in a cast iron pan. It was just great, huge portions. My husband enjoyed the beer selection and a juicy cheeseburger. The service was excellent, the restaurant was clean and everyone was friendly. We will return!

This is a great little neighborhood spot that packs a big punch! I am a massive pickled fan so we always start with the Pickle Plate that includes pickles (of course), carrots, okra, pearl onions, green beans, a hard boiled egg, and even grapes. All pickled to perfection! The employees are all friendly and full of helpful recommendations.   Be sure to check out their drink menu - you'll be sure to get a chuckle over the drink names (#scottsdaleproblems, my chick bad my chick hood.   I do think some menu items are just a tad overpriced, but that is probably expected in the area.

I'd been to the Pig and Pickle for dinner before about 2 months ago. It was good, but my friend and I were disappointed to learn that the duck fat fries were only available during the late night hours.  My husband and I came back tonight at midnight, and definitely weren't disappointed! We ordered the duck fat fries which came with this delicious vinegar aioli. For $5, the portion size for the duck fat fries was cheap! It was a huge serving!  We also shared the Apocalypse Sow Burger. I came on Yelp to see what was recommended and this burger was mentioned as a must. And it is! It's thick, with thick cut bacon that's cooked crisp, carmelized onions, served with a huge pickle on the side. The pickle had a bit of a bite to it, like jalapeño. My husband was joking that he was about to lick his plate clean bc the burger was so yummy. Either come really hungry or split the burger with someone you love.   I asked the server to recommend a fruity drink, and when he mentioned he could whip up a Harvey Wallbanger, I was game. I'd never had one before, but had heard of them. They were Sophia Petrillo's drink of choice on The Golden Girls-how could I refuse? My husband ordered coffee, and it didn't come out of a pot like other restaurants.   The server made the coffee in a French Press, and brought it out to the table. He told my husband to give it a few more minutes to finish brewing before pressing down on the grounds. It smelled enchanting. The coffee came out nice and smooth; some of the best coffee I've ever enjoyed.   We shared everything, and came out stuffed. This place is about 30 min away from our house, but we'll be back for sure. It was a chill atmosphere; there was music playing but it wasn't so obnoxiously loud you couldn't carry on a conversation. It wasn't busy, which was nice.

I probably need to check this place out in the evening, but my only review is during their brunch. It's probably my own fault for not looking at reviews closer, but the menu is different all day Sundays. We were looking for more of a lunch place, but they offered mostly breakfast items.   I decided to go with the hamburger and my only complaint was the bun. Not very tasty or anything special, seems like they just take it straight out of the store bought plastic.
