Maybe they only use this type on Sundays? The pictures didn't look like mine. hmmm.   Service: Our server was great, however there was a guy (supervisor?) walking around with a scowl the whole time. He had a pretty bitchy attitude, I could overhear him while eating.   Anyhoo, I will try again another time.

Pig and Pickle is a great gastropub. Their menu is fun and kind of cheeky (a sandwich named "The Nancy" comes to mind), and they have an excellent drink selection of American and imported beers, as well as great cocktails. I really enjoyed perusing the menu, though decisions are difficult because everything looks good! I loved their burgers and their tots are amazing. The sauce is unbelievable.  I will say I didn't quite feel hip enough for this place! All the servers and the host looked very cool, and I just rolled in off the street with a friend in our jeans and tshirts. Next time I might wear something a little more stylish.

The food was actually pretty good. I had the p&p Benedict which tasted great. But, I don't think they toasted the English muffin at all so it had that raw bread flavor. My dining companions enjoyed their omelets as well. Someone had an over easy egg that was over hard. But, no real complaints.   Unfortunately I have to dock some stars for the service. Our waiter brought me the wrong drink, not a huge deal. My friend asked if they had diet coke and the waiter said yes. She was brought a bottle of boylans diet cola. The waiter should have specified that it would be bottled and a different brand. Maybe he was hoping she orders refills to increase the bill?   I had to ask for every refill of coffee. Just keep it filled, man. It's brunch.   He dropped off the check. The four of us each put our card in and asked for it split. "Oh. So I guess you want it split? Next time you should tell us you needed it before we drop off the check." So I said, you could also ask if we need it split. He said no, he can't assume that. Maybe it's someone's birthday. What? I've served before. It's not difficult. Its just a four top. You keep track of who had what and at the end of the meal you ask "do we need this together or separate?" Or, drop it off and just split it without complaining or lecturing your customers.   When he dropped off the check he gave an incredibly sarcastic "Havvvveeee a greeaaat day ladies!!!" We get it. We annoyed you. Learn to grin and bear it and be a professional about it.
I have been dying to visit this place again! The burger I had late one night was fantastic. They also have a great selection of whiskey. What a surprising hidden treasure!

Went here last night for the first time and had a fantastic experience. We tried 4 different drinks off their lengthy cocktail menu and were pleased with all of them...try the bee sting! The duck leg was outstanding and my friend enjoyed his pork burger as well. The only thing that was better than our food & drinks was the service...our server Eric was spot on! The place is well staffed and the hostess was super friendly. Couldn't ask for more from a first experience. There's no question I'll be back to try the bone marrow!

We stopped in after purchasing a car for our son.  As you can imagine we were exhausted, tired and starving.  My son and his girlfriend had eaten here several times and raved about the food and service.  We had a FANTASTIC time. The food was to die for and I highly recommend you save room for the strawberry vinegar pie - it takes two months to make and is phenomenal. The food was melt in your mouth delicious.The owner Clayton stopped by and was so personable and friendly.  He found out my husband was retired military and thanked him for his service (my husband was impressed with that).  All and all a great time - go you won't be sorry.
Just ate here for the first time. This restaurant is a "must." I wish I lived in Phoenix. I'd come here weekly.

I ordered the ramen noodles with the egg and pork belly. I was dreaming about the pork belly all night. In fact I didn't want to chew it because it tasted so good.  Also my stomach started to growl as I write this review so I might have to go back and get some more.  We sat on patio and it was a chill quiet environment. They had ashtrays if any of your friends smoke...service was pretty good also.

Love this place! I have had a lot of stuff here and nothing fell short of amazing!  Love the staff also.  If you have not been here your life is not complete. You will not be disappointed.  I read some of the negative reviews and I just don't know how anyone has anything bad to say about the food or drinks. Also it is a must to go for brunch sometime.  Ok I am done.  But seriously eat here!

This is a very cool place. My boyfriend and I went there for the first time this past Friday. Our waitress was very helpfully since this was out first time here, she took her time going though the menu and what drinks she recommended. Her recommendations were awesome. We loved our drinks and our food. We will be definitely going back soon.
My favorite item on the menu so far has been Brussel sprouts. Seriously YUM! I love that everything is fresh made, locally sourced, etc. Love to go here with the girls. =)

Wow this place is awesome. Came here at midnight on a Saturday, absolutely starving. The place was busy but the service was great. We got a few beers and the duck fat fries, which were delicious, but the burger definitely won hands down..perfectly juicy, TONS of meat, high-quality cheese, buttery bun. We were leaving town the next day, otherwise I would definitely have come back here again for dinner. I love the vibe -- perfectly for a casual dinner.

I thought the food was wonderful.  We Ordered Brussels sprouts, smothered in bacon bits, topped with a fried egg....scrumptious.  Also had the pork sandwich with golf ball sized tater tots, filled with amazing flavors.  ( I am a loser and can't remember what  was actually in them, but they were amazing!) The food here is great . They don't have diet coke , but they carry regular coke products in a little glass bottle at $3 each. Bartender claims the owners do not  carry diet coke because it contains  fructose corn syrup.. Seriously! You FRY Brussels sprouts and smother them with BACON for crying out loud!!!  I (unfortunately)  NEED diet coke with savory food.  Sorta like wine and cheese for some. I tried an ice tea and it was so bland, tasted like water. So knowing I wasn't happy with my drink options, (diet coke or diet coke) the bartender (we sat at the bar) gave me room temperature tap water, containing a single ice cube which quickly melted.  Eww.   She could have at least dressed the water glass up with a pile of ice and a fruit wedge of some sort, after all, It was 111 de- freakin grees outside!!! She's amateur, it was obvious.  But the food was  delicious and so this place still gets five stars.  BUT, IF I ever decide to return,  I'd smuggle in my own diet cokes or else I couldn't eat here.  SAD! but it's the way it is.  Also, weird/small selection of beer my husband wasn't happy with, he asked for a chilled glass for his CAN of beer, and the "bartender" offered him a can cuzzy, cozy, whatever the hell you call it  instead. NOT OK!!! AND the pickles have a funky taste.  I better stop talking or I'll be changing my five star review. Oh! And they have weird hours.

Finally got to try P&P last night. I came in right as they were switching over to their late night menu, but I had no problem finding some options that sounded good.   I ended up ordering the pork shoulder tostadas, per the recommendation of you fellow Yelpers, and was not disappointed. They were SO good. I'm not sure if I had eaten kimchi prior to these tostadas but I liked everything that was happening in my mouth.   I like that P&P offers industry discounts and good late night eats. I will definitely be back.

The service here is amazing. Tyler is not only personable but a fabulous bartender. I ordered the Brussels sprouts that were topped with an egg as a late night snack, wow! Definitely a new go to spot for some late night drinks and eats!

Yummy stuff!  Great place for something a little different. Started with an appetizer of the Havarti cheese with honey, bee pollen, and apricot-vanilla jam. Nice start! I ordered the smoked pot roast sandwich with havarti, caramelized onions and horseradish and my foodie-buddy ordered the pork burger with bacon, aged cheddar and grilled onions.  We would have discussed our food experience, but our mouths were full and it wouldn't be polite  :)   We shared a S'more for dessert which was described as chocolate mousse on a graham cracker crust with toasted marshmallows. We were just a tad disappointed that the mousse was hard as a rock, so when you tried to cut into it, it flew off the plate, making a bit of a mess.  As it sat, it softened some and was a much more pleasant treat, but had to ask for a doggy bag as it was VERY rich.  All in all, great food and good service. I would definitely return for another go.

I wasn't particularly blown away by this restaurant.  We had seen a flyer for it in the lobby of our hotel and after a night at Talking Stick for a concert we needed a snack so we stopped in here since it was on our way.  As soon as we entered it smelled heavenly of bacon, a lot of it.  The gentleman that sat us was very welcoming and friendly and continued to check on us throughout our meal which was nice.  We ordered some apple brandy mules and a couple of 'snacks'.  We tried the buffalo pork shanks and the Duck, Duck, Pig.  Both of these are very good sized plates.  While the pork was cooked very well and was nice and tender on the shanks, it came drowning in sauce which was a turnoff.  The DDP was nicely put together though and very tasty.  Drinks were great and service attentive, we would be back if we were in the neighborhood.

My Dad and I came in for lunch today. I have been wanting to retry this place since I moved back in the area.  Stood at the front for a couple of minutes wondering if we should wait or seat ourselves... Finally the female bartender came out from behind the bar and told us to pick a spot and she brought over menus.   We ordered the Cuban sandwich and Brussels to share... The bartender/server talked us into getting the tots as our.   Water glasses were empty the majority of the time. When food came out it was cold, the bread was burnt on our sandwich, and the Brussels were cold and extremely greasy. Our girl never came back to check in and so we semi ate our food be we were both extremely hungry. Overall the Brussels were not touched and both of us tore apart out sandwiches to eat what was edible. For too very hungry people we maybe ate 30% of our food. My Dad said all of the fries food tasted like old oil and joked that the kitchen must have been too busy cleaning and breaking down lunch service than cooking our food.  When she finally came back to clear out plates she asked how everything was... My Dad is very straightforward and he told her the Brussels were greasy and the sandwich wasn't very good... She said "sorry about that".  Bill came, tots were an up charge and were terrible... I'm definitely not cheap, but don't hard sell a side for $2 that was cold and barely eaten. No attempt to fix or rectify the comments made about the food. I definitely don't expect comps, but at least some acknowledgment of way below par food and customer feedback. We put cash in the book and she asked if we needed any change... Yes I need change back! So unprofessional and rude. There are much more professional ways to ask.  This was one of my worst experiences overall as of late between service and food. Many people has told me this place had gone downhill, but I wanted to give it another try. My Dad had a bad first and last impression and we both left hungry.

I liked the risks they took with the menu.  The chef did a really nice riff on the Hawaiian dish poke.  The salad was very good.  Nice mix of different greens and well dressed.  Just enough dressing to coat the leaves.  My favorite dish of the night was bone marrow.  The serving was huge and just absolutely yummy.  The last dish was the pan sauteed white fish over couscous.  Pretty delicious.

My friend and I went here on a Friday night for dinner, and we picked it based on the reviews we read. We thought it was going to be busy, but it was pretty empty on the inside. We sat and got served promptly. The drinks we both had were good. For the entrees we shared the mussels and the hanger steak. The mussels were ok; the broth was lacking something. The skirt steak we got was better though. We ordered it medium and it was pre-sliced for us, which made it easier for us to share.   In my opinion, this place was decent. The server was friendly, and they didn't have music very loud or anything so that was nice since my friend and I were catching up. If I'm looking for a place that I can get sat quickly within old town, I might come back here to try it.

Unique menu, friendly and attentive service, well-prepared food! However, I have an embarrassing confession...  Months ago, I was having one of the worst weeks at university, stresses piling on, 8 hours of homework each night. It was a nightmare. I was at my limit (you know that feeling, where you just want to tear your textbook in half and throw your computer off your balcony?) but then thought to myself, "You know what would make me happier than anything right now? A delicious Pig & Pickle BLT." So I headed over, dreaming of one of the best BLTs I've ever had, and how it would soon make my stresses drift away. Flavorful pork belly, tasty pesto, and juicy tomatoes. It even made my 'not-impressed-by-BLTs' fiancé a believer.  Lo and behold, when I sat down and opened my menu... it was no longer there. I asked our server, and he confirmed. And (here's the confession part) I totally went to the parking lot and cried. Seriously. SO! Overall lesson (aside from not to put all your hopes and dreams into food): Yes, their food is *that good.*  Also, Pig & Pickle, I'm moving nearby. So if you decide to bring back that BLT, I'd be forever grateful (and probably forever occupying your restaurant).

I ordered the Brussels sprouts with the egg and they were so so so good! I also had the spicy albondiga soup and it was so yummy with the avocado on top it was perfect! I cant wait to go back and have more of their food. And more brussels sprouts!

Have to try the Apocalypse Sow (ground pork) burger with bacon, it was WONDERFUL.  Also enjoyed the dump truck salad, skirt steak lettuce wraps, and pork shoulder mini tostadas. Service was very good.  Price were reasonable.  This place is a gem!

Went here for lunch( because of the reviews from the Yelp peeps) with my 22 year old son, who's palate is beyond spoiled......  He takes a bite....."Seriously?!"...sits back, while chewing, sits up again, takes another bite....."Uh".....  takes a swig of his beer, looks at my plate, takes a bite of my sandwich, asks me if I'm gonna finish the last bits of the pork belly we ordered first, uh yah?... Just gonna say.......FREAKIN' HEAVENLY!!!! Taste buds went nuts!!!!!!  Pork Belly to start  He had the Braised Pork Cheeks with grits I had the Cuban Sammie  Luckily for us, our hotel wasn't that far before we fell into a very satisfied, Pork Coma!

I liked this place. Visited during happy hour. Got a Rose and the tacos. The meat in the taco was super flavorful and there was a pickled pepper in the mix somewhere that was really amazing. I had heard about their tater tots, so I ordered 3. The tots are not like the normal ones. They are large pieces that have different flavors. I got a pulled pork one. It was crispy on the outside and soft in the middle. Came with a great aioli sauce. The chefs actually comped me one more tot too! The service was great. My waitress was friendly. I will be coming back again to try more items in the menu!
Fun lunch place!   Mid afternoon beer with some pork belly - uh huh!  And even got some free cozies!

Best spot in Scottsdale period.   Clayton and Scotty handle the bar extremely well. They offer an excellent array of hand crafted cocktails, craft beer, and wine on tap. No bullshit, they are some of the best in the business.   Keenan and Josh run the kitchen. From the countless times I have dined here, I cannot find one complaint. It is a restaurant that makes it very difficult to try the same thing twice, as you want to try something different every time. My personal favorites have been the Apocalypse sow, smoked salmon app, and anything involving pork belly. They absolutely crush it. Fresh, local, and unique cuisine is offered on the daily.   Find out when they offer beer pairing dinners. They provide you with a chance to try some awesome food, paired with chronic brews. Seats run out quick, so jump on them when you can.   This is my favorite restaurant. Try it.

One of my favorite restaurants! They have really great service and the food is ALWAYS amazing! My favorite is the charcuterie plate, they serve it with house made bread and bacon jam that will make you wonder why you never put bacon in your jam before. Anyways with a group of 11 no water was left unfilled and we didn't have to ask for anything!

Okay. I have an obsession. But really. I have not been more excited about a new business as much as I have with this one.   First off I hate pickles so at first I was hesitant that when I went in everything would be made with pickles. This is not the case at all.   They have wine on tap. (Ummm yes please) Tots of the day. (Yes that's right they have a different "huge" tot every single day! Only 1$) Give a beer board (you can buy a beer for a friend write their name on a board and when they come in its already paid for so they can enjoy)  Amazing staff (I have yet to have bad service) Phenomenal menu (thanks to amazing head chef)  great Bar!!! Clayton is an amazing owner and has an amazing sense of humor my boyfriend an him are always cracking jokes to each other!   Try "the Nancy" but add pork belly or bacon!  I'm also a huge fan of their "cookie-ish desert! My goal is to try everything on the menu but if hard because there constantly changing the menu adding new items and mixing it up! Another highlight is their late night menu! Try the Udon Noodles soooo good!!   The braised duck leg is also a must try!   The only thing that I've had that I wouldn't be jumping at having again was the pork tostadas (not horrible just not my cup of tea)  I'm so happy that this spot is here!! By far my go to and new favorite place in town. Get there NOW!!! And may your first question be "what's your tot of the day?"

Oh my gosh....it has been awhile since I've been to P&P....love their brunch, but decided to hit happy hour. Great friendly service even though my friend - Clayton wasn't  there overseeing the operation!    I have to say.,,,P&P's Culinary Creativity is so much fun and a true adventure!  Try their Green Chili Mac n' Cheese with Bacon Topping!  It's a true man's candy!  (Ladies that appreciate real food love it, too!).   Can't wait to stop back again soon and see what they have created on their ever changing menu. Really love their pulled pork kimchi street tacos, too!

so delish ~ went with my out of town family.  bone marrow was good - i was impressed to see certain things on menu like that and the "sow" burger.  i didnt get the burger this time, but the pork shoulders tostada were *incredible*.  The drink menu was superb
Good food, great staff, bad location.

Holy crap this place is good!!  We randomly stopped by this place today and wow, was it a great choice! I had the appetizer pork shoulder tostada (YUM) and the shepards beanie pie (delicious). My companion had the scallops- scallops can either totally suck or be delicious...they were delicious, perfectly seasoned and perfectly cooked.   GO HERE NOW!!

I want to go back and see if my second time in the restaurant is as good as the first because if it is I may never eat anywhere else. From appetizers to dessert everything was mouth watering. Comfort food at its finest.

Not a very big place, a dozen regular height tables and about a half dozen high tops. The menu has a blurb at the top which talks about balance.  Balance between sweet and sour, old and new, etc.  I suppose you could almost call this a mission statement because it was evident in each thing I ate.   Here's a nice touch - the hostess dropped off the menu and then came right back with a glass of water.  New one on me but a nice touch.  The waiter appeared a couple of minutes later to take a drink order and instead I asked him for his recommendations from the menu.  He described their duck breast entree in such a way that my mouth was already watering - sold!  While he was talking, I noticed the couple at the next table receive their slices of pie and asked about their dessert offerings.  They must have overheard the conversation because they both gave me a big thumbs-up when he described the process of making the pie the gentleman was eating.    The duck beast served somewhere between medium and medium rare.  I was sliced into about 6 pieces of an even thickness and served over a mixture which included wild rice, spinach, dried cherries, feta cheese, almonds and a mesquite syrup.  When I saw it on the menu it looked like it was a dish that might have too much going on to be enjoyable.  When it arrived in front of me I figured my inkling was confirmed.  I was dead wrong!  The varying tastes and textures absolutely worked together.  Just as mentioned at the top of the menu, this dish was all about balance.  The duck was crispy, salty and tender all at once.  The rice brought another layer of texture while the dried cherries added a certain tang and the mesquite syrup contributed smokiness.  The feta added creaminess and was balanced with the slivered almonds.  Wow!    I have never in my life heard of vinegared strawberry pie.  Apparently, this is an old technique which involves cooking the strawberries well ahead of pie baking and then mixing them into the pie.  There was more to the story which I just can't remember.  What I do remember is the pie.  This really was the most unusual strawberry pie I've ever been served but it was delicious!  The pie itself was filled with a gelatin-based mixture which included the vinegared strawberries in syrup form and a sugary top crust.  Over the top of the pie was a strawberry compote and they finished the dish with creme fraiche.  The first draft had an espresso syrup on the plate but the waiter very graciously removed it when I told him I disliked coffee flavors.  This pie reminded me of eating strawberry shortcake in terms of flavors but not texture.  The texture reminded me of eating pecan pie but without the pecans.  Balance...  Side note: I very much appreciate the recommendations for this place that I received after posting to the Phoenix Yelp talk board.  I probably would not have found this place on my own but I am really glad to have had the experience of dining here on this trip.

A welcome addition to the neighborhood - this place is amazing!  Everything we tried - duck leg, roasted marrow, duck ham (!?!) , pork belly - was delicious.  Can't wait to try the late night menu, and I heard brunch is starting soon!

Really liked this place! Can't wait to go again. We went for happy hour, and was excited to see that it was family friendly as I have an 8mo old. Other families were in there too. Very relaxed and hip sort of atmosphere. HH items were great! Had the dump truck salad and brussel sprouts and was quite full after my meal. The brussel sprouts were suprisingly rich too - in a good way.:D

Go here immediately and enjoy the food, drinks, and hospitality. Do you like pork? Order the Cuban sandwich! Thin slices of ham and tasty pulled pork are the stars of this sandwich but the house mustard and fresh bread make this sandwich amazing. I added a dump truck salad and it was perfect with this monster sandwich. I'm coming back for the Brussel sprouts & pork belly because not having this in my life would be a sin.   The chef here is a super cool guy that takes pride in his food and thoughtful approach to his craft.  The bar staff, regulars, and chef made a out of towner like me feel like a regular. stop reading and go get a craft drink and eat some delicious pork!

Really, really delicious food, very creative, big portions, and relatively attentive serving staff. This place is serious about beer! We had three sandwiches and one entree, plus shared a side of their "tots" and a pork belly appetizer. Too full for desert!

I love coming to Pig and Pickle. It was one of the first places that I went with my boyfriend.  The food is always delicious every time and we have never had an issue with any servers.   One of my favorite drinks was Pimmin aint Easy, although I think it has since changed to another name with a slightly different recipe.  The things that always stick out whenever I tell people to go to Pig & Pickle are Tater Tots. You always have to try the tots. They change them everyday and I am always so pleasantly surprised by the amazing flavor that gets packed into those. The other item is only on the late night menu and that is the Duck Fat Fries. I was super hesitant to try them but I am very glad I did. My only warning that if you are tempted to get the pickled plate it is VERY INTENSE. Something that I recommend sharing with a large group. It is good, but lots of pickled items.   The food is worth trying, don't allow the description of the food frighten you. The chef's blend of flavors has not disappointed.

One of my very favorite brunch spots; love the super amazing Bloody Mary served w pork belly, a deviled egg, pickled green beans, and more! I wish I had taken a pic! I haven't had a bad drink or a bad meal, ever! Love this place!!

I have been here a few times now and can definitely say that this is some of the best food in Scottsdale. OH MY GOD the pork shoulder tostadas - AMAZING. To die for!! The duck fat fries are not to be missed either! They have an excellent alcohol selection. Talented bar staff too- they really know their trade. Friendly and fun wait staff. The live music is excellent, and it puts the finishing touch on the unique vibe. The ONLY way I think this place could get any better is perhaps expanding their menu a bit. But maybe that's just me. ;) Regardless, I consider it to be quite a treat every time I visit this place!!

Some chefs play it safe, but others use their creativity and great flavors to create great food. Great low key yet sophisticated atmosphere and dishes. Try the bone marrow, or the pork belly. Clayton is a fantastic host. Kudos.

Awesome service.  The pork belly is so delicious, its ridiculous.  They make these tots with different ingredients everyday.  Ive had some with corned beef and cabbage, some with hot dogs and smoked gouda, and some other ones with like bleu cheese and bacon.  Best tater tots I have ever had.  They have an eclectic little stoner menu for late nights that is priced pretty well.  I suggest you smoke a j and head out here at like 11.  There is a patio outside and you can eat and smoke out there.  This place rocks.  Its definitely a cool kid spot.
Pretty awesome beers! Food is really different. Get the Tostadas!! They are good, great price too.   Went there for my 40th birthday. We had a really a good time.

Wanted to like this place so bad.  The atmosphere is adorable. We chose this based on the reviews.  We just couldn't love the food.  I ordered a Sriracha drink that was more sour than anything and a pork porchetta that I just could not swallow.  We did have some Brussels that were really tasty.  My sister had a sandwich that the juice so soaked her bread that her bread turned to liquid on the bottom.  I generally do not give low marks on unusual food but this was over-the-top awful.  The waitress appeared to be accommodating and then I overheard her mocking us to the cook when all my sister had asked for was some bread that was not total mush. The manager never checked on us or why we were unhappy and they did not even offer to make anything right.  I would never return to this restaurant again and as you can see from my previous reviews, I am not generally very critical.  If the restaurant service had been more interested in customer service, I may have been willing to go back and try some different items based on so many great reviews but will not be back.

I have a ten month old lab that wreaks havoc whenever he's left at home alone, so I'm always on the lookout for dog friendly restaurants. Our waitress was awesome, and immediately brought my pup a bowl of water and a gigantic house made dog treat, which he gobbled down in about two seconds. Between that and the amazing happy hour, Pig and Pickle is one of our new favorite hangouts! Happy hour goes from 3 to 6 daily, and they have an awesome selection of draft beers, cocktails, and wine for only $5. I loved the #scottsdaleproblems, with prosecco, house limoncello, lime zest, and tiki bitters. Their mac and cheese with pepper jack and green chilies is absolutely amazing. You have the option of adding a hefty portion of house smoked pork belly for $4 - best decision ever. And speaking of great decisions, you should definitely get a few of their tot of the day. These things are MASSIVE, way bigger than golf balls; the tot du jour for our visit was bacon and feta - I could've eaten a dozen of those babies. I don't know what crazy magic goes into their aioli either, but it is so addictive! My friend KJ got the pickle plate, which was definitely interesting. I'm not a huge fan of pickles in general (I know, blasphemy) but this plate was something else entirely! They had pickled EVERYTHING, from regular bread and butter pickles and green beans to watermelon rind, cauliflower, egg, fennel and onions. The pickled grapes were surprisingly good. Pickle lover or not, you and your pup will definitely find something you'll enjoy at the P&P!

Wanned to try something different. Loved their pork belly, their bone marrow, beer tasting that they allowed me to do, support local farms, happy animals, herbs, and gotta say i really really loved their vinegar strawberry pie!!!!!!
One of my favorite late menu establishments. They have the best cilatragon margarita I've ever had! Great patio and awesome music. Oh and can't forget about the awesome staff, Chip is my favorite!

Absolutely  wonderfull The Bone marrow, 2 big pieces, absolutely decedent, warm  buttery, so rich served with buttery crostini  an and herb salad The tator tots, not your average run of the mill tot,  No square potatoes these tots are more like croquet  Served with a spicy aioli, 2 tots belive me that is plenty, so dense and so yummy, Last but not less the Hoop-Dee old school at its best but so yummy. Not a place to miss

I can't seem to understand the hype around this restaurant. After reading all the reviews on yelp I knew I had to bring my girlfriend here while visiting for the weekend. Upon arrival we were being up charged. We started will the brussel sprouts which were inedible as they were drenched in oil. They are deep fried and all we could taste was the oil. They were disgustingly greasy. Our waiter tried to up-sell us from the beginning of our meal. Immediately, he asked, "would you like to try _____ or _____?" Of course these were the two most expensive items on the menu. He also asked us if we would "like to add bacon or pork" onto two separate dishes. By the time we finished ordering, we were tired of being pestered to add to our dishes.   When our main dishes came out they both looked great. However both of our dishes had no taste what so ever. Maybe the greasy brussel sprouts had something to do with that.   The prices at pig and pickle also seem to be a little high for being in a run down strip center. I am very disappointed that this was our last dinner in Arizona. It

This place is fantastic. Gastro pub extraordinaire. Really great service and the food is very very good. I love how late they're open. We got the burger and it was sensational. They definitely use quality ingredients. I would recommend this place and I will be returning for sure.  The duck fat fries are a must

I loved my experience tonight. And this sort of experience tells you that this is how this place runs. .always.   House made bread, mayo... real fat, real sugar, real food. .. the chefs make it all here!   The highlights were the BLT, chicharrones (holy shit, they're delicious), their sandwich bread, their mayo, the carrot cake. I could've tried more but fat is very satiating, so you don't have to pig out to feel full, just the bites I had left an impression on me...though maybe I did "pig out".haha   I admit there was a bit of a glitch in the birthday girls meal, but they were quick to remedy it, comp it and offer us desert on the house, no hesitation.  That's what I liked: no hesitation, just fix it. .and they did.   Waiter was on the ball and atmosphere was relaxed, not Scottsdale pretentious. .. nice place, I'll definitely be back!

My favorite bar. Awesome selection of whiskey all over the world. Cocktails are cool and theres something for everyone. Always a unique beer selection. Highly recommend for service industry especially late night, they will fulfill your munchies. The staff is GREAT! The chef knows what he's doing, always making some tasty specials.

I love you guys.  You make my heart and stomach so happy.  That being said, this place really cares about who is walking in, sitting down and dining.  I only eat at the bar.  The reason?  I'll tell you why.  I always meet someone interesting.  I always make a friend.  I always find something new menu item from my friends at the bar.    Pssst.  If you like foie, get your ass over here.  It's not a sin.  They do it right.  Don't believe all that PETA propaganda either.    Tostadas.  Man.  I could live inside that little cocoon of shredded pork for the rest of my life.    Salmon.  Damn.  They do it right.  Smoked, white pickles onions on top of a mashed potato pancake sprinkled in Panko breadcrumbs.  I love you guys.  You make me weep.  I'm yours forever.

I love Pig & Pickle.  They're open late night, they have a port that I love, the place is fun, it's in a great location before going out at night.  Last time we were there they were playing old school hip hop and rap, it was hilarious.  Our group usually goes on Sunday nights.  Some of our favorites are the tot of the day.  They do these huge tots usually filled with lots of cheese, meat, and accompanied by some kind of dipping sauce.  We got the duck fat fries, seared foie gras, and the wood oven roasted bone marrow with crostini and onions.  The fun thing is after you eat the marrow, the bartender will pour a shot down the bone!  My absolute favorite thing is the pork shoulder tostadas with ginger aioli, kimchi, and scallions.  It's the perfect Korean Mexican fusion, and the pork is so tender and juicy, and it's so messy to eat but so worth it.  Dessert!  We've gotten this deconstructed smore, this awesome meringue  thing, The Elvis, a deconstructed pb&j thing, and a friend got the carrot cake and they loved it so much.  I'm bad at remembering names, and the desserts change around a bit.  But they're all yummy.

I have now eaten here four times and every time is a great experience! Service is very friendly and the food is outstanding. All of the food is made from scratch and with lots of love. The place is spotless, it's an open air kitchen and you can see that it is cleaner than most hospitals. Try anything pork and the clams with chorizo. One of my top five favorite places to eat in the US!

Brunch is Amazing. Hungry or thirsty or both. Try the biscuits and gravy, or the lox. Everything on the menu is amazing. The bloody Mary Pig And Pickle. style with belly though? Omg Jordie Bird I love ya.

I use to go to Pig & Pickle every time I visited Phoenix, and now I live here. I discovered it a few blocks away from a friend's apartment. I love pork and anything pickled so the name took me in immediately.  We always get the charcuterie: delectable bits of cured meat with pickles and bread. We've also ordered the grilled octopus, pork liver smear, pork shoulder tostadas, mussels, bone marrow, foie gras, duck breast salad, and other things that I can't remember the exact name of and are no longer on their ever-changing menu. Aside from the grilled octopus which was a tad too salty, we have loved everything we've ordered. But the food isn't the only great thing about Pig & Pickle, they also serve delicious cocktails, and if you get there during happy hour the prices are pretty nice.  Pig & Pickle is a place I frequently recommend, and will always come back to.

It was alright and thats about it really!  When I visited it was for a friends birthday and so there was a fairly large group (8 people) and so you expect a slightly longer wait for food - which was fine.  The only disappointment was the quality of food as I'd be building it up in my head all day at work thinking about how amazing it was going to be, but it was just a bit average. Nothing was bad per say, but this is why it's a 3 star review not 4 stars.  Beer selection here is great though and the servers are fantastic - they'll talk you through which beers suit which dish or taste and advise you on what to try. I always like it when servers interact more personally and show a genuine passion for what they do!  A nice evening for a friends birthday and a good spot for a group. It just didn't set my world alight.

I met up with a good buddy of mine for a little catchup, a little ambience, and some yummy food.  We were excited to try this place for the first time so here's how it turned out:  Great parking was a pleasant surprise when we arrived at 6 on a Friday night.  I live in Central Phoenix so hardly ever encounter that treat.  Got there before my buddy and was warmly greeted before being seated.  The interior was lovely, warmly lit, and had a nicely-moderated noise level (another pleasant surprise).  The patio had gas heaters and some comfortably upholstered seating so we settled in to get caught up.  I'm on a bourbon kick right now so my server recommended a delicious cocktail.  It also had Rye in it and was pink.  Yummy!  My pal had something equally delish with gin and blackberry.  Equally delish!  This joint has some signatures, one of which is tater tots.  The selection on Friday had baked beans with a side of barbecue sauce.  Wow, they are just yummy!  We both ordered a sandwich based on our server's suggestion.  It was a kind of pork burger, covered with bacon, and it was good.  My only quibble is that it seemed overly salty to me and may benefit from toppings that balance the pork out a bit.  We both had the fries and our server brought us both ketchup and barbecue sauce for dipping.  A nice gentleman came out to ask about our experience and he seemed genuinely interested in our feedback.  So....the next visit will be focused on tots, pink drinks, and a new treat.  I'm looking forward to it!

Note: must like pickles or really good drinks   Basically they are a bar with several really good bartenders who have unusually wide breath of liqueurs to choose from. I went with a buddy (George Meyers, AKA "Da MAN en da No") who knows these types of unusually awesome places and was pointed in the direction of a Irish whiskey I had never heard of and am now destined to buy stock in, Green Spot! Remember that Whiskey, Green Spot. YOU WILL LOVE IT! before the Green Spot, I tried several other drinks which where all awesome, I can't remember their names because after four or five of them I have my first shot of Green Spot and that was all she wrote. I now am regularly purchasing all that I can get my hands on. Oh yeah the food. It was the best pickled EVERYTHING I have ever had. Even the odd pink pickled hard boiled eggs were good. Weird but good.  Stop by the Pig and ask for a shot of Green Spot. Then try some pickled anything. Because the pickle everything.

I can't believe it's taken us this long to try this place! Dinner was great, my husband and I both have restrictive diet and they accommodated happily. We both had the apocalypse sow With no bun and it was so good! Also, we are Diet Coke drinker's, they don't have Coke's but they have this great natural soda called Boyln so good!

Great setup in unassuming part of south Scottsdale.  Beer selection amongst the best I've seen.  Ambiance and service was top notch.  If you like great food(ie) food at a great price, live music and nice people give this place a try.

Let me start by saying, GET THE "Apocalypse Sow"!!!  I've loved this place since the day they opened. You can't go wrong with any of the food here. It has been my regular neighborhood spot for years now. The beer selections, mixed drinks, and ESPECIALLY the whiskey/bourbon selections are perfect. I usually just eat at the bar because the service is so attentive. But the time that we sat at a table with family, the service was great. Our server, Chip, was amazing. We may have to sit in the dining room more often just to see his smiling face.

Love love love! We had the bone marrow-never had before but it was really good and even better with the jelly. Also the pickled okra on the side was the perfect after-bite for the marrow. I got the duck breast which was also delicious and my husband got the hanger steak which he also said was delicious. His steak could have used a touch more salt and my duck breast pears could have been a little more sweet if we were to be very detailed. The cheesecake was the perfect balance of vanilla and chocolate flavors with some kind of fruit compote. Everything was delicious and the customer service was exceptional. The place was also decorated with really cool pop art from a local artist.

One of my favorite restaurants in scottsdale. Great food, moderately priced. Great selection if whiskey and beer, interesting cocktails and well rounded inventive menu.., I haven't had a bad meal yet. The service has always been good.. I would go back anyday for the duck and the dump truck salad. I crave the salad  for lunch, too bad it isn't open then.  I love u pig and pickle
Yum!!! Great unique menu. Had the BLT and salad. Delish. Nice atmosphere and decor and great selection of beer, wine and cocktails.

Who doesn't like Pork.  A very interesting menu with some unique dishes.  Based on the information received from the waitress the menu changes often as they try and utilize available local ingredients.

Finally had a chance to give this place a try now that they are open for lunch. Great setting, friendly people, and good food. I had the Cubano sandwich with fries and a sweet pickle and it was excellent. Since I had to go back to work, I stuck with a Coke, and they have the Mexican Cokes in the glass bottle. However, I noticed that they have an excellent selection of craft beers, including two of my favorites, Ninkasi and Dogfish Head, along with a large selection of wine and other cocktails. I also saw a couple be seated on the patio with their dog and the bartender took an actual water bowl out for the pup, which seems like a great idea. I am definitely a fan, and will no doubt be back again... hopefully when I'm not working so I can have a good beer with my meal!

Closer to two and a half. I think this place has a great vibe and the concept is hilariously awesome. Just the execution of some of our dishes were so-so. Definitely think I could bump up the rating after another visit but this is where I currently stand.  Starting with the drink I ordered, the Maggie. Strawberry and lilikoi are some of my favorite flavors in sweets. But my table and I could agree that the dominating flavors were tequila and OJ. My friend ordered the hard root beer, and it's what you expect except slightly disappointing. Maybe we just suck at picking drinks, I don't know.  We started with the bone marrow since it was a popular mentioned item here. Two thick bones, with buttered toast, okra pickles, and "peperonata" that was basically red pepper pesto. The bone marrow was bomb, but I think buttering the toast makes it overkill on the fats. I think toasted bread alone would be great.  My main item was a build your own burger, medium, with duck egg and pork belly, plus tots instead of fries or salad. The tots are amazing, you get two giant stuffed whoppers of amazing potato goodness. Got hints of cheese or something else, it's not just fried mashed potatoes. Definitely worth it in my opinion, but you might get slightly less mass than ordering fries.  What was disappointing was the burger itself. The duck egg was clutch with a runny yolk, and you get a huge slab of pork belly. But the patty itself was underdone for both me and another mate. Mine was between medium rare and rare even though I ordered medium. My friend ordered medium rare but his was underdone as well. With the burger too soft, the runny yolk that's normally awesome become unpleasant to eat. Maybe it's an off day, but 0/2 isn't too hot.   I think this place is a bit pricey, but those tots and burger I did manage to enjoy were great. I'd love to come back and have my faith restored, but my dinner was on a shaky note.
OMG. Go eat here if you want your taste buds to thank you!!!  Start off with the Brussels Sprouts with a fried egg.   Save room for the savory Carrot Cake.

Staff Food Ambience Drinks FOOD music CARROT CAKE WITH BACON! MORE FOOD!!  This spot made my top 5 places to eat real quick, ive gone through most of the menu, and everything has been phenomenal. All unique with their own flavors, modern ideas with a old school twist.

What an interesting piggy place!! Haha / I mean that in a food sense and not in a selfish sense.   Anyway, the giant branded P&P pig on the wall just jumps out when you walk in.  The staff wore shirts with the phrase "Chicks dig the belly." Pretty funny! Friendly staff. TVs near to watch sports.    Then comes the food. :)  Starters: pork belly, chick pea pancake, Harissa, blue cheese n fig.  -This was a great combination put together. The pork belly was good but I've had ones that was more prepared to melt in the mouth.   Soup & Salad: golden beets, watercress, frisée, blue cheese crema, candied pecans, pomegranate, grape molasses with a side of pork belly. - Yummy in my tummy! This gives a balance of light but filling plate.   The Big Show: grilled hangar steak with fingerling potatoes, spinach, pickled beech mushrooms, chimichurri sauce  - Made medium well. Slight red. A little tough but probably don't wanna send it back just in case - ya know?   Sammies: smoked pot roast, caramelized onions, havarti, horseradish cream on white  hoagie bread with side of dump truck fries - Pot roast tasted like any other pot roast. Some pieces were moist. Others were dry. Caramelized onions are always a must. The fries were like any other fries too. Overall content. :)   Sweets: chocolate pecan pie with a scoop of vanilla ice cream - This is new for me and a win. Delighted with "new."   On the way out I just noticed a cute little piggy bank sitting on an entrance barrel. (Don't know how I missed that. Oh yeah- the gigantic P&P pig on the wall!!). Almost wanted to take it but of course I won't!   A place to enjoy pork belly!! ;)

Multiple businesses have tried to make it at this location, but I'm really hoping Pig & Pickle is here to stay! My wife and I have already been here twice since they opened, and I know we'll be back many more times.  The menu isn't very long, but everything we've had on it has been outstanding. The service is also friendly and helpful. And the actual restaurant is well decorated and has a bustling, but not loud, vibe to it. Keep up the great work Pig & Pickle!

Full posted review and photos at: http://forkvsfood.com/pig-and-pickle ------------------  Initial observations at Pig and Pickle are that it's more affordable than Atlas and the menu is loaded with straight-forward, delicious rustic food with just enough global influence to make it interesting.  I'd have to say that the Pig and Pickle really delivered, especially for this being their opening weekend. The food had a nice honesty to it, the price was affordable and the service was good. There wasn't much negative to say about the experience, other than quibbling over minor details and lack of bread with charcuterie. I look forward to return visits, and I'm eager to watch the restaurant and chefs earn some well-deserved buzz in the near future.

I don't generally review places I been to only once, but I feel it's important that future first-time patrons know that this place is probably not what you'd expect. Don't go here expecting to get a bbq pork sandwich and a beer for less than $20. Go somewhere else!  That said, after staring at the menu somewhat undecidedly for quite a while, I landed on a sliced roast beef sandwich (the closest I could get to what I really wanted), the dump truck salad and their tot of the day, and thoroughly enjoyed my meal. The food, while somewhat intimidating, is really genuinely good here. Our server was back to check on us pretty frequently and was even nice enough to shut off the misters when we thought it was too nice outside to have them on. Their patio is dog friendly, which I love, and I also enjoyed that it was off the beaten path of Old Town. It's nearby, but definitely sets itself apart from the rest of the restaurants in the area. Definitely a place to try, especially if you're one with an advance palate!

Always 5*! Food is yummy, always creating great food with local ingredients. Brunch, lunch, hh,  dinner or late snacks always so good! Drinks are something else, from the classics to a great new creation and some good perfect selection of beers -tap or bottle- just the best place for dinner in South Scottsdale

One of my favorite spots to eat in South Scottsdale! Awesome variety of beer and mixed drinks. Service is friendly and quick and if you are lucky, they have live music every now and then. Recommendations: pork shoulder tostadas, tot of the day, duck breast with wild rice. Can't wait for my next visit.
So I love pigs and pickles, so I decided to make my way out with a rather beautiful lady type (shwing). We got here and the place was

I'd heard great things about this place so was excited to try it, but found it to be okay. We waited around to order, then finally had a server take an order right before Happy Hour ended to get it in before the deadline. Thoughtful, I suppose, but he wouldn't have had to rush had he stopped by the rest of the time we were waiting.  Went with lighter fare, but saw and sampled a few of other dishes around the table. Nothing was bad, but also nothing blew me away. Solid middle of the road across the board. All considered it is a place I wouldn't mind going back to if a friend picked it out, but doubt I'll be back on my own.
Awesome good food. Great flavor and very unique. Service wasn't great, but food made up for it.

Went with 2 friends, had the Brussels sprouts, broccoli soup, apocalypse burger and grits.  Service was impeccable, food was tasty, balanced, well made and presented.  Make an effort to visit, atmosphere was perfect wine and beer lists are long.  Pricing hits the spot too.

Me and Mr. T came here last night. We inadvertently made it in time for happy hour since our movie at Camelview was sold out. I was impressed they have happy hour on Saturdays, but the pricing was less so. A dollar off wine by the glass (5 to choose from), well drinks, sandwiches, and apps.  Nothing on their "old school" cocktail list called out to me (which is extremely unusual), so I got a greyhound. It was delicious with fresh-squeezed ruby red grapefruit. My husband went with their ultra smooth mai tai. I'm not sure if it was smooth because it was blended well or just light with the booze.  We got the $4 plate of pickles. I figured these had to be good given the name of the restaurant. There were several varieties on the plate including grapes (yum!), spicy dill, bread and butter, fennel, sunomono, and watermelon rind (the highlight of our entire meal).  The vegan burger had a nice flavor, but it fell apart with the first bite and continued to do so as I ate it. The burger chunks were good with the dump truck salad though. Perhaps P&P needs to bite the bullet and just do this as a vegetarian burger with eggs added so that it binds properly. My husband thought his beef sandwich was just ok. I tried not to steal too many fries off his plate. Those were delicious and definitely not frozen.  Overall, it was an all right experience. We wouldn't come back here on our own, but we wouldn't say no if someone suggested P&P either.

Not impressed. I was with a large group, so that might have been that. I was late and everyone else had already ordered. The server acknowledged me as the straggler or so I thought. I asked for a drink menu and a regular menu and he gave me the drink menu and he came back to the other end of the table a couple times leaving me still drink-less. After that he didn't ask about food and one of the guys in my party went up to him to tell him I was still looking to order. Everyone else received their food before I even ordered. I should have just given up right there, but I was starving. I ordered the apocalypse sow with salad. Not as good as I expected. I felt it was dry and lacking flavor. The aoli was just plopped in the middle. The meat was crumbling and I had to just eat it with a knife and fork. Should have just got the soup.

Dined here Tuesday night with my team after work (roughly 10pm) and the team along with myself found this place to be excellent in all aspects! Although it was late (usually servers are in a hurry to get you up and out) the server was very friendly and accommodating, I wish I could remember his name so I could give him the credit. They have an extensive reverse happy hour menu which is great for late workers and have great cocktails. I got two dishes. The fried Brussels sprouts which were amazing with pork belly added and I also got the duck fat fries which I wasn't to crazy about but, all my friends food was great. In conclusion  Service - 5/5 Food- 4.5/5 Value- 5/5

Stopped in during a visit to Phoenix area.  The entrees were a bit mixed, we had the grilled bavette and the Cuban pickle crisis.  The steak was fantastic and would recommend.  The Cuban was good if your in the mood but not great. For drinks the beer selection looked good, my fiance had wine which was pretty bad and didn't end up drinking more than a sip.  The service was great, they were very friendly which was great.  They actually had a band in playing while we are and they were fantastic which made for a great atmosphere.

Amazing flavor. Amazing food. Amazing service. Had the trout and it was so buttery. My husband had the shrimp and grits. He said it was outstanding. The owner turned us on to a sampling of the house made bread and they were outstanding, packed with favor - especially when topped with the bacon jam or the salted butter- YUM! We split a bowl of their scrumptious soup. It was delicious. Also tried the beet salad and were surprised by all the flavor. We will come back. A must try!

This place is amazing! I'm from California and have never been here before. I love the concept, and how fresh everything was. We got there and it was happy hour and yes, it made me very happy. I would like to come back and try the dinner menu. Till next time when we come back to AZ! Our sever was super cool. She took her time and explain the menu items. She had a great personality too. Everything we got was delicious! My favorite was the dump trunk salad

My friend and I were pretty disappointed. Everything sounded so great and unique, but my mussels with chorizo just tasted burnt...I'm not even sure how you would burn something like that, but I digress. I can't even remember what my friend ordered, but again, it was something that appealed to our foodie sense on paper, but was nothing too special in actuality. Too bad...

Usually Yelp reviewers are pretty right on, but not in this case.  I give the one star for the nice waiter.  The food was awful and over priced.  The cod bites appetizer had 4 small (half dollar size) pieces of fish with about 20 soggy french fries.  The pork pot roast sammy had a nice burnt roll, that actually cut the roof of my mouth.  Very little meat in the sandwich and half of it was un-chewable fat.  The flavor of the inside onion, cheese and butter was good.  I ordered the tots for an additional $1.00 and you only get two small potato creations.  These were decent but not great.  I was surprised that the waiter did not mention anything when he took my plate with a pile of chewed up fat on it.  I think he sees the writing on the wall and didn't really give a hoot.  I would suggest he starts looking for a new job.  This place has been open for three weeks and I am positive that most of these reviews have been made by friends or family members.  I have lived in Scottsdale for over 40 years and have seen many places come and go.  This place will go.

Very much enjoyed the Charcuterie Plate and the house made pickles. Pork Tostadas were delish.  Props to the bar: These folks = extraordinary cocktail crafters.  Thanks for serving Hendricks with the appropriate garnish!  :-))
Great food and awesome service. The cuban pickle crisis sandwich is absolutely delicious!

This restaurant is SO good. Came in with my family of 6 and sat near the bar. Server was a gentlemen with flawless silver locks and was absolutely stellar. (used to manage a restaurant so I know good service) all food and drink tasted delish. Props to Skot the bartender and props to the kitchen for speedy and perfectly executed bills. NEW FAV OF SCOTSDALE!

This is the hardest thing for me to do, but I have integrity and I believe it is in public interest to document when you have an issue with food at a restaurant; people deserve honest reviews.  I had a couple shards of hard plastic in my Pig and Pickle Eggs Benedict.  These shards were hard enough to cause some serious damage if swallowed, so I'm glad that I am a good chewer.  Although the service was stellar and the food tasted great up until that point, I'm sad that employees did not recognize and then throw away batches of food that might have been contaminated by a broken holding container.    I feel like two-stars is enough to document that this occurred for future visitors.  I was compensated for my meal and I was happy with how this was dealt with, but I can never return.

Went in to Pig and Pickle on a Monday with a grip of chefs and foodies around 11 to find more than 20 or 30 people all looking to be enjoying themselves at this sparsely decorated gem in a strip mall.  The dining room is decorated with a giant wall of the silhouette of a pig and the rest of the room with local artwork, including a gangster Marilyn Monroe, I'm a fan. The drinks list included small batch boozes along with great beers by the bottle and tap.   On to the best part of the place, of course, the food.  We all ordered different things to share and get a full experience of their late night menu.  Different than their regular hours menu of course.  I got the pork tostadas with kim chee and the pickles plate.  Both were delicious and the kim chee actually had a little funk to it that I appreciate.  The pickles were great too and a  good assortment with grapes being the star along with green beans, fennel, beets, and onions.  My friends got the burger which was juicy and cooked perfectly on a flatbread that fell apart a little bit.  We also all tried the Tot of the day which was prosciutto and some sort of cheese that I forget, also tasty.  Possibly the best tot I've had.  We also tried the croque madam which was executed well with creamy mornay and perfect runny eggs but the star of the night was the braised pork leg which anyone there late night must have.  Perfectly tender with a crispy sear and delicious braised butter beans with tomatoes.   Pig and Pickle is worth every penny and I will sure be back for my late night after work cravings for local goodness.  Oh did I mention 2.50 tall boy PBRs and coozies lol.

I can't comment on the food because right before we were about to order the waitress let us know that 4 out of the 9 items on the menu they were out of, so we decided to go elsewhere. Drinks were good. But we won't be back.
Pretty mediocre food, extremely slow service. Good atmosphere and good potential but was disappointed. Could've been an off night.

Great wine by the glass choices. I had the bone marrow appetizer and it was my favorite taste of the night: rich, smooth, and the pickled grapes were a perfect pairing. The entrees were a little disappointing. I tried the porchetta and the duck. The porchetta was way overcooked and dry and the gnocchi that accompanied it was burnt on one side and raw on the other. The orange sauce on the duck was too sweet for me and the duck itself was a little chewy. I would've loved a crispy skin on the bird as well.

The pricing for this establishment is a little steep.  But where they earn my praise is this is one of the few artisan establishments which allows dogs on the patio.  The cuisine is always top notch, and the patio can make a relaxing experience watching the streetscape on Thomas Road.  The music is a little rough, but the place is clean and the ambience is there.

It's always a bummer to see a spot you enjoyed in the past- slide downhill in such palpable fashion.   I used to come here for brunch and happy hour. When a friend I haven't seen in a long time suggested getting drinks- I said let's hit P&P.   Got there a bit after 4 and the place was empty except for one high top.  I found my friend and joined her. It took a looong time to have anyone check on our table, which is odd since it was dead. I tried to order a drink off the happy hour menu but they were missing an ingredient.  I was surprised there was no offer to substitute something else or offer an alternative. Instead I said I guess I needed more time. My friend suggested I just get that drink minus one ingredient, since it would likely taste good anyway. When the server came back I asked to do that, and she seemed totally flummoxed and said she didn't know if they could do that- but she would check with the bar. Five minutes later my drink shows up and miraculously the missing ingredient is now back in stock.   For food we ordered pork tacos and an order of Mac and cheese. Both items were $5 on happy hour; and the server asked if we wanted to add pork belly into the Mac and cheese. I assumed it would be an extra buck, or maybe a little more- but I had to laugh when the bill arrived and it was an extra $4 for some bubble gum-like pork belly. The add-on costs nearly the full price as the dish its supposed to enhance.   The tacos were TINY. If you've ever seen the YouTube videos of the hamsters eating tiny food- then you've seen  this food.  I understand it's a happy hour small plate situation- but it was still pretty weak.  The Mac and cheese was abysmal. It looked like Mac and cheese but had no discernible flavor of any kind. It was so odd. The dish desperately needed salt, as it was so so so bland. Sadly the table also needed salt but there was none, and our server was no where to be found.   Another odd thing that killed the ambiance, as there were two streams of music. The overhead music and then the kitchen was blasting death metal, at an oddly high volume. I love music and like to hear it everywhere- but when it is blasting into a dining area, that's just unprofessional  and basically sends and overall message of apathy- which makes sense when you take into account the poor service, tasteless food, and garbage drinks.   I don't know what the hell happened to this once great place- but if I were the owners I would be pretty nervous about my future. I wish this place all the best- but they gotta get this figured out.

Like a lot of people have already said,  if you aren't ordering the pork shoulder tostadas, you're doing it wrong.  It's an amazing and unique appetizer.  The rest of the menu is also excellent (such as the pork shank). It's worth the slightly higher price.

Holy wow! This restaurant is just a couple miles from my house, but I avoided it thinking it was some "hipster, fruiffy food" joint. Well, it kind of is, LOL. But SO delicious! From the decor to the food to the staff, everything about this place has made me a regular customer. Not somewhere you want to go if you're super-picky (you know who you are, "I wanna substitute everything" folks), but if you've got working taste buds, you are in for a treat. I had the Apocalypse Sow burger..... *drool* The french fries are some of the best I've had. My 2 year old loved the grilled cheese sandwich and (aside from the lack of a changing table in the bathroom), it was super family-friendly. They've got a bar set off to the side with two flatscreens to watch the games, and their drink menu is twice the size of their dinner menu, haha. Add a sweet side patio for outdoor dining, and it couldn't get much better than this!

The menu is a little different than your typical BBQ place. I might even call it eclectic. There were only a couple of things I would try. Most of the other choices had ingredients I don't care for.  Went there for lunch. I had the Cuban sandwich my wife had the Croque madame. They were very good although the Ciabatta bread on the Cuban didn't hold up the the sandwich. It fell apart. They do give you a good sized portion. I think prices could be lowered and portion sizes reduced as neither one of us could finish our meal.  The service was not very good. Waited a long time for the waiter to come by, he only came by one time during our meal, we could have used refills on our drinks. We were finished and waited a long time for him to get our check. Another table had the same experience with the same waiter. Unfortunately, he was the only server working at this time. There were only 4 tables for him to cover.  We won't go back as there is just not enough on the menu I like.
Outstanding.  Pork leg, tots, beers, food.  Good.  Now go eat.

Stopped here simply because we liked the name. Will return because the food is PHENOMENAL!  We had the Cuban and the Apocalypse Sow. Delicious, divine, simply the yummiest "sammies" I think I've ever had. Can't wait to go back.

The Brussels sprouts, beat salad, tostada appetizer and the pork shank are delicious. The service is probably one of the worst. The Foie Gras was so salty that it was like eating salt packed sardines that weren't rinsed - sad because it was excellent last week. The tater tots were basically like round croquettes with no filling (they were supposed to be filled with ham and cheese), and we were told that they would be exploding with goodness... They were like deep fried mashed potatoes. The Dump Truck salad, and, as I mentioned before, the beat salad were my favorites. I will come back again for sure but will not anticipate great service.

This place quickly became my fav neighborhood restaurant and bar. They have a great selection of craft beers!  The food is unique and very tasty.  The burgers are big and the fries are seasoned  nicely.  The service is very fast and friendly.  The decor I love: very industrial with cool local art and wood accent walls.   If you want a cool restaurant and bar you gotta check out the pig!

Just driving by this place makes my mouth water! I don't know if the air around Pig & Pickle actually smells like bacon or if it's just my imagination getting the best of me.  Service was friendly and prompt. I had the porchetta which was absolutely amazing. Each bite had a slightly different taste and texture. The inner portion was a little bit spicy and the outer portion was like bacon--but better (how is that possible?). I also had the pork tacos with kimchi and they were great! Tender, shredded pork with kimchi on top. The kimchi wasn't at all overwhelming.  And for dessert--the nutella ice cream. This is a game changer for me! I don't usually order dessert because I always overdo it during dinner, but thankfully my date insisted. It was delicious and I found myself continuing to dream about that ice cream and figure out when I can have it again. I can't wait to go back to Pig & Pickle--my new goal might be to try everything on their menu!

My first 5 star review and you'll see why  Fiancée and I wanted to try this as I'm all about what you can do with meat.  Grabbed a seat at the bar and immediately had a menu and two waters.  Bartender help my girl out with her mixed drink which was a ginger tequila.  Not a tequila guy but darn did that taste great.  Bartender definitely took his time making it and could tell he cared how everything was.  Now of course I went for the apocalypse "sow" which made this a 5 star review.  Very tender pork burger, homemade aioli and of course bacon and cheese.  Not much else but not much else was needed.  The spices and tenderness said it all.  Served with a side of homemade fries that were perfect.  Fiancé had the shrimp and grits.  She loved it, Looked awesome, ample size but I was so focused on my burger I was full by the time I thought about a bite.    Will I be back? You bet....Will I be back this week?  You bet!
Love this place. Charcuterie platter is always worth it, great place to hang with friends and of course my mom!

I've been here twice now and this time the whole restaurant was redone and I REALLY love how they've redecorated! It's got a very cool, welcoming vibe and I will definitely return.  There are a couple of reasons I didn't 5-star this beauty. One: slow bartenders who don't greet you at all. You just sit there like an idiot until you're so dehydrated you ask for something to quench your thirst. NO BUENO. Socializing with everyone while a customer waiting for a drink is just bad form. Two: very, and I mean very, limited vegetarian menu. And while I get that 'pig' is in the name, not everyone participates in the eating of your cloven hoofed animal. So please expand that, it would be so awesome.  So, to get down to it. I sat at the bar and once I finally got my drink everything moved pretty smoothly. Good beer selection, by the way. Not original, but no Coors Light here so I consider it a good selection. I ordered some delicious fried Brussels sprouts with asiago & a farm fresh egg and let me tell you, that was probably the best I've ever eaten. I have no idea where my aversion to BR's came from. Probably because my mom didn't do them P&P style. DO NOT MISS THESE.   For dinner I had ratatouille with a blob of goat cheese in the middle. Not a great taste at all. I wouldn't have even ordered it had there been a bigger variety of veggie dishes to choose from and you can sure bet I won't order it again. It was odd. I don't even know who made this dish up, blech. At any rate it was P&P so they did make it better than any other place I've eaten it (the very few times I have) so there's that. Their menu changes often so hopefully they'll incorporate better selections.  All in all it's got a great vibe and for you meat eaters this place will seem like culinary heaven. It's a definite keeper for the ambiance alone!

So far so good. We went for happy hour & ordered almost everything on HH menu except for brussels sprouts & only because we were full from the other four things we ordered already. Very different & very delicious! We did find multiple items to be slightly over-salted but it did not take away from the dish. We can't wait to return to try other menu items. Highly recommend!
Hands down, the BLT is the best sandwich I have ever had. Period.   A true gastronomical experience.

Holy cow this place is amazing. I don't know how long i have had this place bookmarked to try but i am so happy to finally eat here. Great happy hour food and drinks. We got the crispy skin brown butter trout which was so tasty! The smoked pot roast sammie was ginormous and incredible, especially when paired with tots and a fresh pickle. Yum. Our waitress was also phenomenal, she gave great recommendations and was on the ball the entire time.

I can't believe I've never been here and it's so close to my house! This place is fantastic. Came for happy hour and at first was disappointed that the food was so limited for HH, BUT they did not disappoint. The food is delicious and they definitely specialize in making drinks. Our server Ricky was incredibly courteous and attentive. I will be back to check out their dinner menu very soon!

THIS PLACE! I run a local restaurant, and on principle I have never yelped before. I sat at the bar, I had the foie...I downloaded the app and yelped.  Their hospitality is AMAZING. I cannot say enough about the culture in this restaurant.  The food is OUT OF CONTROL! Thoughtful menu with amazing choices that the foodiest foodie and the pickiest eater will love.  The bartenders are so humble and so accommodating. I cannot say enough!   Love. Just. Love.

I've never had a service as bad as this one. It's a shame because we've read all these great reviews and our whole party agreed that this was the worst experience we've ever had. (only giving 1 star because it won't allow me to post without one)   I'm a server, so I first hand understand and know how it is when dealing with parties of 5 or more people BUT the way we were treated and taken care of was not okay.   First off, our server Anthony was rude and paid no attention to any of us AND it wasn't even busy. A couple of people on our table didn't get water for 20 min because he was no where to be found. It took about 30 min before we could place an order. And his responses were short and rude. Everything was " yeah it says it right there" or " um yeah" or " um no." I'm sorry, but I'm pretty sure the sass isn't necessary when guests are asking a simple question. One of our friends asked for a side of ketchup two times and never even got it.  Second, our food was luke warm and my friends burger was under cooked.   When we asked for our bill we realized we all had gratuity already added to it and we asked our server about the gratuity, he gave us a sassy/rude response saying it's automatically on there. Which is fine, but again the attitude was not necessary.    Then Anthony came by faster then ever to pick up the checks that were signed. After he came to pick up the checks he was circling the table and noticed someone in our party writing a review. Anthony came up to our table and asked if there was any issues and then dropped a card with a managers name and number on it then continues to say that if we have problems to call the number. What was really upsetting was after giving us the card Anthony felt the need to come up and confront the guest he saw writing a review and said "I'll be seeing if you have issues on Yelp tomorrow" ( very rude and sassy AGAIN) AND he took the card with the managers number on it away from our table.   Him confronting someone in our party about a review is not only unprofessional and inappropriate but also none of his business.

Love this place! Food is bomb (Brussel sprouts, pork belly, tater tots, jam and toast to name a few). Love the salty dog cocktail. And the atmosphere is great, particularly when Austin Carthell is playing.

Yes. You should go!!  We were visiting from out of town & found this gem on yelp. Easy relaxed place with great food! This is an overdue review from 5 mo ago. But I remember the food ..& this place is great! The server was great, in the midst of our convo...you could tell he enjoyed who he worked for,  & knew the food! We chatted a lot about the food. I can't recall what we exactly  ordereded..but. We had the bone marrow appetizer. It tasted  like bone marrow.  We had a pork roll swhich on the  house made bread roll. Everything about it was soooo good with the balanced slather of mustard &  house made pickles...& the pork juices.  Nomnomnom. I had the mussels..in a white wine broth with house made chorizo! Oh the best chorizo we both ever had! Delicious paired with the mussels & my crusty bread to dip in all the lovely juices of the them both swimming together in my bowl. To top it off..the desert. Oh so memorable... the toasted butter browned carrot cake with fried sweet yam shavings , carmalized pecans, with a black pepper berry drizzled over it & yes..  a whipped cream goat cheese! Oh what a way to end a fabulous meal. Hubby & I absolutely loved that dessert..the food, the service. We again wish this establishment was in our state & near our neighborhood so we could support it... awwww. Shame it is hundreds of miles away.

Great food cooked with an eye for detail and flavor. My husband and I came here on a Friday for lunch. There were very few dining at that time, I'm told all the craze happens at night and for good reason, the place is hip and has a great atmosphere. That being said, people are missing out on their fantastic lunch menu. The bar selections are unique and there are a great many to choose from. We ordered the fried brussel sprouts and pork shoulder tostadas to start. They were both Delicious. We then went on to order the udon noodles and grilled hanger steak for our main dishes. Again, both were delicious! The steak was very juicy and full of flavor! The udon noodle dish was sweet, spicy, nutty and covered with a great assortment of fresh vegetables.  Great service, great food, great atmosphere!
Great happy hour, fun beer selection, and lots of random tasty pickled stuff.  Very unique place, and a new favorite!

okay...I'm still laughing at Rachel R.s review...it's called PIG and Pickle not Pickle and Pickle...what were you thinking?  anyway...  took wife and kids there after a day  in Sedona...  the Charcuterie (sp?) platter pickled eggs YEAH BABY!!!  pickled grapes nice....everything on that plate was amazing...steamed clams with chorizo in the sauce....whoa....yummy...the Pork Belly was the most amazing delightful bad thing to eat...I need another please....and even the Friday Fish Fry was good...but the dipping sauce e they brought with it made it taste completely amazing....service... well Christina was awesome....I mentioned the Cole slaw was bland but only in contrast to everything else...she had the chef spice it  up for me.......great service....

This is definitely one of my favorite places to visit, when I visit the area. I've been here several times and have yet to be disappointed.  A few of my repetitive favorites include the golden beet salad topped with pork belly, bone marrow, charcuterie board, pork belly appetizer, pork belly entree, foie gras, the Brussels sprouts with a fried egg and pork belly....and, wait, did I say pork belly? The meats and pickled foods on the charcuterie board are made in-house, as well as the breads.   The menu changes seasonally, so I can't wait to see what will appear next!  They also have a nice selection of craft drinks and beer to choose from. I usually go for something local and/or of the IPA variety.   The staff is friendly and efficient. I thought the price for every meal eaten here was reasonable. As far as gastropubs go, Pig & Pickle is my #1.
This place is awesome! We had alot of differnt drinks all of them were excellent. We had the tacos and tots both so good. The tots are to die for. They for sure are a must.

I love the Pig & Pickle... I ride my bike here sometimes and have dinner.
