I will come back to elaborate with pictures if Karma isn't able to finish it's job with the flood they had a week ago. Looks like you needed my well wishes after all.

FOODIE delight! Ambience is nice, casual and a bit noisy; it's a social hub in the dining room and the bar. A few on the patio. Menu changes often at the whim of the Chef, so your favorite might not be on the menu....opening your mind to a NEW favorite. Service is friendly, but not overwhelming and since the menu is very creative, the server has knowledge to guide you.  This is my 2nd time here and I will be back with friends.

This place is awesome. I had the cheese plate and mussels. The mussels were great until I had a bad one from the batch. I guess that's what can happen but it put a bad taste in my mouth for a couple hrs. Maybe a warning label???? Other than that I would go again but try something different

Gotta say that I've been here three times with friends and we all agree--food is amazing. Service?  Sort of like they are doing us a favor and frankly seem irritated we came in. We've had three different servers each time and it's all the same. Would it kill you guys to be fun and friendly?  Last night topped it off. Friends from Ahwatukee drove all the way to meet us for Happy Hour. We ordered drinks and a few appetizers. Before we finished them our server removed our plates and silverware. We had to call him back to say we weren't finished and could we have our plates back. Did he say "Sorry"?  Nope. Just grumpy we asked.

Great craft selection awesome vibe. Concept is simple yet very strong "Pig n Pickle," is a great late night spot with crazy good food. The bartenders are wicked friendly and will remember your name, you will quickly feel like a regular. Good range of harder liquors as well.

This place was bomb.   The pork belly appetizer was super tender and delicious. I got The Nancy, which is a veggie sandwich with a shiz ton of brie on it, so you  know it was good. My favorite part of the meal may have been the tater tots... Such fancy and detectable tots stuffed with bacon and cheese and herbs. The service was awesome, too! The waiter had great suggestions. Some random bar tender yelled, "See you tomorrow!" when we left, which was pretty hilarious.   Okay, first Yelp review: complete.

Flew to the Phoenix area for the first time to visit a friend and went to Pig & Pickle for a Sunday brunch. I ordered the ground burger, medium rare, and my friend ordered the P&P Benedict. My burger came out medium but I'm used to that at this point. Besides that, it was absolutely delicious and my friend said her p&p benedict was heavenly. Of course we had to order mimosas and bloody sconnie. Both drinks came out fresh and delicious. All in all, this place is top notch. Definitely will plan another trip when I visit Phoenix again

Feels more like Portland then Scottsdale which is very welcome.  A very accommodating staff and a menu that allows you to explore alternative pieces of animal from the comfort of your middle American sensibilities.

This restaurant was highly recommended to me and my family, so we decided to try venturing outside of our comfort zone and trying a new restaurant. As the name implies, the menu is mainly focused on meat and pickled items. I had the pork belly that was to die for. My dad had the pork burger - topped with bacon, it seemed like an item from the Heart Attack Grill's menu, but he thoroughly enjoyed it. P&P has a great beer and wine list. Very friendly service and a relaxed atmosphere. We'll be back when we're in the area again!

Had our last dinner of the night before we left Arizona the next day. Boyfriend came across this cute place called "Pig & Pickles". We came on a Monday night of Memorial Day, assuming that everyone has work the next day, this place was pretty empty around 9pm.   We did not know they were part of the Arizona Restaurant week, so we were curious of what they had for it. After overlooking menu, it was $30 per person for 3 course, so we each decided to get it and share.  First Course: + roasted bone marrow+green garlic & spring onion compote  Two bone marrows were served under green garlic spring onions and a side of sliced bread. Delicious when you scoop some marrow onto the bread then add a bit of the green garlic spring onion and yum  +mushroom crostini+pistachio pesto Mushroom crostini in pistachio pesto was served on top of two sliced toast. Mushrooms well sauteed and the flavors were good.  Second Course:  + the dump truck' - mixed lettuces, shaved veggies, seeds, cucumber and shallot vinaigrette  Loved how the dressing was light and everything was fresh.  +wedge salad - bacon, egg, cucumber, tomato, radish and buttermilk bleu cheese Not a bleu cheese person, however, boyfriend enjoyed it. You can request to put the dressing on the side. Crunchy wedges!  Third Course: crispy skin chicken - bacony red potatoes, creamed leaks, arugula Chicken was flavorful and very crispy. You just need to take a small piece of the chicken and eat it with the potatoe, creamed leaks and arugula.  + pork porchetta - roasted pork belly, homemade sausage, creamed corn, heirloom tomato & arugula Heaven in your mouth! A thick slice of pork belly wrapped around homemade sausage and served with creamed corn? The combination was just perfection. This is a must get if you love pork belly.   Overall, we loved our meals and sure did get full off of it. The meals were big and we were informed that we can purchase one restaurant of the week and share among two people, so it'll save you some bucks.
I had the eggs benedict and it was super silky and DELICIOUS!!!!! Jennifer was our server and she was amazing! Definitely going back for both the food and service!
Food is amazing, very foodie.  One of the few places in town that has great food late.

We came here because I had a restaurant.com gift certificate. We started with the pork belly, which was amazing...very tender and flavorful. Then we had the broccoli and brown ale soup, which was topped with bacon...heaven! I finished with the drunken chicken, which was a little different than I expected, but still very good. My husband had the pork burger and turkey-bacon tater tots, both of which were very good. Next time we are in Scottsdale, I think we will make it a point to come back.

We always have such a great experience here!  My husband and I stopped in and ordered fairly simple dishes, but the food had that amazing foodie wow factor.  The dump truck salad was super simple - greens, sliced cauliflower, sliced carrots, baby tomatoes, radishes with a light, fresh dressing that added to the effect.  It was so fresh, it tasted like we were eating on a farm!  Perfect to split.   The Friday fish fry (available all week) - their version of fish and chips - was some of the best I've ever had.  The descriptions of panko breading and vinegar flavor on the fries drew us out of our usual no-fry ordering.  Wow, this did not disappoint - fish cooked to perfection, bursting with light, fried flavor and the fries were lovely, as well!  Hurry in because the menu changes frequently, and this dish is worth the trip.  Ooh, and the service was impeccable, as usual!

You know it's been one killer experience after another here.  Great drinks, kick ass staff and food that is nothing short of cajones out magnificent.  No joke....You're taste-buds will be begging for more.  I have the utmost and sincerest faith in that.    I was here a little while back with a gal I am friends with.  I got a burger and she went healthy with a salad.  Nothing short of great.   I love these guys and I'm so glad they're in business.

Different yet satisfying. I'm a fan of exotic foods and this place was just what I was looking for in Phoenix/Scottsdale area! The drinks are on point too. Strong and flavorful! We only had two of the appetizers but I must admit that I really liked the menu and the eclectic variety offered. I'm looking forward to trying it again on my next Phoenix visit! :)

The BEST place for late night eats, night cap cocktails, or any kind of chill food or drink. Try the tots, bulkogi lettuce wraps, and/or pork shoulder tostadas. Great staff, great music, great food, great drinks.

P&P = Gastropub that caters to the restaurant industry folks after hours with some lively patrons, some interesting bar bites and libations. The in between hours aren't so bad either.  Plus an early and late version of HH.  This is one of those blink and you would miss it and definitely not on the radar for most visitors unless a local pointed you in their direction. It definitely has a cozy, neighborhood feel once inside that belies the edge of the strip mall location.   I happened upon the P & P after a charity golf tournament in the area. Some of the players in our group couldn't say enough good things about the P and P. We decided to meet up after getting cleaned up later in the evening. As the night meandered on the place began to fill with servers, bar keeps and chefs and all manner of industry folks made their way over.   We had already managed to grab several of the somewhat limited seating at the bar to sample some of the tasty treats on special after 10.  The pork shoulder tostados were my favorite, make no mistake there is a reason the word Pig is in their title. They have more than a few dishes with divine swine involved.   We also tried the duck fat fries( only late night) and the Bulgogi lettuce wraps. I have to say yes again to the fries but no to the lettuce wraps. The beef was just too sinew laden, chewy and tough and way too salty.   All in all the small group of us found the staff and barkeep super friendly, attentive and just made for a better dining and drinking experience. The place isn't so loud you or crowded that you can't have a conversation even as it fills up. I am sure it can get shoulder to shoulder during it's busiest hours but we didn't have that experience.  A nice hidden but not so secret neighborhood gem.

Great ambience, great beers. Why not 5 stars?? Ordered a cherry beer and a blueberry beer. Tasted really delicious. I guess they are seasonal and you might have to rush to get to try some.  Did not try food here though. So, prolly I'm gonna update this review after a try.
Outstanding! The pork burger was fantastic as well as the interestingly fabulous pork tostados!

Somehow on the way to pick up sandwiches for dinner, we ended up at Pig & Pickle.  We should plan on sandwiches for dinner more often!  There was quite the age range of customers which must be a testament to the quality of food.  I also must be in the upper range since I did notice it was extremely loud.  Definitely not a place for a quiet, romantic dinner.  But a great place for a great cocktail and equally great meal.  I had to forgo the cocktail instead having a boring sparkling water with lime.  But I was pleased to see mussels on the menu which is one of my favorite lighter meals.  It was a decent sized portion for a modest price of $15.  Served in a rich and flavorful broth of white wine, tomatoes, and creme fraiche with plenty left for soaking into your bread (I ordered extra bread).  I did get a grain of sand in a couple of them, but overall it was a nice dish.  My husband had the bone-in pork chop cooked perfectly with the slightest hint of pink still there.  He also gave a thumbs up to the accompanying succotash.  As for the oven roasted bone marrow he ordered, I did not go there.  It was a significantly smaller portion than served at Searsucker, but was also priced quite a bit lower at $9.  He did like it, however.  I should also note, service was excellent!  In fact, all the servers seemed to be doing a great job!

Sunday 10/16 at around 6:00PM. My boyfriend is in his 50s and is an F&B manager at a country club with over 35 years of food and beverage service. I'm in my 40s; I am now in medicine but I was a wine somm with over 20 years of my own F&B. We know both front and back of the house well. We love to dine out and appreciate service as much as good food. This was a casual night out for us. At P&P we were greeted and allowed to choose a seat outside. Our server was Jake. I asked him "how is business?" He said, "it's slow tonight - there's the Taco Fest and people that can afford to spend to money at restaurants are out of town". My boyfriend and I just looked at each other (....did he really just say that?)... He took our drink order as well as appetizers. He asked if we wanted waters. Our cocktails and appetizers arrived before the water was finally delivered. The Brussel sprouts app came out much quicker than we expected and we thought they were great. However, the lettuce wraps - 3 for $12. Somewhat over-salted, no sauce. In fact, it was as if they were made with soy sauce and a packet of taco seasoning. We were still hungry but had no desire to stay any longer. Jake asked us twice before our appetizers were finished if we wanted anything else. To put us out of our misery, after the second time he asked, I let him know, "we just stopped by for an quick appetizer and we will take the check." It took nearly 10 minutes for the check to arrive. Tito's on the rocks, a ginger beer, Brussel sprouts and lettuce wraps = $35. Gave him a credit card. When he returned for me to sign the check, he asked if we were finished with our food. We said yes, at which point he then reached through my arms (as I was signing the check) to retrieve every last plate and utensil on the table, and hurried away. A place that touts "we dig the pig" - and NO pork ribs? Something to consider. More important to consider is wait staff training. As I mentioned before, we both have a few years experience in the biz. We understand when and how things are done well and when things are not. We are not snobs; we do give a fair critique. Being insulted and hurried doesn't bode well. Customer service is of utmost importance. It wouldn't have mattered if the food was amazing - we will not return to P&P.

Walked in on a whim at about 630-7pm on a Saturday night with my man-friend.  The hostess told us it would be about 15 mins as they were full at the moment. No worries, the bf was just glad to have a tv with the game on in front of him.  Checked out the drink menu at the bar for a few minutes... Nice beer selection and good drink prices!  They have craft cocktails, but I went for a beer since they had Konig Ludwig. =)  For dinner, I debated on the pork tostadas and the vegan burger with bacon... The bacon is a FREE add-on!!  The waitress suggested pork tostadas, so thats what I had.  Quite tasty!! There were 3 tostadas with piles of pork! They had a great ginger aioli and crunchy/spicy kimchee. 2 of them filled me up, but I went ahead and ate the 3rd one since the bf was too full from his tri-tip dinner.  Needless to say, neither one of us had room for dessert.  The service was good and friendly and overall it was a good dinner.  The only thing I didn't care for was the $3 charge for a soda water at the bar when I ordered a beer. Fizzy water for 3 bucks?!  My bf almost exclusively chooses soda water/club soda over flat water, and I have never been charged for it when it comes out of the tap.  Just sayin.

First of all... The bread pudding was to die for. Save room for dessert or eat it first. The macaroni and cheese was very good. They didn't skimp on the cheese at all. Lots of it. The dump salad was very crunchy, just like I like it. Nice and fresh. And Rick, our waiter, couldn't have been better. I will definitely try this place again.

Yay! Rejoice! There is finally a foodie spot in south Scottsdale less than a mile away from me that brings some hipster cred to the corner of Hayden and Thomas Roads. The Pig & Pickle just opened, serving up a pork-heavy dinner menu paired with a variety of beers and handcrafted cocktails. While the interior gives off a sports bar vibe with an open kitchen, the menu features local ingredients in comfort food style dishes that give the place a warm, welcoming feel.  I had a really great vegan burger ($8), made with beans, grains and seeds. It was tasty and filling, and I really enjoyed the seasoned fries that came with it.  My friend got the creamy broccoli and and brown ale with cheddar soup ($7), which he said was great, as well as a pot roast sammie ($10), with carmelized onions, havarti and chile aioli. It looked like a hearty sandwich, and he said it really tasted fresh.  I'd go back to the Pig & Pickle to try their mac n' cheese -- and I'm also curious how their appetizer of pickles would stand out. The spot is also cool because it serves food until 1 a.m., which is great for Old Town Scottsdale nightclubbers who want a foodie fix.

My fiancé and I absolutely love this restaurant!  We've been here multiple times and enjoy their unique dishes and ever changing menu.  You have to have a creative pallet to truly appreciate this restaurant

I really want to like this restaurant because the pork belly appetizer is delish, I give that dish a 5 star but that's it. The drunken chicken is soupy and no flavor to it and I ask the server if it's suppose to be like that, her response is that's how we serve it here, so I split my burger with my friend bcoz he can't eat it except for the carrots that's in it. Now for the pork burger I forgot what's it's called, the bacon is over cooked and tough it's hurts my tooth to eat it and the pickle that goes with it is too sour, u can even eat it. When we paid I told the lady when we're ask how was the food we said ok to be polite she ask how can we make it better how are u suppose to answer that if we already address it before with the server and server didn't take care of it, we're not there to get a free meal so we paid and left. Thanks we have a discount coupon, I can't see paying a full price for that meal. We're not going back there.

I can't say enough great things about my first dinning experience at Pig and Pickle! I have wanted to try this place since they opened since it's a mile from my house, boy am I glad I did and sorry I waited so long!   Since it was so nice out my girlfriend and I decided to sit on the patio. Our server came over and loved his dry sense of humor! We got a few recommendations on the cocktails which every ingredient is made FRESH!!! I had the Pineapple Express and she had the Tropical Itch. They were both awesome!  Our server told us about the Tots and they are made fresh and different daily! We each tried one (they are huge like meatballs). OMG AMAZING!!!!  She was going to get the Fish Fry and I was going to get the Littleneck Clams but he reccommeded we eat something they are known for since it was our first time. I agreed. I was looking at the Duck Breast and he said it was great so I decided on that and my girlfriend got another pork dish that was stuffed (can't remember the name). OMG my duck was outstanding! One of the best dishes I can say I've had in quite a long time! I'm still craving it!!!!!  This is a great spot for late night eats/drinks or dinner. The service was great as well as the food. I would suggest this place to anyone and can't wait to go back soon!!!

I worked with Anthony to orchestrate a surprise birthday dinner for my husband. He went above and beyond to make the experience easy to plan and seamlessly implemented. Our waiter was wonderful. The food and drinks were delicious. We'll definitely be back!

I am a vegetarian so I was totally not wanting to try any place with "Pig" in it's name. I finally gave in and went with my husband who had been wanting to try it out. I was pleasantly surprised by how tasty the salads are and there are quite a few dishes I could eat. Since trying this place we have gone back 4 times and it's only been a month. I love everything I have tried and so does my husband. It's rare we find a place we can both enjoy.

I really love this place! The drinks are out of this world (recommend the gin bramble) and the food is delicious. They have a cool concept of this board that says "Take- Give" and it encourages people to buy others drinks. I think it is a cool "pay it forward" type of idea. I got the pork belly blt and it was so tasty! I was too chicken to get the stuffed tots but I heard they were good!
Love this place, right when you open the door this amazing smell hits!  Have never had anything bad there and they have some great HH specials!!

I came here on a Friday night. Not too crowded, we got a table right away.  Our waitress was really cute and friendly. The pork shanks appetizer was amazing! It has a buffalo type sauce. I had the frisée and arugula salad which was okay. A bit small. Pumpkin bread pudding was delicious. The pickles that came with the burgers are a little odd.. I like a good ole dill pickle though. Overall good experience and would go back.

what? a veggie burger with a $0 bacon option? how funny. we didn't consider this place at all for a dining option considering the name had "Pig" in it. but after a few yelp reviews, we wanted to try their homemade veggie burger.   it's in a rather unassuming corner of a strip mall, so again, i was expecting another BBQ joint. i was very wrong. the interior is modern, sleek, and homey at all once. we opted to sit outside, which has a dog friendly patio. they have more than a few vegetarian meal options. i had the vegetarian shepards pie. it was gigantic and piping hot. filled with mashed potatoes, carrots, huge amounts of kale, peas, beans...i could only muster half and took the other home for leftovers. it was extremely savory and i would definitely order it again.   their beer selection is impressive, but even more so is the means to obtain their ingredients. our server said everything...except the mussels...are bought right here in the valley and all parts of their food menu are made in house, including their bread. i was very impressed.   i hope this place stays around and becomes a staple of our 2 mile dining radius!

Every time I pass this place I want to stop and check it out. . . Today was the day and I must say we were less than pleased.  First, on a 110° day, the air wasn't working. We arrived for happy hour, but really wanted a real menu. HH food was lack luster:  Mac and cheese wasn't dreamy creamy excellence, it was dried up pasta with some cheese and toppings.  Salad was a little better than ok. I tried the marrow bones and while good, could have used something more on the plate to help cut the rich fattiness of the dish The beer could have been colder, but now I'm whining. Service was good, but I'm sorry, we won't be back.
This place had a really good vibe.  Live music and the server was really cool.  Good crispy skin trout.  Really good, burgers.  Not so good, tots.

I came here with a group of my friends for a going away dinner for one of them. My friends were already waiting for me and as I sat down the waiter , Anthony, was at our table but i don't even think he noticed that I got there because he didn't asked if I wanted a drink or anything. He stopped by our table every 20 minutes just to refill the water and barely even talked to us. When it came to ordering food I asked if the lamb sliders were good and he said they were his favorite. The lamb sliders came out and 50% of it was the bread so I took off the top bun and it was still disgusting. The duck fat fries were alright the fries were very hard. All in all I have no idea why this place has 4 stars the whole experience was awful and a waste of my money.

Read about this place sometime ago but stumbled upon it looking for some thing else during the lunch hour. This place is a fine tuned gourmet treat. Great pork items. All with an upgraded gourmet twist. Kim chi on pork tostadas (awesome!) Fennel in salads. all kinds of delicious variations that up the deliciousness factor of sandwiches and entrees. Craft cocktails. Microbrews and good wines. What is not to love about this place! Somebody has thought long and hard about the food here and delivers with attention to details and presentation. Nice open restaurant with an inviting bar. Open kitchen and friendly laid back atmosphere. Try it. You will love it.

I came here for the first time with my mom and my boyfriend based off a review in the Phoenix New Times. Right off the bat I loved this place. The decor is so cute, there are many pigs and pickles hanging around the dining room and the kitchen is open to the dining area which I love. Since my first time I've been here more than I can count and each time I've had the best food and have been waited on by the most knowledgeable and friendly staff ever.   The food here changes with the seasons and they offer fresh and local dishes which is refreshing since I like to try new things. Honestly you could get anything on the menu and it will be the most delicious thing you've eaten.
Just go. Great service and stoopid good vittles:) And bring you dog. Staff loves the canine!

I'm still a fan of this place! Recently enjoyed the pork rinds (chicharrones) and cheese plate over happy hour ($5 each) before digging into the Cuban Pickle Crisis for dinner. It was all great!   The cheese plate featured delicious bread, apricot preserves, dried cherries and delicious almonds along with two types of cheese: one soft and one semi-soft.   The chicharrones were still crackling for several minutes after being brought to the table. As fresh as they were they were not too hot to eat -- which is important because the snaps and pops made us want to dig in SO bad! They were crisp and had just the right amount of salt and paprika. It was a pretty big portion... with three of us enjoying them, there were still a few to take home!  The Cuban sandwich was GREAT! Each component: the ham, the pulled pork and the cheese were delicious on their own; and, together: they were out of this world! For my side, I chose the tots which are really more like mini potato croquets. Think: breaded and fried balls of creamy mashed potatoes! How could that NOT be good, right?

Went here for brunch. The menu is indeed pretty limited.   Service is here and there and seems pretty disorganized. They came back after taking our order to get my order again because they forgot.  I got the crab hash. They dropped something greenmixed with a fried egg on top. Before I dug into it, they took it away because they gave me someone else's plate. My plate came. It was also greenmixed with a fried egg on top so it made the mistake understandable but made me question in the variety of the food.  Anyways, I would not recommend the crab hash. It was surprisingly very creamy. It could be called "cream of crab hash". The flavors weren't there and of course, the texture was nonexistent. If I didn't know it was crab, I wouldn't know from tasting it. The only slight upside was the sprinkling of greens that gave it a crunch now and then.   Anyway, the food will seem a bit pretentious if you can't deliver on diverse offerings.   But nice people and unique restaurant hours.

We had a fantastic experience here last night! The day after St. Patrick's Day evidently made for a fairly slow Friday night. We were seated immediately, and taken care of well the entire time. My husband had the bone marrow, and I saw a smile on his face that let me know all of the stress of the day had disappeared. He said his duck was the best he's ever had. I'll take his word on that, I'm not a fan of duck. I have a sensitive stomach, and have to order carefully to avoid problems. I ordered the dump truck salad with no tomatoes and the dressing on the side. The vegetables were so fresh and full of flavor, that I never ended up even touching my dressing! It was so spectacular that I'm having difficulty gagging down this bagged salad from the grocery store as I write this review.  I also ordered the house made charcuterie, pickles and bread. The server was kind enough to make sure that I had bread without cheese or tomatoes to meet my needs. He even replaced the butter with a fabulous mustard that really enhanced the meats. My favorite of the evening was what I believe they called the hunter sausage. It made me break into my "happy food dance!" The spices were complex and not over powering. Some of the pickled items were a bit of a single note, and probably could benefit from some added dill, onions, or garlic in the brine. But the sweet pickles were the best I've had, and I'm usually not a fan.

I really, really wanted to like this place. Two of my favorite foods, right in the name!  But, alas. Went there for lunch today. Three occupied tables  in the whole place (what does that tell you?). Asked to split a $14 cuban sandwich, with two sides, NBD. Sandwich is delivered to the table on one plate. I ask the foodrunner/server if the chef will split it for us. Waiter sniffs, and says, "That's what THAT is for!" and nods at a steak knife on the table. Really? Saunters back and leaves our food in the open window until the cook can be found to cut it in half.  Unfortunately, it kind of went downhill from there. The Cuban had sweet pickles and not the expected dill. Had they been really good, it would have been NP. But this was a serious mound (as much as the meat) and we both had to pull them off. Over- dressed mustardy buns (and I love mustard too), a blandly dressed salad (too bad, the veggies were fresh), and the star of lunch - two potato "tots" - the whole experience averaged out to a really mediocre lunch. Even the dill pickle served on the plate was so vinegary tart I had to spit it out. And I love vinegar!   Between the snotty food runner (our main server was good) the disappointing mashup of my favorite foods, and pricey lunch menu, I won't be back. I'll get my pig and pickle fix elsewhere.

When it initially opened I gave it three stars.  It's been 4 or 5 stars since that time with a changing menu and great service.  Recently we had a group of eight dine there.  About half the people got sick.  It must have been one of the starter plates.  We had the salmon (one of our favorites), charcuterie and cheese plates. Nothing tasted off.   I'll still go there because the food, drinks and service are great, but I'm wondering who else got sick?
Bone marrow was interesting, not sure I would order it again as it tasted like eating a large chuck of fat.  The staff was very nice.

Service is slow. Forgot to refill waters. The pork marrow was pricey and disappointing. Pork liver was ok. The pork tostada literally smelled like my friends dirty Great Dane. It was very unpleasant . My entree was pulled pork sandwich and was also disappointing . It had too much melted oily cheese and too much bread. This place could put less serving on plates. Too much food that tastes bad.

First time at this restaurant, and it will now be on my list of favorites for Phoenix.  Worth the 20 minute drive from my hotel.  AYUP!  Drive from wherever you are to this restaurant while you're in the are.  Bacon flight?  Yes!  The ambience is casual.  The menu is spectacularly unique.  I've never had a breakfast like fried Brussels sprouts with an egg on top.  But it was one of the best breakfast meals I've ever had.  The fresh cut bacon on the side made this a meal to die for.  Go for breakfast, can't recommend it enough.

This place is awesome! Everything from drinks to dessert was full of whimsy and flavor.   Our cocktails were handcrafted and unique.   The bone marrow app was unexpectedly tasty.  The duck breast was a perfect medium rare with great flavor.  The hangar steak was tender and flavorful. In my perfect world, it could have used a pinch of salt.   The triple chocolate cheesecake was a perfect compliment to the french press coffee.   We will definitely be back.

Happy hour 4-6 pm with three wines, four beers and 8 appetizers.  Ordered the beer cheese dip with pickled veggies and jalepenos. Very good with just a slight kick.  Ordered roasted Brussels sprouts as an accompaniment tony main course of shrimp and grits.  Very good and eclectic menu. Food was very good!

I had wanted to try this place for a while so I met a friend here for lunch. I arrived first and sat at the bar for a while before I received service. Finally someone approached me and asked me if I was there for a job as the bartender. I said no but spent the entire lunch wondering what about me looked jobless. I thought it was funny and really has nothing to do with my rating.   Decent selection of beer on tap, I had a delicious IPA.  I ordered a burger with a fancy name & aioli mayo or some bullshit like that but it was basically a patty with bacon on top. It wasn't good at all, I only took a few bites but what I did eat sat in my stomach and made me feel gross all day.  The service never really got better but there was a speedy and fun glam guy working the patio that made me wish we would have moved out there once my buddy arrived.    I've wanted to give them another try but I associate the place with the gross feeling now and can't force myself to go back.

Stopped by this past Wednesday night after looking up the menu online. It looks like they have a very extensive bar, and the cocktail menu seemed well thought out to match the ambiance. Started off with the street corn. Very simple, and tasty with the perfect amount of spice. Ordered the apocalypse sow. It was a bit overwhelming and messy but I found it to be very enjoyable when I broke it down and ate it with a fork and knife. I was glad I ordered the tots with the meal. They change daily but mine were panko crusted with a mashed potato and sausage filling. Delicious. The service was excellent and the owner was there greeting the guests which is always a good sign. I really enjoyed my time here and would definitely come back next time I'm in the Phoenix area.

I have to say, normally I love this place, but today the pork belly is off, and if you're going to braise pork belly, you have to do it right every time. Half it is still on the plate b/c the fat is chewy and inedible. For pork belly novices, it should melt in your mouth. Customers shouldn't be gagging on it. This is especially true for a restaurant that prides itself on its  pork offerings. My boyfriend and I agree, this pork belly hurt our hearts.

This was so NOT what we were expecting. We truly expected a quaint little pub bistro feel with some great food. Hmmmm.   First off, the music is quite loud and the tables in the dining area were so high up, they come up to almost level with our chins. The waiter came by to make his suggestions. They were definitely his! AND we just couldn't hear each other. The waiter suggested giving us the tomato salad as an appetizer. I understood him to say it would be an appetizer "size". Then I finally ordered a "Nancy" sandwich. I thought it was a burger given the price and the location on the menu.   I was WRONG  on both counts.    The salad came and seemed appetizer size. NOPE. It was a hefty $14.50 for a small bed of arugula and a few slices of heirloom and cherry tomatoes topped with cream fresh. Then the "Nancy" came. I guess I read the menu wrong as it was listed under MAIN plates. Instead, I got a Brie sandwich with two slivers of avocado, onion, tomato, and a small garden salad. My partner couldn't eat the Brie. She said it was tainted. I ate about half.   When the waiter came back, I politely told him I thought our Nancy was a burger. He said: Oh no! I just thought you two were the Vegetarian types. He smiled and left. What??? ....BUT IF that were true, what are we doing going to "Pig & Pickle"?!?!?!?  Also, I was just shocked at the $13.50 charge for a cheese sandwich and $14.50 for a small rather simple tomato salad. The waiter insisted it came with a fresh baked roll and freshly made pickles. BTW They could keep the pickles. They were on the sweet side with some odd mixture of spices. Neither of us liked them at all.   Just feel it was a pricey experience.

Delicious!! I've been here several times and tried their sandwiches, salads, and pork belly! They smoke all their meats in house and you can taste the quality.  They have great drinks - I love the Bramble On and #ScottsdaleProblems (lol). They have a large selection of beers, too.  Every time I've gone there, the service was friendly and prompt. The menu is a bit tricky, with lots of fancy things I've never heard of, so the waiter had to explained our options and also suggested their favorites.  On a side note, this is probably not the best restaurant to take a vegetarian or vegan. Our friend only had a few options - fried brussel spouts (yum) and a couple of salads.

came with a friend to try out their HH menu - we ordered the tostadas, the banh mi, the broccoli cheddar soup, and the chedder cheese dip. while good, all of these dishes were variations of the same thing! i was also a wee bit late, so the food was lukewarm :/  the tostadas had a nice twist - pulled pork topped with house made kimchi! it was good, and i recommend this dish! the banh mi was a HEAPING assortment of pork on pork on pork - it was not my fave and i do love me some banh mi. it was just very meat heavy, and could have used a little more acidity and some veggies etc to add some more depth.   the broccoli cheddar soup was very very thick and very very cheddary and LOADED with bacon. it was good, but super heavy.  the cheese dip was kinda the same thing, but with a spicy kick and no broccoli or bacon. out of the 2, i'd recommend the dip.   at this point, we were WAY too full to attempt anything else, but decided we'd be back to try the sandwiches and entrees. so far, the food is a solid 3.   but to top off our dinner, we decided to get a dessert - the seared carrot cake. probably the best carrot cake i've ever had? it's lush and perfectly spiced, topped with the most amazing whipped goat cheese, fried carrot chips, and black pepper caramel, with a sprinkling of white raisins. to die for. i would probably come here just for this. the dessert is worthy of 5 stars - rounding this review to a 4.
Amazing food and booze experience! Can't wait to come back!!  Perfect service and perfect music/vibes!

This place is a great example of what a gastropub should be.  Nice decor, friendly and knowledgeable servers, good food and drinks.  I was here Saturday and enjoyed my experience.  The cocktails were well made and quite reasonably priced at $8-9.  My Sidecar was great.  I'd like to see a little more selection for the wines by the glass.  The duck ham salad was a nice start.  I really liked the duck tostada with kimchee and the tri tip was perfect.  An extra bonus was observing the hipster patrons with their little hats and skinny pants.  I'll be back!

Awesome! Dog friendly patio! Double awesome. The food was absolutely fantastic. I nibbled on a few items and was very impressed with the quality. Everything a pork lover could want. They even brought my dog a home-made peanut butter bacon treat! Excellent beer selection and the patio. Our server was Ashley and she was very attentive and made great recommendations on IPA's. I was really stoked when she split up our check even when we had split entire dishes she broke each check down to exactly what we had! You had me at bacon jelly. Awesome.
What a great little find!  The pork belly starter was my choice for a meal and it didn't disappoint. Good food, good atmosphere and good drinks!  Really what more can you ask for?

I signed up for Yelp just so I can write a review on this restaurant!!  There is not a month that goes by where I am not in some other large US city having  a nice meal and I have to say that the Pig & Pickle competes toe to toe.  This will for sure be a Top 20 Phoenix-Metro Restaurant!  I am already planning on being back in a few days.  Awesome service, great personalities with the staff, cool atmosphere, great drinks and absolutely ridiculously yummy food.  It has the friendliness of the Mid-West, a feel of a Kansas City steak restaurant, an eclectic menu of a San Francisco hot spot, and the cozy atmosphere of a Cheers bar.  Do yourself a favor and just go!!

Started with charcuterie, pickles and bread. It was interesting and most of it very good! I didn't appreciate the snout but two old Scottsdale bags seemed to enjoy a good snout every now and then... The pork porterhouse was slightly overdone, teetering seriously close to dry. Scott was a great bartender and very attentive.. The food was good but not 'go out of your way' good. I probably should have ordered something different...

Let me preface this by saying I'm NEVER the type to complain or even take the time to log into Yelp to share my opinion unless it's an awesome review but this deserves to be known. My good friend decided he wanted to try Pig & Pickle as he had been referred to the restaurant by a fellow KCCO-er. He knew that taking me there may be a stretch as I am a self proclaimed "5 year old eater" but what the heck he thought. When we sat down we weren't greeted right away by our waiter but no biggie. When he did come over he asked if we had ever been there and when we said no he did a good job at explaining the culture of the restaurant and the food (cool!) Once he went to actually take our order things went down hill. I ordered first and I half jokingly asked if they had a kids menu because for me the menu was a little out there (sorry for the foodies out there (including my friend) I'm sure I'm an embarrassment ;)) I mean c'mon he didn't even crack a smile at that he just looked at me like I was an idiot and said no. I then proceeded to order the burger and when I asked for pickles (it is in the name after all) he said "It will come with a pickle on the side but not on the burger" I then ordered the fries as the side and he very condescendingly said "already knew that!" My friend proceeded to order all the wonderful things he saw on the menu and the waiter was much more responsive and welcoming to him. Once we received our appetizer, the waiter came back and proceeded to talk to my friend about the secret menu and even showed him a picture on his phone of a specialty burger so obviously this waiter takes his food seriously. Which by the way I respect totally but throughout the rest of the meal the waiter completely ignored me and only acknowledged my friend. It really made me feel like he was punishing me because I ordered the burger (which so did my friend!) but I'm just not the adventurous eater...sue me! Even my friend noticed and said I feel like I'm eating by myself because he is blantantly ignoring you. I felt so uncomfortable the entire time I was there which was disappointing because my friend was enjoying his meal but not the service. So word to the wise...if you don't like to be too adventurous with your meal choices I would not recommend this place but if you are...you'd really enjoy it since the owners are actually the cooks (pretty cool!) So there's my two cents...if you get the server by the name of Sean (which I only found out because it was on the bill the I paid) beware...he may hurt your view of this potentially awesome restaurant. I will end on a good note to say the rest of the staff was much more friendly but there's definitely a bad apple.

We were in search of late night eats after flying into PHX at 9:30 since most non fast food places close around 10.  The name immediately caught my eye as pork and pickles are things I love to eat.  We arrived  around 11 pm.  There were a few patrons dining inside and at the bar as well as outside on the patio.  The late night menu was a good size as were looking for a light meal.  We ordered the tot of the day.  It's more of a potato croquette, but for $1, it's absolutely worth getting 1 per person.  The aioli had a nice spice and flavor to it.  We ordered the pickled things and our faves were the grapes and beets.  We dipped the pickled egg in the aioli.  I think that combo would make an awesome pickled deviled egg or pickled egg salad sandwich.  The liver and caramelized onion smear on toast was tasty, especially if you are a pâté fan.  The smear had an interesting smoky taste.  At $4, it's a steal. My bf had the burger and fries.  He said the burger was good but nothing special.  I ordered the shrimp and grits.  The portion size was large.  It wasn't what I expected.  It was more like a shrimp, sausage, and tomato stew on top of grits.  It was too spicy for my taste, but the cheesy grits had me going back for more as I wanted every last bit of grits.  I would have been happy with mostly grits and a few sautéed shrimp.  Overall, the meal was excellent.  With tax and tip, the 2 of us were well fed for $40.

I've heard lots of good thugs about pig and pickle so I had to try it out. My family went in for a cocktail after a dinner last Saturday night. The waiters were all really nice, and accommodating. We had a larger group, so that they pushed tables together right away. Everyone was impressed with their drink, but mine was the best by far! I highly recommend the cilantro margarita! It was the best margarita I've ever had, hands down! Another thing I had to try (but wasn't quite as impressed with) was the bone marrow. I knew I wanted to try it, but it wasn't easy to eat. I definitely don't regret trying it tho. The serving was huge! (Which I was glad for because it was $16) if everyone just had 1 or 2 bites, you could share this between 8! For us, 1 or 2 bites was good enough when you are eating what tastes like pure fat haha. But they kicker was at the end... you can get "the ludge!" They pour a shot of bourbon down the empty bone you just ate all the marrow out of! It was actually tasty and lots of fun! Great experience!

From out of town and stopped in because Yelp reviewed it highly. Ordered the P&P Club with salad! I inhaled it! It was delicious and just what I was looking for! the food was presented very nicely and the price was right! Highly recommended

Service is terrible.  Had to ask to be seated.  As servers stood around talking with customers about wine and food, i waited 10-15 minutes before someone finally asked if anyone had helped me.  That person then went over and pulled my server away from a conversation that had been going on since i had been seated.  Finally placed my order.  After a substantial wait, a chef came out with my meal and asked if i would like him to describe it for me.  After declining, i ate the mediocre entrée', paid my check and left.  I have dined in 5 star restaurants around the world.  This place needs to remember two things.  1. EVERY customer counts.  2. They are next to a Crazy Howie's Pizza in a strip mall, not in The Biltmore.  Service and food are mediocre at best.  Substantially overpriced!
My boyfriend and I fell in love with this place. The owner and the waitress we had were such sweethearts and THEY'RE DOG FRIENDLY! We had an amazing experience there.
What a great place! Great environment! Great food! Great drinks! I would recommend this place to anyone in the south Scottsdale area. Don't wait "just do it" lol

Perhaps my expectations of this restaurant were what led to a disappointing experience.  We were seated on the patio and greeted fairly quickly by our server,  however the hostess had forgotten to give us a drink menu so we had to send our server away until we could figure out a beverage. After that,  out server came around very rarely and didn't have much personality.    We like to try house cocktails,  and ordered two of their specialty drinks;  mine was decent (a pig and pickle take on an old fashioned) but my husband's was gross. He ordered one of their aged cocktails and it was so sweet he couldn't finish it. After that, we stuck to wine.   For dinner we ordered a pork burger and shrimp and grits. My husband's burger was really good,  but my dish was disappointing.  The menu didn't disclose that the shrimp and grits would be buried under a mess of sauce (some sort of tomato sauce I believe). The shrimp didn't seem to be seasoned at all, and were few and far between. The Andouille sausage overpowered the dish.

All three dishes were good. The easy over egg on Brussel sprouts and asiago cheese was delish, a perfect healthy and enjoyable brunch. Wow the crispy skin trout was very good too. The udon noodle meal was tasty but my 3rd fav of the morning. The staff is very standoffish especially on a slow and quiet day(service 3). I'll be back for the food but I hope the attitude improves.

I really like the concept of this place - meat and pickles, sour and sweet, everything made in-house.  Even the drink names are great.  Pig & pickle has a bit of an identity crisis though.  It's like casual pizzeria meets upscale gastro pub combined with anything pig related.  On the walls you'll find local art you can purchase and on the bar shelf you'll see are two plastic pigs humping.     The servers are very knowledgeable about food and are quite helpful, yet the bartenders goof around as if they are coffee baristas.  The drink menu's are awesome and the food choices are some of my favorite.  Unfortunately while the menu looks great, the food fails to deliver.  Love bone marrow - just not here.  It could have used some more time and the whatever bread crumb topping just didn't go.  In-house chorizo - nice touch - but I've had better at breakfast joints.  I really wanted to give this place 4 stars because it's the kind of place I like.  Underwhelming food made me want to give it 2 stars.  The charcuterie was great though - variety of meats and pickles - that deserves a star in itself.

If you're trying to go HAM for happy hour, go to Pig & Pickle. I had the rosé $5, well I had several... it was so good! Also ordered the Mac and cheese (added bacon) and tacos on happy hour both $5 (so cheap!) OMG the mac and cheese had WAY too much bacon.... said no one ever. The tacos where pork, obvi, and had just the right amount of spice. P & P has that mom and pop feel with the quality of a five star restaurant. Perfect place to pig out.

It really has become a favorite spot of mine. I am shocked and amazed they had fiddleheads when they had them.... they were delicious... the hanger steak and chimmichurri? Delucious! I love that the menu changes because it allows not only for seasonal items but awesome surprises as well.  It's almost like you get a present when the menu changes.. i like presents :-)   The Mississippi mud pie chocolate,  oh my goodness its so chocolate, is really good these days too.... although, that carrot cake? mmmmmm.... (not so awesome deconstructed in a to-go box), but even then still my fave... with mild peppery goodness, caramel whatever goatcheese frosting...  I always also enjoy the music playing ever so faintly in the background,  Tribe Called Quest, some Heiro, some Wu, some Bob, Blackalicious, Diagble Planets, J5, sometimes there's live music....   I dig.   Yup, I think Pig & Pickle makes my soul feel good.

Actually my 1st time is today & I have to say...  WoW, Awsome.  We had the House Made Charcuterie.   If you like smoke flavor in your food & don't mind some picked veggies with it. You will be  in Heaven w/this platter.

You haven't been?   GO!   The sooner the better!  How is that for a short Review? Been at least a dozen times and have eaten from ALL of their Menus (which do change periodically). Have NEVER been disappointed. The must haves:  * Pork Shoulder Tostadas (FABULOUS!) * Charcuterie (Always a treat and some surprises - pickled grapes? Delicious) * Duck - NOT Pig, but generally wonderful! * Vinegar Pie (usually combined with a fruit like Strawberry) MAGICAL!  Certainly has become one of my favorites and open late night or early morning, depending on your schedule. I BET IT WILL BECOME ONE OF YOUR FAVORITES AS WELL!

The food here is unreal, that apocalypse sow burger is a taste of the heavens. Also late night menu till 1am, can't beat that. Also the udon noodles are to die for. Even though the location could be better, I will be coming back.

The roasted Brussels Sprouts were life changing. I am addicted. The drinks were great & the food was delicious. Very pleased with this being my choice for new restaurant of the week! Loved my server, very knowledgeable. I will definitely be back.

Definitely not a preferred restaurant of mine. I came here one about a year ago and had poor service and unappetizing food. The server took an incredibly long time to get our drinks out and take our orders and then because we had a party of 8 he included 22% gratuity to our bill which was unheard of to me and everyone I was with and for the service and food we had gotten we were upset. My fish was drenched in oil and butter to a point where it was like a soup that my meal was steeping in. Definitely won't be coming back here any time soon.

This is one of my favorite restaurants. All the food is made from scratch using local farmers and ranchers the place is clean and they play good music. Everything on the menu is excellent. It's the type of food that will wake sleeping taste buds. The Pig and Pickle sets the bar for good food.

I go to the Pig & Pickle all of the time and it's a must to take friends to when they are visiting out of town.  My go to's are having an order of the pork tostadas and the brussel sprouts(do they just call them sprouts in Brussels?) as an appetizer and then I have one of their specialty big plates depending on what is new... with a delicious old fashioned.   Many of the staff have been there for a long time which is always something that I look for as a trait of an amazing restaurant.   Even my friends who don't like pork or pickles like this place.   You should go today... and next week too.   You wont regret it.

After hearing about the creative and delicious dishes at Pig & Pickle and learning about the Chefs' commitment to local produce, handcrafted cocktails, homegrown herbs, and fresh baked breads, I was excited to finally visit P&P to celebrate a friend's birthday.   Our server, Cat, was super friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. She was encouraging of us trying new things without being "pushy" which was quite refreshing. We ordered a round of cocktails and everyone was quite pleased with the humorously named drinks: "Red Headed Stepchild" (which came with a Sour Patch Kid!), "Salty Dog" (vodka, black/white hawaiian sea salts, fresh grapefruit) and the "Maggie" (homemade triple-sec and Hawaiian Sun strawberry/passionfruit juice - delicious but not too sweet). I ordered the "Bramble On" (gin, blackberry, lime juice, soda) because it sounded creative and refreshing, but since I'm not a "gin girl" I didn't find it quite as tasty as the other drinks.   The favorite appetizers that the group tried were the Pork Belly Tostadas ($9 for two large tostadas) and the Fried Brussels Sprouts with Asiago and a Farm Fresh Egg ($7). The Butternut Squash Soup with toasted pepitas was so delicious that I was glad that I had a small bowl for myself that I didn't have to share!   A specialty item on the menu tonight was Trotter Stuffed with Fennel Sausage. "Pied de Cochon," as this delicacy is known in France, is French for Pigs' Trotters or Pigs' Feet - yep, feet! Not surprisingly, this part is typically thrown away by butchers, but apparently this can be quite appetizing when it's prepared correctly (bones removed, cooked for hours, etc.). I don't love pork, so I passed on the opportunity to try this dish. The meat-lovers in the group tried the stuffed trotter and were disappointed that it wasn't quite as tender as expected, though they raved about the fennel sausage and the raspberry sauce that accompanied the dish. Our server noticed that most of the dish was left untouched and when she heard it wasn't quite as expected, she apologized and took it off our bill.   The main dishes were the the show stoppers of the night! The Golden Beet Salad ($9) was artfully presented and deliciously prepared with candied pecans, watercress, bleu cheese crema, and pomegranate seeds. The sandwiches or "sammies" come with your choice of fries, small "dump truck" salad, or tots for an extra $1. With all the other appetizers, two people split the "Nancy" (brie, avocado, tomato and shaved red onion on garlic rubbed bread) and were quite satisfied with the sammie and salad.   The birthday girl selected the "Chocolate Mud Cake" for dessert, which was beautifully presented with a candle and chocolate garnish on the side. The chocolate cake was moist, rich and delicious with a hint of sea salt that was nicely paired with a scoop of butter pecan ice cream.   After a fun birthday celebration that excited our taste buds, I'd love to come back to P&P to sample more of the menu and enjoy the happy hour pricing (4-6 pm daily).

My friend was raving about their menu so after a late night out on the town, we got there at 1:05am and unfortunately the kitchen closed at 1am.  We didn't make a big fuss cause well, it was 1am in the morning, we were not going to make anyone cook for us so late/early in the day! So my friend and I both had a cocktail each~ he had the manhattan martini and I had some drink for which I cannot remember but they were both well presented and delicious~ full of subtle flavor! The name Pig & Pickle is so deceiving since if I heard the name without coming to the joint, I would expect a hole in the wall BBQ place.  But I see from the many reviews this place has already received, the word is out that this place is a foodie heaven and a cool place to hang out. I will be back again, this time before the 1am gong hour so that I can try out their menu along with more of their delicious, libacious cocktails!

What's Pig & Pickle?  A hip restaurant that keeps tapping on something new and that they do.  I had been here a few times and they always have something new in their menu. Pork Belly and Bone Marrow are so sinful but after taking a bite I feel like I'm in heaven! So delicious! Mac n' Cheese is awesome! Talking about desserts like strawberry vinegar pie  and pumpkin bread pudding are such a delicious treats!

We had a great lunch here! Their 'tots' are delish and not like any normal tator tot you would get at another restaurant. They were large, fried mashed potato balls - you only get two with your meal (and a $1.50 additional charge) but they were well worth it. The only small complaint I have is regarding their alcohol. We ordered bloody Mary's and they left a bit to be desired, but were still on the pricey side. Next time, I'd probably just settle for a beer. Otherwise, great food, great atmosphere, and the host- who I think must have been the owner - was really friendly and helpful.

Stopped by here while visiting for spring training and was not disappointed. Started off with the beet salad which fresh and light. For the main course I had their pork burger which was delicious and full of flavor. Wrapped it up with the most amazing cookies and creme brûlée. Service was great and our waiter was super helpful with recommendations and explanations for how things were prepared. Will definitely be telling others to stop by here and hopefully will drop by again next spring.

New to Scottsdale (3rd day.) Los Angeles eater. Blown away. Everything about this restaurant clicks, from the service to the presentation. Of course the food is great, why else would I be writing?   What strikes me is their commitment to their craft. They are brave in their offerings; dishes that aren't your standard fate, but mouthwatering nonetheless.  I appreciate restaurants that aren't afraid to push the envelope, all while sourcing responsibly and with quality in mind.  The food? I've eaten twice. You have to try the charcuterie plate. Insane. House made.  The Cuban pickle crisis looked picturesque when served and exploded in my mouth. Their salad was the best I've had and I don't even like salad or the idea of fruits and nuts in it. Go figure.  Try it. Blame me if you don't like Pig & Pickle.

We had our corporate holiday party here last night and it BLEW US AWAY!!! The owners and staff are on top of their game. The service was impeccable, the food surpassed my expectations, and the drinks were scrumptious. The two owners take pride in their work and it is evident. My office will not stop talking about how amazing the party was last night. PS- our company is in the restaurant industry so we are kind of food snobs and you guys NAILED IT!!! I would highly recommend Pig and Pickle for lunch, dinner, or any private dining event...you will not regret it. Thanks again guys...you rock!!!

I came for dinner on Tuesday, and had a server named Sean (aka Science Rocket on the receipt), who provided possibly the worst service I've had to date at a restaurant. From the second he brought our table waters it was clear he didn't want to be serving me and the one other person I was with.  Once I ordered my entree he was immediately upset with my decision. He began arguing with me about what I should order instead, and started insulting me for not trying one of the entrees unique to the restaurant. Once he realized how rude he was acting he tried to make up for it by saying, "I'm not trying to be a dick." I cant think of a more unprofessional phrase you can say to two people who you are supposed to be serving.  I am not easily offended, but he talked down to my table like we were idiots for having preferences outside of his own. The person I was with got the "Apocalypse Sow"  pork burger and it was not worth the $7, let alone the $15 they charge. The meal I ordered, which caused Sean such frustration, was the fish and chips. They weren't bad, but judging with my server's opinion of them Pig & Pickle should probably take them off the menu and stick to what he likes.  I will not be back, but my suggestion to anyone who decides to go would be if you have Sean as a server don't order something he doesn't like or you might anger him.

This is our second visit. We celebrated my birthday this evening. Lamb chops with chimchurri, pork belly with sweet potato purée. Need I say more?  P&P is the top of the heap in Scottsdale dining. Ashley, our server, is also on the top of her game. Very professional. For dessert. The Elvis. Peanut butter cheesecake with strawberries caramelized bananas and bacon.

I've watched five restaurants go under in this same location. However, Pig & Pickle is the only restaurant that seem to figure it out. Best place ever!!! I would recommend everyone to go there. Staff is amazing. Food is great. If you want a tasty burger, this is the place to be. For the most part, the Owners are of a kind. They make everyone feel like their at home. This business will last a lifetime because of them and the staff they provide.

I'd give it 5 stars but for a few little glitches. Service was outstanding & the food was nearly perfect but for a few inconsistencies- too few broccoli in 1 soup & too much in another.  There were unopened clams & tons of celery in the clams. Besides that we loved the tots and the bone marrow. I've had marrow many times, including in France, and this was my favorite preparation. Luscious! Other favorites were the burgers, brisket, and steak. I loved the salad too. The beer list was exceptional but they only had 6 wines by the glass. All the desserts were wonderful. Favorites were the Elvis & the chocolate cake. We can't wait to go back again.

Went here last night for a light dinner with two girl friends. I've heard about this restaurant and have been meaning to go, so I was so excited to check it out.  The decor is super cute - dim lighting with an inviting bar and pig signs/pictures/designs everywhere - loved it! But the food was even better. We ordered just a few small plates to share. The pork belly (umm, yum! perfectly cooked and delicious tender and flavorful), the pork shoulder tostatas (they come 2 to an order and are piled high with shredded pork) and the shrimp & grits.  We had that kind of service where you don't notice they are there, but your water cup is always full and the empty plates are always promptly removed.   Loved it! I will be coming back here as soon as I can!

Nice ambience, good food, great whiskey selection, friendly servers and bartenders  Bone marrow: bomb diggity Veggie Supper: so flavorful and earthy! really great textures Beet Salad: refreshing and light  Loved it both times I've been here.

Nice atmosphere inside and I really enjoyed the hip-hop music that was playing. The hot wings were great and the sauce tasted like they made it in-house. The poutine was tasty in the spots where the fries soaked it up, but the fries near the outer edges were too crunchy and dry. Drink menu is a bit confusing with all the strange names. I had a smokey flavored drink which was okay and cost $8.   This place has potential once I find my favorite side dish and drink to go with the awesome hot wings.

We tried the pork belly. Albondagas soup and the broccoli cheese soup. The were all very good. I did not realize the soup came in two sizes. $5 was the small. Wish I had gotten the large but I just ate some of hubbies pork belly, wishing I had ordered some of my own. Pork belly and soup were enough for a good meal unless you are a big eater.

This restaurant is totally cute, hip, trendy, loud, and fun - I am just not sure if the raving yelp reviews lived up to my expectations. I came here specifically to try the brussel sprouts - I am a total fan of brussel sprouts. I decided to go on my yelp app to see what else I can try.  We came on a Friday night - around 9pm. There was a crowd of people and live music! Yay, live music. We sat down right away and the server wasn't that friendly, but didn't mind. I ordered the funktional drink and it was really strong. I guess it would be a really good drink if you are out with friends, talking the night away because this one drink can totally get you "happy".   We ordered the pork belly, the fried brussel sprouts, and the stuffed tater tots. All were very tasty. However, I guess for someone who cooks almost every day and can make restaurant quality food (patting myself on the back), including some bomb brussel sprouts, I wasn't wowed. The alcoholic drinks though, I would come back for especially if I want to forget my problems.

Food was just okay. We went in at about 11pm, and the service was fast, but the burger took ages to come out. The rest of our party had the hot dog and fries and finished their meal before the burger even made it to the table. The bacon in the burger was also chewy rather than crisp which made it difficult to eat.   Waiter was really nice, and the one alcoholic drinks our table ordered was well made.

Pig & Pickle, how you make me so happy!  This is my go to spot. The food is delicious and the staff is pretty good.  As someone who works in the industry I like that they stay open late to accomodate the night shift people.  Bf and I came here a long time ago based on yelp reviews and we've been coming back time and time again.  We've tried almost everything on the regular menu. Unfortunately, since our schedules have changed we haven't been able to enjoy the after 10pm menu in awhile.  You cant go wrong with the pork liver smear, bone marrow, and the newer pork belly starters.  The burger, hanger steak, and duck are amazing as well.  Large selection of beers and signature cocktails (with a good twist on some classics).  I think they make their own flavored bourbon, too.  I highly recommend this place. I've recommended it to people many times already.
Awesome place to eat and drink. Service is great and the owner Clayton is super helpful. Will definitely eat here again.
Good if you love Salt! The salt to dollar ratio is here is off the charts.  The automatic gratuity was a nice touch as well!

This place rocks!  I usually get my drinks from Scottie but today Shea showed off his magical drink mixology and I was not disappointed.  The food was divine as well, with Matt offering to box up my leftovers in his most manly of ways.  Ladies...visit these hotties for your drinks and you will not be disappointed.

They cure their own meat, pickle locally procured veggies, bake their own bread. Everything we ordered tasted delicious (actually the bread was just ok) - a charcuterie plate, and Brussel sprouts with bacon. The service was delightful.  If you are a vegetarian or do not eat pork, you would be a petty idiot to come here and then complain you didn't get what you want. Thats like going to Walmart and complaining they don't have Louis Vuitton..

Pig and Pickle's website says it best!   "...don't call us one dimensional....the idea behind the brand is all about balance. sweet needs sour...chocolate needs salt...we support local when possible, small farmers, happy animals, real sugar, real fat... we hand craft our cocktails, bake our bread daily, make our own aioli and grow our own herbs...."  This is just the kind of place you want to venture to for great cocktails, great bites, or an indulgent dinner.  Happy hour here is a fantastic way to familiarize yourself with their toothsome menu.  Featured are $5 Pupus such as the incomparable  "Dump Truck Salad with mixed lettuces (spring greens such as arugula and spinach), radish sprouts, fresh mint, baby shaved veggies like radish, cauliflower, cucumber, carrots, cherry tomato, sesame seeds, shaved fennel, chia, flax seed, and all doused with a wonderful cucumber and shallot vinaigrette, dusted with sea salt and cracked pepper.  Incredible!  You can also enjoy the likes of Creamy Broccoli and Brown Ale Soup, or a selection of the Chef's housemade charcuterie, all for $5 during HH which is 4-6p Daily.  The menu does change seasonally, so there are items such as the Crispy Chicken Tacos with Sriracha Aioli and slaw that may not always be on the menu.  With a name like "Pig and Pickle, I was unsurprised to find the chicken tacos lackluster.  Chicken was breaded and consequently dry and flavorless.  It would have been a great taco if the meat was rotisserie or marinated.  The aioli was wonderful, just the right amount of kick balanced by the cool of the red cabbage.    However!  The Pork liver and Caramelized Onion Smear, with pickled fennel and an apple raisin mustardo was exquisite.  It had a wonderfully smoky flavor, and the Hawaiian sea salt gave it so much more character.  Highly recommended for pate lovers.  Personally, I thought this plate was great without the pickled fennel or the mustardo - just the amazing sea salt.  The Wood Oven Roasted Bone Marrow came last, served with Crostini  and caramelized onions.  It tasted like a decadent and savory sweetbread butter, and it is no wonder why it is a staple here at P&P.  Drinks! With names like Salty Dog and the Stoney Baloney, you are in for a unique treat.  The Stoney had a unique melange of Hophead vodka, fresh lime, grapefruit juice, hop grapefruit bitters, an IPA float, and candied lemon rind.  The Salty dog their own version of the "Greyhound" with Hawaiian sea salts.  Although I did not venture into sampling the Dinner menu, I spied several tasty looking dishes such as Pork Porchetta and Mussels in White Wine.  With great service and equally great dishes, I am definitely coming back here for more!

Ive been here for lunch twice and have not been disappointed. There is plenty of parking and it's a nice looking facility. The staff are pleasant and knowledgeable about there eclectic menu and extensive list of beers. There are daily soup and sandwich specials. On my last visit I had a bagel with lox and it was hugh and was only about $9. It is large enough to share or provide another meal at home. My friend is still raving about their soups. We've been here twice and I can guarantee that we will return.
5 Stars....food, staff, vibe, location...such a welcome addition to the neighborhood. Phenomenal.

After taking another couple to the Pig's brunch last Sunday, I have been thinking about returning to the place for a specific  menu item....prime rib. I'm usually an omnivore if the food is done well. I have not been shy about sharing the places that do all food justice. Tonight, Peg and I returned to the P&P because we knew that the aforementioned prime rib was on the menu. OMG!  If you are tired of things that some restaurants try to do to this product via rubs, coatings, or anything else that is NOT just your basic wonderful cut ofmeat, then you really need to check the version that Keenan, Josh and crew serve. It is, IMHO, the best in the Valley hands down!!. Deliciously rare-med rare, a twice-baked with broccoli and the wonderfulness of a good potato, and the bet-you-can-only-eat- half verision of what tasted like the oldtime Parker House dinner roll. Peg's scallops and corn combo were amazing, and we started with splitting a bánh mì sandwich and a bowl of gazpacho...both on the great happy hour menu as well. Thank God we 86'd the wedge salad!  The bánh mì was incredbile....and it will be split (with a dump truck salad, perhaps) for an entire  dinner next time. BTW..dipping the sandwich IN the gazpacho is a bit of heaven in and of itself. At any rate....this meal was memorable. Yet again, Chris, Kat, and the always efficient servers were filling water glasses and being attentive. The more we go to this place....the better it gets!  Dr. B

Over a two-week period have been here about 5 times. Happy hour features $5 mixed drinks which are great... try the "pain killer" or "gin & juice" as the menus rotate; $5 'Happy Hour items include: an 'adult' mac & cheese (with queso blanco, pepper jack & green chilies) came in a hot iron pan - fantastic! And pork tacos that are small but very very good . Dinner with friends we had the grilled bavette (steak) which was perfectly cooked, and accentuated by the  gorgonzola fondue; walnuts & cranberries are addictive; tiny purple potatoes were okay but I would have preferred mashed and I prefer mushrooms on the side or not at all. Brussel sprouts wuth added bacon is simply to die for. Children's Mac & cheese was Kraft level so we sent it back and Ricky exchanged it for grilled cheese with steak fries  and that was much better. I'll be coming back again the next time in town!

Great place for Sunday Funday brunch, mimosas, and bloody marys.  A big group of us from out-of-town arrived a little after they opened at ten.  We enjoyed the bloody sconnie - vodka, house made bloody mix, lime & a beer back.  I think I had three of them!  A few of us (including myself) ordered the p&p benedict - roasted pork, sunny up eggs, english muffin, cholula hollandaise.  I added bacon...*drool*.  It was so delicious!  My friends enjoyed the pork belly, too, of course.  I'd definitely go back the next time I'm visiting Scottsdale.  Many other fun drink and food combinations to try!

Everything pickled and everything pork!  Try the charcuterie!  The bread is flavorful and fresh, and trying everything else on the plate is a veritable adventure.  The croque Monsieur is among the most delicious things I've ever tasted, and the worst part of dessert is narrowing your choices down to one!  The cookie was amazing, and next time I'll be trying the chocolate cake.  Seriously, any restaurant that offers pork belly as a side is a foodie dream.  Beer selection was small, but interesting and good.

very tasty food and generous portion size. Efficient and pleasant staff. My spouse enjoyed an excellent beer. This was our second visit and we went for "restaurant week" It was a very pleasant dinner and I highly recommend this restaurant

I had really high expectations for Pig & Pickle. Driving past it for 5 months built up my expectations to be quite high, but overall, it was just A-OK. I had their truffle fries and bone marrow and it was just fine. The fries were average, definitely better than fast food but not better than any other fancier joint in the area. The bone marrow was saltier than I would have liked. As in, way too salty by like 5-10 dashes of salt.  I think this restaurant definitely has a lot of potential and is a really cool hangout for young people in Scottsdale, but could be better considering its competition in the area.

This may be the coolest late night spot in the entire state of Arizona. The triple threat of being open late, having delicious food/beer and having a live DJ playing that boom bap is a combo I dare you to find elsewhere in this area.  I highly recommend the gin and guice cocktail and the buffalo pork shanks. They have an extensive list of craft beer as well. The service is good and the entire place is clean, well lit and full of quirky pig themed art. The prices are reasonable and the environment is relaxed and unique. Next time I visit the area this place will be the first stop.
Customer service was excellent, but food was way overpriced for what you get. I had the shrimp poboy. Not that impressed.
The last three times we came here for lunch this place was closed for no apparent reason. It seems like they are never open. Way too hip to have any kind of consistency in their business hours.

what a huge pile of disappointment this place is. how this restaurant has four stars is a serious mystery to me.   my fiance and i came here for dinner one night when we were both absolutely starving.  we would have thought almost anything was delicious at that point, and we were still totally let down. in order to accommodate our crazy hunger, we ordered a ton of food. we started with the house made charcuterie plate and couldn't find anything on it that we enjoyed.  i love pickled foods, but there was something about the flavor that really turned me off.    next up was the creamy broccoli and brown ale soup.  this tasted like something you'd get at applebees or chili's and looked like it too.  it was so boring and generic-i figured the ale would give it an interesting flavor, but it just tasted like a bland bowl of whatever.   i know we ordered at least three other things, but they were so whatever that i literally can't even remember what they were.  i was also disappointed to later find out they have a tot of the day (loooove tater tots), but our server never mentioned them.   i can't see a reason to return to this restaurants unless it's for a cocktail only and i'm in the area.

Came here multiple times mostly because of the convenience of the location. Have to say it's very tasty and definitely made us come back for more. It's been since January but I still remember the delicious charred Brussels sprouts and crispy skin trout!

P & P is a foodie place. The speciality, as the name suggests, is meat, particularly pork. The pork shoulder tostadas with kimchi are to die for: fluffy, moist, perfectly seasoned. The pulled pork melts in your mouth and kimchi topping is the perfect accompaniment. There are two per serving, and with the side order of Dump Truck Salad--a generous serving of fresh greens with seeds of and vinaigrette dressing, you have a perfect small meal. Amazing deals during 4-6 happy hour and late night menu (10pm-2 am) on both food and drink (tostadas are always on the menu). Other favourites: pork belly tacos, vegetarian burgers, regular burgers (they bake they own buns, and those are brioche buns!!). There is an ample selection of boutique beers and drinks made with freshly squeezed juices and home-made spirits. Definitely order seared carrot cake dessert with chevre whip topping. Worth the trip from anywhere in Phoenix.

P &P's Easter brunch...in a word: Awesome! Fabulous spread with biscuits and gravy, eggs, bacon, sausage, fruit, baked items and salmon with capers. My favorite was the goat cheese focaccia. Plus you could order from the menu their signature P&P Benedict, a non meat Benedict, farmers omelet or waffles.
