And of course their famous $5 mimosas and bloody Mary's along with a fabulous list of craft beers. And...wait for it...the price? Just $25 per person! So the brunch for 2, 2 bloody Mary's and 2 craft beers plus generous tip: only $90!

I cannot get enough of this place!  Such great food!  Wait staff is friendly and courteous, and pretty accommodating for those with issues with food allergens.  Recommend the pork belly, Bloody Mary, and just about anything else; I have yet to be disappointed!

We were staying in Tempe for a couple of weeks before we tried this place, and wish we'd found it sooner. Friendly, dog-loving, patio space and gourmet foods. I had the pot roast Sammie, she had the Cuban. They pickle their own pickles and bake their own breads. They get their fries from a local food truck until their late night menu starts (which Brings duck fat fries in tow). We really hope to make it back one day, but you should definitely try it.

I reserved a table here for my birthday dinner for a party of 10. Table was ready for us right away. My friends brought in a birthday cake for me but we weren't allowed to because if their policy which is fine. They were able to store it for us. I think the manager or owner felt bad so he gave us a bottle of champagne for the table. THAT is great customer service right there. He was so friendly and welcoming! I totally recommend this place!   As for the food, everything we got was delicious! Duck breast, pork shoulder tostadas, steak, pork shank. Everyone loved their food. The carrot cake and Mississippi mudcake was amazing!!!  Thank you for the wonderful dining experience on my birthday!

Our second time eating here today! Brunch- Zach was awesome, best bloody marys I have had! Comes with a shot of beer. My hubby had the breakfast burrito and I had the bavette and eggs. Incredible! Dinner- u must try a few different home made cocktails, everything is natural and fresh. My favorite was the missionary. We shared the  charcuterie platter- huge, so yummy and the groundd burger we also split. Great hamburger, even the tomatoes were awesome! Great vibe in the bar, music was old school, very chill. We also had the peach cobbler, holy crap. Best dinner ever!!;)

First time there last night. Had the blt. Amazing. The first bite was a flavor explosion. The vinegar on the fries was a bit much for my pallet. My wife had the hamburger and said it was great but again, the fries didn't work. Service was very good. A lot of menu items I wouldn't go for but what I had was excellent.

This place is amazing.  Went there for Sunday breakfast, and was absolutely blown away!!  EVERYTHING is custom crafted, and made to the highest standards.  Their regular lunch and dinner menus are equally good.  Wherever you are in the valley, this place is worth the drive!!!

took the family out to P&P for New Year's Eve lunch - 8 of us and every one was very happy with their meals - including a vegetarian and two gluten-intolerants. the Veg had the fried brussels sprouts and a beet salad and swooned - also a Maggie margarita that was excellent; Glutens had breakfast (raved about the pork belly & potatoes), and beet salad + order of bacon, and they must lose money on the bacon; easily 7-8 slices of excellent quality pig sides.  Sis had the 'Cuban Pickle Crisis' - a superb Cubano sandwich, and hubby had the P&P club - both raved about the quality and the size of the meals.  Niece had 'Apocalypse Sow', I had a bite and it is excellent.  I had a patty melt, I'm a sucker for home-made rye, and ordered it medium-rare, but got it well done.  It's hard to get a burger properly cooked medium-rare here in the Valley, but I expected better here; the quality of the Naiman Ranch beef was good, but,,,,,,,,,,,, come on guys. PS  - Our server, a grey-haired rail of a happy smiling man, was very good and not intrusive - it was easy to tell when we were all laughing out loud that he should wait a minute to ask how we're doing - we're doing just fine. All-in-all  it was a very good dining experience, and I will go back.

Everything I have tried has been amazing!  They have an awesome menu with lots of interesting, and perfectly crafted meals.  My favorite dish has to be the Brussel Spouts with a fried egg, but usually we just order a bunch of appetizers and build a charcuterie board to share.  Servers are always ready to make recommendations from start to finish including and excellent selection of craft beers and whisky.  If you are in the mood to have some great food and dine in a very casual dining room and patio make plans to try this place.

Lower your expectations, this place is over priced, staffed with untrained and unprofessional employees. A successful business requires good service with a good product and they failed on both. Ordered a sandwich and they " politely rejected institutions". Most customers expect some flexibility especially for a $14.00 sandwich. The scary thing that owners, investors and managers should be concerned with is the empty parking lot, with plenty of time for thier employees to catch up on email and text.
This place serves consistently delicious food and has an incredibly friendly staff. Be sure and check out the amazingly dog friendly patio!!

Came here with a large party of 10 with reservations. Everything was set and prepared for our arrival. The place is really open and spacious with the kitchen also being open. Luckily we came around 5:30 and took advantage of the Happy Hour deals. Literally every drink on the happy hour menu was excellent! My favorite was the Pain Killer. They also had killer deals on food on happy hour as well.   We had a large party so I was able to try a bunch of different dishes. The biggest standouts would be the Crispy Duck, Brussels, Steak, and the pickles!! Everything was cooked to perfection and flavor profiles were well balanced. They also can add bacon/pork belly to literally anything. Make sure to ask for pickles regardless of what you order!  Service was solid as well, it was my friend's birthday and our server solo sang him Happy Birthday like a champ.

Fun gastropub- easy to find with ample parking. Service was quick, very attentive to almost too attentive. Menu was pretty awesome with a lot of fun things to try. Everything we ordered was outstanding. Make sure you are sharing the small plates because they are actually pretty hefty portions. Beer selection was decent, nothing out of this world. Some breweries were local and unknown to me. Others were not so special. They do a tasting flight with hefty 6 or 8oz pours in mason jar like glasses. My only qualm was that the interior space is massive and tables are far apart or high up in the air giving an awkward, vulnerable dining experience rather than cozy and intimate.

Had dinner there last night and the food was outstanding!  we started with the house made charcuterie, pickles and bread.  YUM!!  The different jams were delicious.  I had the apocalypse sow and could not finish it!!  I wanted to but alas I was done!  They have a good selection of beer and wine to go with your mean.  Our server Steve was great and knew the menu very well!  And for bonus points the place is open late!!!!

I like to consider this place a little diamond in the ruff. Came to this place cause it was highly recommended to me by a chef friend, (Gloor (-;), and so glad I decided to give it a shot! I've been here a few times now and haven't had one bad thing off the menu. They have these giant tots that are stuff with different things everyday. It's a place you can tell the chef is passionate about his food and it clearly shows through the food. Ingredients are fresh and cooked to perfection. Currently on a mission to try everything on the menu. You will not be disappointed in this place. Great vibe and great music.
Great food and drinks . Love their Sunday brunch and drink specials . The fried Brussel spouts with fried egg is outstanding,  I add pork belly really great flavors .
Great happy hour selections included were some beer selections and food apps. Fun atmosphere.

Whoa! Gave this place 3 stars last time due to hiccups in service (it was their first week or so in business). But after a visit for dinner today with my family I had to update it to 5 stars. The service was absolutely above and beyond. Our server was quick and helpful. The entire staff was so kind to my baby nephew who had a few crying bouts. The staff came out with a bowl of ice cream to help calm him down and even gave him a piece of bacon on the way out.  And of course, once again the food was incredible. Every single person in our party ordered something unique off the menu and loved it.

Last week I had a group of 10 people from work.  We were all out-of-towners-- And it became my duty to find a place where we could have food and drink.  Thanks to Yelp, I found Pig and Pickle!  At 4:30pm I called for a reservation, and at 6:15pm we showed up and were seated immediately.    The staff was very friendly.  We had a patient waiter, who had a second waiter with him whenever serving us.  They were so good.    We got our drink orders in, and I forgot what everyone got.   They have an extensive drink menu, whether it's cocktails, beer, wine or anything else alcoholic.   I opted for beer, a Saison Dupont farmhouse summer ale.    I had a hard time choosing because their beer menu is so diverse and interesting.    With all the amazing choices, you should NOT order the usual commercial beer, eg Bud, Miller, etc.   I now can't remember all the food, but we ordered a lot.  We started with a few orders of Shisito peppers that were cooked in a soy sauce mix of some sort.  Some of these peppers were hit or miss in spiciness.   I love spicy, but hit a really strong one, and for about 15 minutes my tongue was about to fall off.   We also started with three orders of the kalbi lettuce wraps.   The kalbi was medium rare and cut thick -- Which made it a little chewy.    To round out the appetizers, we also had two orders of the Brussels sprouts.    If you love Brussel sprouts, you must get these!   I was annoyed that I had share with the group!     Everyone ordered all kinds of entrees. As for me, I opted for the steak, medium rare.   I absolutely loved it.  Simple as that.     I'll be returning to Scottsdale in a few weeks, and you can be certain I'll be here again!

I love this place. Not sure why I waited so long to try it, it's amazing. The pork was soft and delicious, as was the house made mustard and bread. Can't wait to go back to try more. Their cocktails were wonderful as well :)

Eclectic atmosphere, good food, and friendly staff.   I recommend this place if you're tired of the typical restaurant fare. They have an interesting menu that changes often. DJ came and place some pretty cool tunes on Friday night.

I really liked this place. A friend took me here for dinner on a recent Friday night and we just loved everything. We sat near the bar, at a high table and ordered 5 things off the menu, mostly appetizers but one entree (the pot roast). We also had a salmon appetizer, a pickled appetizer plate, a cheese plate, charcuterie, and possibly one other item. I'm not doing them justice by listing them. Everything was delicious and beautifully presented, with interesting accoutrements accompanying them. And the ingredients were fresh--you can tell.  Our waiter was wonderful. After asking about the beer on the menu, I decided to try the "surprise" beer of the moment. They open several kegs a day of different, miscellaneous beers, in addition to their impressive microbrew offerings. Turned out it was a beer I'd been wanting to try but there was only a tiny amount left on tap. The waiter gave me the last half-glass on the house, which was really very nice of him.  With a $15 coupon, we couldn't go wrong. Even without a coupon next time, we still won't go wrong. I recommend this to people who want to try interesting meals with more than just the usual fusion, but real imagination.
The food was delicious! I had the hanger steak and Tony had the clams. He ate every single one!

This continues to be one of our favorite restaurants!  Imaginative menu - and a delight for brunch.  What I love is their willingness to create a special experience for you.  We've hosted private parties in their spacious meeting room, and the manager helps us create the best experience ever.  I love a restaurant where you can add a plate of bacon or pork belly to any entrée!!  They have great vegetarian options too, so something for everyone.   Support local - and be prepared for some great options!!!

I give them credit for trying, but its just too overpriced for what it is.  My tots were cold in the middle, the waitress couldn't give a semi-accurate description of the dish she served me.  Don't try to order water to drink because the the tiny sippy cup they give with ice holds about one sip.    The tostados were good, but the rest of the meal, the no kids menu, we left disappointed.  If they move the restaurant ten blocks north they can get away with charging those prices, but not here.

I've only been here twice so far (I live next door) so this is based just on the two times I've been here. The first time was good, the second time was better. The first time we came we sat outside and we ordered the tostadas to start which I honestly wasn't a big fan of. I think tostadas are my least favorite Mexican dish so maybe that's why but I think that there are better looking apps on the menu that I'm looking forward to trying. We also tried a tot (can't remember what kind it was that night) but that was the bomb and they're only a $1 which is a deal and just a fun thing to try. Then we split the trip tip steak which I didn't like. It was way too salty which is seriously weird coming from me because I LOVE salt. However, the blue cheese fondue that was on it was reallllly good. I personally wouldn't order that steak again. Our waiter recommended we get a slice of key lime pie and claimed it was the best he had ever had (my boyfriend wasn't convinced) so we tried a slice. It seriously was the best we'd ever had. Sooooooo SO good. I would order that again anytime. I also tried the Salty Dog drink (grapefruit juice and vodka and sea salts) and I wasn't impressed. The salt like was too hard to come off of the glass so you didn't really get any of it when you took a sip. The second time we came I got the mussels with chorizo and those were really good and I'd definitely order them again. The service is really good here and the staff is friendly so that's a huge plus. I am looking forward to trying different things on the menu as well as trying the brunch!

This place is 4 stars for most food items, but dragged down by a miss on the buffalo - blue cheese pork shanks and the completely rare lamb chops that I ordered medium.  Portion was very small also and cocktails are light on the alcohol. Brussels sprouts with farm egg were a solid 4 stars.  Ambience is cool. If I could give this place 3.5 stars, I would. Tip: if you feel like lamb and you're all about the food instead of atmosphere, try the lamb chops Marsala from uncle Sal's Italian restaurant down the street... They are to die for and it's a very big portion. A full rack instead of four bones.

Bit of a hit or miss for me. The service was slow (especially for a Tuesday) but friendly. The pickle plate was interesting and good. I had the Cuban missile crisis sandwich and couldn't eat much of it as it was drowning in mustard. The bread ended up soggy and sitting in a yellow pond. The "tator tots" were lovely - they are actually fried mashed potatoes. Interesting concept but not sure I'd ever go back.

Got take out here tonight for my roommate and I. I've eaten here before and everything was alright, not worth the hype or the price, but good enough for me to go again. As a bartender, I don't and have never left a review for any restaurant or bar ever, but this time was worthy of a first. The bartender when I called to place my order was definitely less than friendly to start. He quoted me 15/20 minutes which is the window in which I arrived. I did, surprisingly, get a quick smile upon realizing I was the take out customer. Other than that, he was totally cold, but whatever, I was in and out. I got home and we both realized first that the fries with our meal were mostly hard as a rock as if they had been sitting under the heat lamp for hours. Even if you could chew through a few, they tasted old. My roommate's brie sandwich was delicious. All I ordered was a regular burger which I was charged $12 for instead of $9. I also was charged 50¢ per meal for take out. Really guys? The bun of my burger was as rock hard as the fries and the entire meal was (no exaggeration) a task to eat. Not to mention, it really didn't taste that great. All around, I feel like I was overcharged and wasted my money on inedible food that's sitting in my trash can. I've heard the background of this place and used to respect it, but out of the 10/12 employees working with maybe 3 people at the bar and 5/6 tables, nobody could be attentive enough to put out some decent food or even kind? Pretentious restaurants are popping up everywhere and some people enjoy that, but mostly people just want good food and good service, none of which were apparent today. Bummer too, because I make a point to support local businesses.

Checked out the P&P for restaurant week.  We arrived early and decided to test out the happy hour specials at the bar before having dinner.  There are lots of apps for about $5 to sample during happy hour.  I recommend the beer cheese.  It was really good.  The charcuterie board was pretty good as well though I didn't care for jam.  The HH drink specials were ok with drinks and beer in the $5 range.  Might as well stick with the liquor.    The main event came around and I couldn't do the 3 course restaurant week menu on the account of the appetizers at the bar.  I opted for the Apocalypse sow (pork burger with bacon).  I wasn't in love with it.  I'd recommend going for the regular burger with a big slice of pork belly added on.  It'd be a $1 cheaper and better.  The rest of the party ordered various things, including the restaurant week menu.  The marrow bones looked great, the crispy chicken received good reviews, and the $2.50 cans of Hamm's were certainly enjoyed.  For dessert, the Elvis was probably the one that went over the best.  All in all, the P&P has a great atmopshere, creative food, and good specials.  I'll definitely be back.

I have been wanting to try Pig & Pickle for some time now. Luckily, since my co-workers know I'm a foodie, they gifted me $50 giftcard to try Pig & Pickle. I grabbed my husband and we hustled down for Happy Hour. Happy Hour runs from 4 - 6pm daily and they have plenty of appetizers for $5 and numerous drink choices. Since we wanted to make the most of our experience, we ordered three items off the Happy Hour menu.   First, we ordered pork tacos. I am not going to lie - these were the best thing we ate all night. If we had only ordered the tacos, we would have been in hog heaven - pun intended. The pork was flavorful and spicy with a tender slice of avocado on top. Only two came to an order, but they were perfectly delicious. After trying the other menu items, I wish we had just ordered more of the tacos.  Next, we ordered the pork tostadas. This was pork shoulder with ginger aioli, kimchi, and scallions. The pork, while extremely tender, was flavorless. The kimchi (pickled cabbage) was off putting - after one bite, I picked all the kimchi off. Even my husband, who normally likes kimchi, commented on how off it tasted. Needless to say, we were not impressed.  For our final appetizer, we ordered the chef's choice house made charcuterie. This came with some pickled vegetables, several meats, a spicy mustard, a bacon jam, and two types of bread. Let me just say, the house made bread was fantastic. It was soft and flavorful. My husband enjoyed the bacon jam and I liked the spicy mustard. The pickled vegetables were meh. (There were pickled pearl onions, pickled green beans, and to quote the waitress, "pickled pickles".) I don't remember the exact names of the types of meat except there were three of them - one being a pork sausage. Again, we weren't very impressed with the selection.  For dinner, my husband ordered the littleneck clams with chorizo and a side of pork belly. The clams were in a white wine sauce with herbs and tomatoes. I tried a slice of the chorizo and it was tasty, but overall my husband didn't really like the meal. Even the pork belly, which he loves, was just "okay".   I ordered the smoked pot roast sandwich. This came with Havarti, caramelized onions, and creamy horseradish on a hoagie roll. I had the option of French fries or a small salad and decided to go with the fries. The fries were both good and bad at the same time. They had a nice flavor to them, but they didn't seem cooked all the way through. You know how you bake a potato and sometimes the inside isn't cooked - it's in that half stage of being slightly tender but chewy? That's how all the fries were. Which is definitely not the norm for fries but it was so odd that I kept eating them, trying to see if it was all of them or just one. (It was all of them.) The sandwich also gave me mixed feelings. The roast itself was tender but flavorless. When combining all the sandwich flavors, it actually tasted good. (The onions really complimented the roast and the horseradish gave everything a spicy kick.) Overall, it was a decent sandwich but nothing to rave about.  In the end, we used our entire giftcard. My husband commented that he was glad we had a giftcard so we could try everything but that he wouldn't go back. I agreed and we probably won't be back. Mainly, the food was just "okay" (except  the tacos - if you do go, get the tacos) and the restaurant is about 30 minutes away from us. It's hard to justify driving 30 minutes for "okay" food. The service was nice. Our waitress was attentive, friendly, and prompt. She helped us decide on what to order when we had questions and gave us her opinion on dishes.  Overall, the restaurant is a neat idea - everything is house made and fresh but the execution/flavor was just lacking. If we are ever in the neighborhood, we might give it a second chance but who knows when that will be.

Okay so I love this place. I live around the corner so I am there at least once a week and I think they know me by name which is slightly embarrassing.  They have taken a quiet strip mall space and turned it into an amazing gastropub type restaurant. The ingredients are fresh, in season and local, they put tons of thought into the menu, the beer list is extensive and the old fashioneds make me feel like don draper in mad men.  Try "the nancy" and the cheese plate is a must. Also attend happy hour here for great deals, I think it's from 4-6.

Delicious food, great drinks and friendly service. We actually came for lunch but the menu was still serving breakfast items. We decided to stay anyway and I'm so glad we did! The mimosa was wonderful, you could tell the orange juice was fresh squeezed. They had items on the menu I had actually never even heard of but after the waiter gave a little bit of an explanation, they were merely just fancy names. I got the biscuits, eggs and pork gravy. It had a really complex name but it was basically just sunny side-up eggs, southern style biscuits in gravy with pork pieces instead of ground sausage. I would definitely recommend, it was great spot for brunch!
Returned for Sunday brunch with friends a couple weeks ago, and it was every bit as good as our first visit. Highly recommended.

If you're in the area, looking for a non-Tex-Mex happy hour, just go here.  Really.  Or if it's late night and you need a nosh (and a drink).  Just go here.  Really.  'Nough said.  What to eat?  Pork belly anything.  You had me at pork belly.  And boy, do they know how to do it here.  But also delightful sashimi apps on occasion. I've had many of their fish specials, and it's always a winner.  Happy hour wines on tap.  Yes, you read that right.  They have solid wine selections to compliment the savories - and you can read about the happy hour (and late-night) savories in the other reviews.    Pig & Pickle has a nice comfy vibe, eclectic clientele (from Scottsdale usuals to hipsters to service industry types).  Comfortable, homey fine dining.  Boy I hate the word "gastropub."  It's really an edgy bistro trying to slum it a bit.  But in a good way.  Comfortable enough to hang but just industrial enough to rotate the 8-tops.    And--get this--I don't like dessert.  BUT:  The carrot cake is just heavenly.  Really.  Just say yes.  I get it every time.  Unless I'm saving room for yet another smoked salmon app or charcouterie plate.  MMMM.  *checks web for flight times to the Valley....

I've visited three times for brunch so far. If I was to grade my meals on a A-F scale, I would give them "C", "A", and "B," respectively. So, I think the food is definitely good.   The reason I give this place a 3/5 is from my last experience. Our waitress was very friendly, but the overall service was very sloppy, so much so that I had to write this review.  1) The hostess seemed careless in refilling our waters, nearly knocking our glasses over several times. Though I'm not a prude when it comes to fashion, her gothic, Stevie Nicks look was odd given the décor of the restaurant. It also looked and felt like she had some attitude.  2) I didn't get to start my actual meal until five minutes after it was delivered. The reason was I had to waive down the waitress for basic items associated with a brunch.   -- I had to waive her down for ketchup (I had eggs and potatoes on my plate, and anther person had potatoes.) -- I then had to wave down the waitress for salt (There is neither salt nor pepper on the tables.) -- I needed butter but did not ask for it simply because I was tired of waiving her down. The toast could have REALLY used it; being in the army though, I've had worse.   3) Finally, just plain inattentiveness was an issue. There were long breaks in between her visits. (The place was slowly becoming busy, around 11am). The table ordered a second round of cocktails and they did not arrive. I could have used a coffee refill during the meal but that offered AFTER she delivered our check.

Pig and Pickle is amazing. They have a phenomenal food menu. The food will blow any foodie away. Someone clever; who knows what they are doing must have done the menu. They serve amazing food till 1:00am, what more could you want? The only thing around that rivals Pig and Pickle's food; is they're cocktail and beer menu. Service/staff could not be more helpful and friendly.   I'm
Sexy.  Everything about this place is just plain sexy.  I had one of the best nights I've ever had in this part of scottsdale. Thank you P&P What a gem..!!

The food was great and the bartenders were very helpful and friendly! However the restaurant server could use more training and or an extra set of hands our table felt very ignored she walked past us a couple times without offering to refill empty drinks and when we asked for condiments she never brought them I had to get them from the bartender myself!

This place is awesome, the location might make you think otherwise due to the fact it's in a strip mall next to an E-cig joint and a MMA sparring gym. But forget that noise, because once you are inside you forget where you are.   First and foremost- beverages as in cock motherfucking tails are top notch. Every drink they mix is done to perfection, I hate these other god damn restaurants where everything is too sweet or they put 18 different mixers in each drink. I want to taste my booze and Pig serves it up just right.  They use high quality alcohol paired with outstanding bitters and tinctures. They even have a few cocktails they age themselves.  Not only are the drinks awesome but beer and liquor selection is killer.   On to the food, obviously this place serves some bomb ass meats from pork belly to foie gras smear to carnitas tostadas. I have ordered several items and have never been let down unlike my sex partners. The Elvis dessert is downright tasty.   Lastly, the service is always exceptional, granted I only sit at the bar or do take out but they are always friendly and go out of their way to make sure you have a great experience.   I love this place and it is head and shoulders above a lot of the old town Scottsdale hyped up bullshit restaurants.

Went here lately night with family and friends after a spring training game. We were seated outside and it was a perfect night. Most of us ordered the Apocalypse Sow, I had the lettuce wraps, one grandson had burger and fries other grandson had something called madam something. Portions were huge!!!!  Everyone got quiet and you could tell we all enjoyed the food. Water, tea and beer was flowing and the service was really good. Very nice experience. Thanks Check Please, AZ for the review. We had a great time.

First of all anyone that rates this place under 5 stars needs to have their brain checked. The quality of the ingredients show how much the owners care! I had the hanger steak with chimichurri sauce cooked perfectly and my husband had the duck with spinach and rice (nothing but mmm noises the whole time, that's how good it was!) One of the owners checked in on us and actually made a drink, where do you ever see that?!?!? Ugh nowhere! Really glad I came across this place!

The last experience I had a pig and pickle was awful. We had been once before and it had been alright food but I wanted to give it another try since we live in the neighborhood and I had heard great reviews. We went for the late night service and called before I went to make sure they were still serving the waitress was hesitant to say yes even though there was over an hour of service left. I have worked in the food industry and if you're open your open you can't complain about your hours. When we got there the same lady helped us with our food. We ordered a couple drinks and asked what she recommended for food. She recommended the pork tostadas THEY WERE TERRIBLE. When she brought over the food it smelled rancid.... like she was serving us rotten meat. I ate one bite and couldn't take another. She never came back to our table to ask how her food was so I'm almost positive she did it on purpose because we didn't eat a single bite of it. I am not usually quick to judge but the behavior was unacceptable. We could never get her attention so we paid in cash and left. Terrible experience. We will never be back. So disappointed.
Been here several times. Awesome restaurant with delicious food, good drinks, and friendly service. Cocktails are good, and they have live music on fridays. Really fun, casual vibe.

Definitely recommend the  shrimp and grits! So yummy . The sauce was spicy and had a New Orleans flare to it. Hats off to the chief for that dish! The post roast Sammie was decent, their attempt at a brisket sandwich. The tater tots were really like hush puppies and you only got two, disappointing. The lettuce wraps were good and different with the kimchi. Overall, good experience. Service was pleasant and our server had some good recommendations. I would go back for the shrimp and grits.

A bit late on the review (maybe I'm just getting over my shock and awe of the delicious food I didn't know about!) but my family and I had a wonderful evening here a couple weeks ago. We ordered the Ratatouille with pulled pork, Nancy sandwich, and shrimp and grits. Super good food and I love how you can see the kitchen cooking all of the food! However the desserts were the main star for us - blackberry vinegar pie and a glazed carrot cake did us in. We still can't stop talking about them (go out for dinner someone else, get dessert, "but what about that vinegar pie and carrot cake"...happens every time) :) Christina was a great server. Thank you P&P! Definitely want to come back here for late night!

We had an overall good experience I guess I just had high expectations going in The drinks and appetizers were amazing We got the charcuterie board But my entree the pork burger fell flat after that I think the patty could have used more seasoning

Pig and Pickle never ceases to amaze me. The food is amazing and the specialty cocktails are amazingly concocted. Bottled beer selection is stellar and they have a few draft beer options  Staff is always friendly and you receive a warm welcome every time you walk through the front door. Food menu changes on a regular basis as the chefs like to keep the diners on their toes by providing new and exciting dining experiences.   I'd strongly suggest the bone marrow and once you've finished the marrow wash it down with the bone marrow bourbon shot (just as Scotty the bartender!).
Good place to come with friends for food and drinks. They have a large selection of craft beers and their bovine inspired cuisine is very tasty.

It doesn't get better than Pig & Pickle...outstanding food , great service and good value without being pretentious. Pork belly tostadas...awesomeness! Smoked salmon stacked high in a latke...delicious! Gruyere with local honey, bee pollen and apricot jam was delightful. The wife loved the tostadas the she ordered them for her entree. The Apocalypse Sow was the best burger I have ever had...the ground pork, bacon and cheese was heavenly. Cod fish and tatters were very good. The s'mores dessert was worthy enough to go just for the desert.  The hostess, the manager (Chris) and our server  (Justin)  provided outstanding service . They know how to make you feel welcomed and make it easy to want to come back again and again. I recommends everyone to go here!

Edible, but not impressed. I was excited about it because of the reviews and was not satisfied. I may have just purchased the incorrect entree (salad) which was bland with not much flavor at all. Feel free to give it a try, but be sure to order something other than a salad.

Here's the deal with this place. I think your either going to really like it or really hate it. My wife and I are one of the people that really enjoy this place. I'm not a big fan of the pickled stuff but their food is amazing! They serve bone marrow. I know it sounds gross but I would recommend it. It's served with bread and it's like a butter topping for the bread. Their carrot cake is the best cake I think I've ever had!! I also really enjoy their brunch menu. I would highly recommend this place!

I read good reviews, but when I went for lunch I was surprised by how small the menu is. I expected traditional barbecue, but it really isn't. I ended up ordering a salad and cheese soup. Everything was fine, but in a town like Scottsdale with so many choices, I won't rush to come back.
Only a restaurant for those who like different types of foods.  Attentive service, but the food took a long time to arrive to our party of eight.  Look at the online menu before venturing out.

I was told that the chef at the Pig & Pickle used to be the chef at the Atlas Bistro, so I had very high hopes for Pig & Pickle. I went with my family & for the five of us, we shared three apps and five entrees. The tostada & the buffalo shanks were both pretty good, but the charcuterie plate was forgettable. Of the five entrees ordered, nothing rocked my boat all that much, nothing wrong, but nothing right.   On the up side, the service was excellent. The waiter was really nice & didn't seem to be bothered by my family's tendency to be a little boisterous.   One thing that did annoy me... I was the designated driver, so I ordered a diet cola with dinner. Out came a diet cola in a cute bottle. It was good but not no refills good for a three dollar soda.   I probably won't be back, not because it was bad, but I know where to get better.

I love this place. This is not a good place come if you;re on a diet.  so far we tried,...  Bone Marrow, pork shoulder tostada, rib eye steak----which was amazeballs--- stuffed tater tots, duck, and fried fish.  I think I loved alll of these with the exception of the fried fish. It was crispy crunchy but there's so many better yummy things on the menu.  the vibe is casual and service has always been great. the patio is petfriendly so you can bring your beloved furbaby here if you'd like!
Food was really good.  We got good service.  The pickled things platter was really tasty and included pickled grapes, cactus, okra, bread & butter pickles and a garlic pickle!

We were searching for a less pretentious atmosphere after calling around Scottsdale for reservations. I saw a write up in Valley Guide in our room and read reviews on Yelp. Well, we scored!  I should mention that we are traveling with our 5 year old with a nut allergy. The staff was incredible and accommodating and so knowledgeable about the menu. We arrived for the end of happy hour and ordered the tostadas with pork and kimchi and the dump truck salad. Both excellent. The salad was very seasonal with cauliflower, radish and cucumber, my 5 year old loved each bite. My son's burger was hand made with homemade bread.  After our apps we had the mussels with chorizo and homemade bread. When I asked the waitress if it was good she begged us to order it. It did not disappoint. We also had the pickles on the side which was not just house made pickles but a pickled egg, beans, okra, mushrooms, beets and even grapes, all distinctly different from each other. My only complaint was that there was a lot of fennel in each dish we had, so by the end of the meal we had a bit of fennel fatigue.  Would make a big effort to come back here again when in town. The staff was so attentive and knew so much about the drinks and dishes. We didn't drink this evening but the specialty drinks were as well thought out as the dishes. It was a pleasure just reading the menus.

Had a work Happy Hour here. The food was awesome and they have a huge drink menu. Jake was our waiter and he was amazing.   We had almost every appetizer on the happy hour menu ordered to the table and everything was eaten so fast we had to order more.

Just relocated to the area and needed to grab a bite after a long day of moving boxes and furniture.  P&P is my neighbor so I went in for convenience but will be returning as a local.  The food was great and so were the beers.  Great knowledgeable staff and our dog even received a little treat as well.  Love that the tot recipe is ever changing!

12/13/12  Nice space!  Let me rephrase that-- very cool-looking bar counter, but the rest of the room was too open, with low four-tops in the middle of the main room and high two- to four-tops next to bare walls and near the bar area.  It felt a little disconcerting...  Upon entering the restaurant, I immediately gravitated to the bar counter, where the choicest seats seemed to be.  The bartender there was friendly and eager to tell me all about the beers offered here.  After being able to sample one of the beers (sorry, none of the ones listed online sounded familiar), I decided to go with a glass of Malm Sonoma pinot noir ($10).  A pet peeve of mine is having to drink wine from a beer glass- not cool, but I got over it.  I started off with the Braised Pork Belly, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/pig-and-pickle-scottsdale?select=IxQZJrjKInhC-mVb9TCd1g#IxQZJrjKInhC-mVb9TCd1g which came charred (grr!) and sitting on top of a delightful silky bed of (not cloyingly) sweet yam puree, and garnished with Brussels sprouts slaw and maple syrup.  I expected the pork belly to have a little more crunch after seeing all that char, but it was almost too tender.  It tasted quite lovely, but I preferred the pork belly that Roka Akor used to serve (I hear it's not on the menu, anymore?).  I really enjoyed the yam puree's contribution to the dish-- it was almost jammy.  Still, at $10, I'm going to skip it next time (and resolve to look for it on my next trip to Roka Akor!).  For my main, I had the Braised Duck Leg, $13, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/pig-and-pickle-scottsdale?select=aUDb-8nR1pDZroVx1gHiHQ#aUDb-8nR1pDZroVx1gHiHQ which was a work of art!  Gorgeous colors and a MYRIAD of textures and flavors, it is definitely a dish I would order again and again!  The duck was crispy and very delicious- one of the best pieces of duck I've ever had the pleasure of tasting!  I especially enjoyed the crispy mung bean cake upon which the leg was placed on.  (Being Asian, I am familiar with mung beans- red, yellow, and green, to name a few, so to see this ingredient used in a novel way in American cuisine was exciting!)  I so loved the big bursts of ginger flavor in the cake-- I wish to see this item on more menus- at least as a substitute for crispy polenta, or risotto.  The sweet soy had almost a balsamic twist to it.  I whole-heartedly recommend this dish!  To finish, I ordered the Apple Turnover, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/pig-and-pickle-scottsdale?select=4bSitqEOaCaP4SvbuyJb6A#4bSitqEOaCaP4SvbuyJb6A with vanilla-bean ice cream, $6- a special of that day, which required I wait an extra twenty minutes to bake-- I do not mind waiting for freshly-baked pastries!  This delightfully-flaky turnover arrived atop a rivulet of beautiful caramel sauce, piping-hot tender spiced apple slices inside, a dollop of creme fraiche, and apple matchsticks on top.  All of this was garnished with toasted pine nuts... Exquisite, and yes, I ate it all!    Since I arrived during happy hour, I was able to get a $1 off each item.  I found the tab a bit pricey ($46, including an $8 tip), but I did have wonderful leftovers for lunch at work the next day-- everyone kept eyeing what I was eating and asked where I found it on the buffet spread!  As if!  :)  I'll absolutely be back! http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/pig-and-pickle-scottsdale?select=AFu1PBeqCLa2A1NVFXRwbA#AFu1PBeqCLa2A1NVFXRwbA

A fairly eclectic menu featuring items such as pork liver, braised pork shank, and pork belly, Pig and Pickle is a porcine charm.  If you like whiskey, Pig features a selection of over fifty (rough guess) types of spirits including unique ryes that'll produce a Manhattan cocktail reminiscent of a Wall Street watering hole.   The patio is noisy due to its open access to Thomas Road. On this night, everyone seated on the patio nearly jumped out of their chairs at the sound of skidding tires thinking an accident was in progress.  Shortly after, a loud boom from across the street, likely a car backfire, but nerve shattering nonetheless. Throughout dinner, the evening was littered with annoying roadway distractions, not fun.  My advice? Don't opt for the patio no matter how loud the climate inside.   Service was stellar, with the waiter offering helpful tips, advice on how things are prepared and how many servings to expect from various appys. Prompt, courteous, and seemingly well trained.   I had a pork shank accompanied by yams. The yams were a bit spicy but not too, just enough to add a spectacular flavor and wake up your taste buds. Unexpected and flavorful surprise for the non-yam enthusiast.   Pig and Pickle has done a good job with everything we experienced save for some type of barrier between the patio and the roadway to help with noise abatement.

I have been wanting to try this place for quite some time after hearing good things, finally got the chance and was very pleased.  The best part of our experience was that they were open late, not a lot of good food joints open late in the South West!    I ordered the shrimp and grits but the grits came out cold, they made me a new one and threw in a free dessert.  The ground pork burger (can't remember the name of it) was outstanding, everything about it was super yum!  Definitely will return :)

We came around lunch time on a Sunday so they had the brunch menu up for grabs. We started with a basic beer and glass of wine, but ended with a yummy cocktail and one of the better bloody mary's I've had. This place is just fun to sit and drink at -cute bar, fun vibe, great bartender. We should have gotten the tots - they change daily based on their menu apparently and the guy next to us got them and we were very jealous. I ended up getting the biscuits and gravy with pulled pork added and fiance had the eggs benny. Both were good, but I think I would prefer their dinner menu more than their brunch. My biscuits or gravy had that refrigerator taste but the pulled pork was good. Fiance said he would have preferred pork belly to the pulled pork on his benny. Needless to say, I am giving this place 5 stars because I have heard such great things and we had such a good time. I'm thinking the flavors were just a mistake that day and you can't base judgement off of your one time, especially when friends go all the time and have a great experience.

The food I had was delicious!    The bar is very small and really crowded (other patrons leaning over your food to try and order a drink).  No more than 3 stars though.  When I first realized the hours of operation, I thought it was a joke.  This place doesn't open until 4pm everyday?!?  For a wannabe gastropub?!?  In Old Town?!?    Hello???  Old Town is a day drinking society!  No one here waits until 4pm for a cocktail.  How can Old Town patrons come drink if you're not even open???    Also, not enough TVs.

Host staff wasn't so great but Christina who showed up mid conversation told us to get a table to get water while we waited for our to go food. We ended up eating our soup in the restaurant mom and I shared the bacon, Wisconsin cheddar, broccoli soup. It was absolutely amazing. I'd advise on sharing it because it was very rich. Christina told us to get the carrot cake but we were so full we got it to go. I'm normally a chocolate person but our server said she is too but loves the carrot cake! It was freaking delicious!!!
The cocktails and poutine brought us back two nights in a row. The sandwiches are on fresh made bread that put the whole thing over the top. Great food and drinks at an affordable price.

This is my second review, based on me having been there three times since my first 5 star review. The second time it was still pretty good, though the menu was missing some good items. The third time was with a larger group of 7. Food was ok generally, but my duck with huitlacoche was just mushrooms being passed off as huitlacoche. Service was decent. Last time will be last time. Made a reservation for a specific table. When we got there the table wasn't ready. No problem, but it irked me when the hostess pointed at the couple still in the table we had reserved and sighed. It was like she was passing the buck even though it wasn't necessary. We wait about 15 minutes and then the hostess gets us and proceeds to take us to a different table. I look over at the one I had reserved. It was empty and just needed to be cleaned off. I told her that that was the table we had been waiting for. She let us move, saying that she just wanted to get us seated. I can't imagine why she thought it would've been a problem to make us wait a couple more minutes to clean off the table we wanted. Then as she cleaned it she once again passed the unnecessary buck by blaming our delay on the person who took the reservation. It was weird. Ok. We're seated. We wait 10 min for water. Finally the waiter comes. By then we know the drinks and appetizers we want. We have to almost force the waiter to take them. He obviously wanted to only take the drink order. We wait a half hour before the drinks and appetizers arrive. No waiter visits during that time, and different people bring them. However, the waiter is continually visiting the tables of young women behind us and in front as well as doting on a larger group. He's busy but I can't figure out why we're ignored. By the time we're done, still no waiter. I had tried to convince my wife and brother to leave before the appetizers arrived. They weren't having it. After another 20 minutes after the appetizers were done, they just want to leave. Finally, almost an hour after we sat down, we get the second waiter visit. He just kinda irritatingly asks if we know what we want. No specials. No bread. Etc., even though he asked all the other tables he was doting on. I said, "just the check." He got annoyed we weren't ordering. Brought the check. Left no tip. Adios forever. We went to the Citizens Public House instead, which has much better food for the same price.

My friend and I stopped in for a small lunch. We were very surprised with how good the menu sounded. We hoped the food would be as good as what our minds were now envisioning..      We ended up very happy that it was.      I had the Biscuits and Gravy for Sunday brunch and my friend had the Chorizo Scramble type of dish.       Mine was wonderful, though they should cut the biscuits in half so it makes four then add gravy. It would be more enjoyable. Adding a couple of tomato slices would be good too.      My friend and I were apprehensive about his Chorizo dish. They make their own and when most places do, it isn't that good. This place is totally the opposite. The Chorizo was fresh, spicy hot and full of flavor. It was FANTASTIC. They should turn it into a dip and serve it as a app later in the day.      Simple put, this place rocks the Pig!      If you order a side of bacon, you get a big plate full. Not 2 pieces. Yummy!
Service was great. Food amazing. We had the pork shoulder tostadas, bone marrow, and duck entree. Waitress was very knowledgable of food and had great recommendations. I would certainly return.
Solid 4.5 stars had the burger and really did enjoy it.  Happy hour is a great deal  on food but drinks are still pretty expensive.

I've lived down the road from The Pig and Pickle for the past year now and was just recently able to stop in for a late dinner. I ordered the mussels with the chorizo and was very pleasantly surprised. The entire time I was eating I couldn't get over how good they were.  Two of my friends ordered the steak and one friend ordered the trout. We were all talking about how good our meals were the entire time. Not one of us had a complaint.  I can't believe it took me a year to stop in here!! I'll definitely be coming back.

An Arcadia restaurant feel in South Scottsdale. Finally! Happy hour is only $1 off f&b which isn't all that great but we still enjoyed. The cocktails were good and food was also reasonably priced and tasty. Will definitely be back.

I love this restaurant.  Been here twice and everything we had was delicious.  Portions are on the larger size.  Prices are reasonable.  Food is fresh and always well prepared.  The bread board is a NOT MISS.  I'm also a big fan of the smoked salmon app on the oversized tater tot.  Their tater of the day is fun, cheap, and worth a try.  When we ordered a side of bacon, they literally brought out a PLATE full of it.  For $3.  SCORE!!  Now taking reservations for parties of 5 or more!

I really dont like pork. I never cook it, I never order it, but I ate it and recommend it from here because it's that good. I ordered take out, and while I was waiting for them to bring out my food, I hung out by the bar. It has a cute, gastropub feel. I ordered the pork belly appetizer with hummus which made me melt. SO GOOD. The pork shoulder tostadas was good, but I still don't understand why Americans think sour-pickled cabbage is kimchi. Anyway, I definitely want to try other items on their menu... I will be back!

I visited this restaurant last night. I got their pork burger with side of duck fries.   The food was ok. The bacon on top of the burger was a little plasticky and hard to chew. I really liked the fries, although it was plain and not salted ...  The server came across a bit rude. My biggest disappointment was with their kitchen setup. The food comes out at random times. I got my fries 10 minutes after my burger and everyone's food came out randomly every 10 minutes.

Love the creativity of the menu items here, and when the dishes come out they didn't disappoint. Seems like a lot of AZ restaurants try and put fancy things on their menu but taste doesn't seem to deliver. But Pig & Pickle has it down! Sooooo goooood.   Minus a star because even though the drink menu looked exceptional, all three drinks we ordered were a bit too overpowering and sweet for our tastes...they need to be a bit more balanced. But hey, there's a great selection of beer to choose from, so you can still get your drink on.
Proud to say we had our first beer here. We had the banana bread ale and a chocolate milk stout and were completely satisfied. Pork belly is a requirement to try before you leave!

I met a friend here for dinner and was REALLY impressed.  For a bar the staff is friendly & knowledgeable.  The food is much more gourmet than I'd expected, but isn't pretentious.  Great mix of flavors and concepts.  Had the pork shoulder tostadas, the smoked salmon on scallion tot, along with a great vanilla porter from Tucson brewery (recommended by the bartender when I asked what he had that was local brewed.)  Would go back often if I lived in Phoenix.  For the money, I don't think you can find BETTER quality, and the quantity wasn't skimpy either.

What a culinary adventure this was! Before dragging myself out, i managed to try the pork shoulder tostadas, the tots, and the bone morrow among other things. Although all great, the tostadas is an absolute revelation. Bursting in flavor, it was alone worth the trip.
Awesome experience - great atmosphere, the food was awesome (make sure you try the Tots, they are UNBELIEVABLE) and craft beers on tap...what more could you ask for? We will definitely be back soon!

I went by yesterday 3/16/16 because I heard everyone raved about the place, from San Francisco. Came here for dinner and was highly disappointed. Along with a few other friends the restaurant was closed due to a gas leak.  well I'm glad they are fixing the problem and bummed I wasn't able to try it.

Amazing!!!!! Came Here after he Super Bowl events becUse we were finally Im Scottsdale and only pig and pickle on the mind. Yum I had the veggie sandwhich add pork belly. Nice all bit home and had the Creative salad on the side

Had family passing through Phoenix so we had four generations together for dinner. The Pig and Pickle turned out to be perfect! Great service, and an ecclectic selection of locally sourced ingredients all turned into gastronomic delights.  Bring your appetite or be prepared to take home leftovers.   Definitely a place we will be returning to!
Great service, tasty food, and an excellent Gin selection.  One of the best G&Ts I've had to date.
There are so many places with great food in Scottsdale but few with the service that you get here.  Everyone treats you like a VIP

Went expecting very good things based on great reviews in the local papers and Yelp. Unfortunately didn't quite live up to expectations. Restaurant itself is nicely appointed and has a good feel. Service was friendly and attentive. Food wasn't quite what I was hoping for though. We had the bone marrow and pork shoulder tostadas to start. Bone marrow was nice - enjoyed the onion jam and pickled onions it came with - nice compliments. The tostadas didn't work for us though - the ginger aioli lacked much ginger and there was just way too much of it. The duck leg was excellent itself, but the bean cake it came with didn't do much for me, and the bean sprouts and cabbage slivers on top didn't do much for the plating or the dish over. The pot-roast sammie was good, but the fries were barely warm and no longer crispy - which was a bummer.  I'd probably give this another shot as I liked the concept, but probably not in a big hurry to go back. Pricing generally good, though if they shave a dollar or two off the apps that would help.

Went here for my first time. The tostadas were outstanding my daughters veggie burger was excellent too!! ..... and you can add bacon for free. The service was excellent we sat at the bar and spoke with one of the owners Clayton. Definitely will go back here.

Wanted to try something new so my husband and I stopped in for a late lunch. We shared the Cuban with home made tots and a bowl of their broccoli cheese soup. Everything was delicious. Side note, tots consist of two golf ball sized tots and are worth the extra "buck fiddy".

The food is really good with interesting combinations most of the time but pretty overpriced. I don't go here often but every time I have been in, the menu has changed which is both good and bad. Good that they keep things new, bad if you were hoping to pick up your favorite dish it might not be there.

The owners are great and really know what they're doing. The food here is to die for!! And they have a lot of options for vegans and vegetarians which is great. The chef really knows how to make the flavor in all of their dishes just phenomenal. The service is always excellent, especially from Jordan. My good friend also works here, and it's so clear that owners treat their employees with respect. That's so important! What a great all around place.

Brunch and drinks are outstanding, gave only 3 stars for the following  reasons.  Sat at the bar, two bartenders    Not attentive, had to order drinks a few times before  they would awkknowledge and actually make the drinks. Had to wait over 5 minutes just for salt and pepper They got too busy hanging with regulars.

Out of all the place I have done in Scottsdale. This place by far have the most amazing foods, hospitality service ever. Is not from our waiter. Is from the chef himself. He is so on point pushing everything to come out on time. And so accommodating toward our group. Our waiter is not too friendly, he does not have a smile on his face the whole time he serving us. Our wine, cocktail, and beer pairing blend in so well with all our dish. We really have to thank you the chef himself.. For such an Amazing experience

Straight up, we did not eat a meal here, we ate dessert only and had drinks.    Being only a stone throw from my sister's house and open until late, it was a perfect spot when we decided to do a late dessert before I left early the next morning back home.  At 10:30 pm, the run a "late night menu" which had limited yet with variety selection of entrees and desserts.  It also had some recommended drinks.   Being a non-drinker, I have to go by the drinkers' opinions which were that the drinks were good. Upon investigation of the drink menu, an obscure ingredient made these two Hawaii girls go, hmmm. Li hing mui. Upon further investigation we found out that the bartender was originally from Hawaii.  Cool point.   Dessert... ah, even on this late menu, was unique and interesting.  At this late hour, one would be forgiving if a place just offered a slice of pie with ice cream on the side. Not here.  The were individually prepared and it took time to get it.    I'll say this much, when an employee/our server knows all the owners and their history, points them all out at 10:30 on a weeknight, and gushes about their hard work, ability to collaborate and be original; you as business owners, are doing something right.     Overall it seems that this place is ambitious and willing to take the risk, exert the extra energy and push the bill to get people to see that they are not a joke when it comes to creating an original experience.  I can safely say this, on this Tuesday night, by the time we left at about midnight, the place was even more crowded then when we came.    I am definitely coming back again to try their regular menu.
Absolutely outstanding food and service. amazing entrée and the same with the appetizers tremendous selection wine list is good drinks fantastic beer selections, wonderful ready to go back

Amazing happy hour food & beer prices.  Had the Dump Truck Salad, and it was bursting with tons of veggies and probably came in at over a pound.  For $5 it's literally a steal.  The charcuterie plate on HH is also $5 and also amazing.  Great house-made mustard, meats, pickles, etc.  Very unique and tasty.  Wish they had some non-alcoholic beer or cocktail options.

This was a very fun and interesting place. We went for lunch I believe during the week so it really quiet. We shared the tostada appetizer and then shared the apocalypse sow pork burger. Both were very tasty! Service was really great too, they were attentive and friendly. The only thing I would say is the prices seemed a bit high for the portion size they gave you. Other than that our experience was great and we'd go back to try some more options.

It was restaurant week so we got booted to the outside at 5pm, which I think my cousin got bit by a scorpion something, which I'm so glad my baby didn't. Her skin puffed up. It was really bad..  To the food...(happy hour by the way too) The food is that asian/mexican fusion with tacos, etc that just didn't impress me because it's become the norm. My stomach starting hurting afterwards and I had to drink a lot of water. Overall, I just wasn't wowed and my cousin landed in the urgent care = deal breaker

We had a great experience for dinner last night. Arrived around 6:00 pm, needed a table for 6. The host was so welcoming, he set the tone for a fabulous time. We had two different servers, both had great personalities which made the meal so much fun. We ordered the BLT's made with pork belly, fabulous! A hamburger was also ordered and pronounced delicious as well as a Cuban pickle crisis sandwich which was also a hit. The beer and wine were reasonably priced as well. A great evening and we will definitely be back!  Thank you!
Mixed...have been several times...seems to have gone downhill a bit.  The bacon, however, is amazing!!!

My husband and I have been here several times, and each time I've been impressed with our food. The staff is extremely friendly, and our server always recommends interesting craft cocktails for us to try.   The shrimp and grits are flavorful with creamy grits and a wonderful cured chorizo addition. The "apocalypse sow" pork burger was flavorful and juicy but extremely rich. We recommend sharing it with someone. My husband's favorite is the crispy skin trout, which comes with an incredible brown butter sauce and roast fingerling potatoes. The mussels were flavorful with a wonderfully spicy broth. You definitely need the grilled bread to stop up the sauce.   As for the appetizers... I can't say it enough... Pork shoulder tostadas. They're fantastic. We had the Mac n cheese as an appetizer also, and that was even better than we had anticipated.

Pig and pickle... This place came highly recommended by friends so we decided to give it a try.   Service was ok. The waiter forgot to bring our side of shredded pork despite three reminders. Oh well...not the biggest issue. Drinks were ok. The "special" hoop-Dee drink at $13 didn't live up to the hype.   We got the pork tostadas with kimchi for appetizers which we really enjoyed. Only disappointment was the kimchi was not spicy. It was either white kimchi or they washed the kimchi of its red pepper. However, we were delighted with the amount of juicy succulent shredded pork on top of the tostadas. I probably could've eaten two servings of these for dinner.  My husband got the Apocalypse Sow burger. True to its name, it's a heart attack/cholesterol buster neatly packaged between two pieces of bread. But it was delicious. Who can say no to various pieces of pork piled on top of each other?  I had the burger with dump truck salad side. The burger was ok. Nothing fabulous. The dump truck salad was nothing phenomenal either. It was an interesting mixture of veggies to include chopped cauliflower. But in my honest opinion, the salad dressing lacked any flavor whatsoever. I was a bit underwhelmed.  But let's get to the pickle spear that comes with your burger. I was very disappointed for an establishment that has "pickle" in its name to put a pickle so sour and tart it makes your eyes water on its plates. It wasn't only me that has such a reaction to my bite into the pickle. The whole table of 6 agreed. So I can honestly vouch it wasn't just me... :(   sorry pig & pickle you under delivered on the pickle...

Yep - first stop - late night - right after landing and picking up the rental car.  One of the few options for late night (that I found when doing my pre-trip research).    They even have a Late Night Menu.  What did we have?    The pickle platter ("Some Pickled Things") is a must - many unusual (rarely pickled) items - red grapes anyone?! Delicious!   Also tried the "Apocalypse Sow" burger - ground pork burger, bacon, aged cheddar & grilled onions - absolutely great!  Final item we tried was the "Tot of the Day" - good - but not up to the standard set by the other two items listed above.  Oh and did I mention the extensive beer menu?  I honestly don't remember what we had, but that's the point - take the guidance offered by the bartender.  You like it hoppy? fruity? heavy/light? - answer honestly - and then drink whatever is put in front of you - you'll be glad you did!  Run, don't walk to the Pig & Pickle!

Plain jane atmosphere, eggs Benedict on corn pancake was kinda bad, pork belly and eggs was very tasty. Morning missle drink was like fermented OJ that you found in your cooler from last summers camping trip. Wait staff was awesome. I will go back again just for some more pork belly whatever.

Crazy good!  We started with the pork belly and watermelon gazpacho. Both great! The heirloom tomatoes in both dishes cant be beat. So fresh and full of flavor.   For dinner I had the duck leg with an added sunny side up duck egg on top. I can't tell you how awesome it was. They had a torchon de fois gras on the side... Omg. So creamy and dense.   My husband had the grilled ribeye, med rare. Veryyyy good! Cooked perfectly and the scalloped potatoes with leeks was delicious.   Will return for sure!

Huge fan of this place. Every time I go I always have a great meal. My favorites are the carnita tostadas with kimchi and of course the house pickle because of the pickled grapes. I will definitely keep returning

My absolute fav in Scottsdale. The food is locally sourced. The menu is progressive. The chef is grounded. So are the bar staff. All my needs are met and its been going on for some time now. Yes. Its true love.

This is my first "updated" review. I hate to say it, but P&P has been on a steady decline and my previous 5 stars must be amended. Sadly this decline has gimped both the service and the food. It started when I was with my best friend and we received, how should I put it... adversarial service from our waiter. I mispronounced the beer company "deschuttes"  and was callously mocked. Things went downhill from there. The level of arrogance and disrespect we received from him was way out of line but the food was spot on. Based on the waiter I put P&P on probation for a while.  I returned for some takeout and placed my order at the bar. I recognized one of tha managers and explained to him that my absence was caused by that atrocious waiter. The manager was happy to inform me that he was fired and that he had a bad feeling about hiring him. This time the takeout fell way flat. The pork tostada, which is one of their strongest apps was about 20% pork fat. It was nearly inedible and I had to pick out the pieces before digging in. The flavors were there, but this was a pretty obvious execution error.  The last straw was when I bought my parents in for dinner. Service was aloof, I had to get up and fill my own water due to an absence of attention. The Korean Beef lettuce wraps suffered a myriad of issues. Primairly the steak was served at room temp, combined with being undercooked and disgustingly fatty, this was a complete flop and a textural nightmare. The waiter spotted me filling my parents water glasses themselves and apologized for his lack of attention. I took the opportunity to call him out for poor ap, and he took it off my bill. After the water incident he paid us more attention and P&P crushed the main courses.  I wonder if P&P has had major staff shakeups, because my first handful of visits were flawless (see my original review). The talent in the kitchen and wait staff has had such a blatant fall from grace I can't see myself returining. Ever. A creative concept and menu brought down by poor service and execution. I'm sad but I'm sure I will find a new gastropub.

My husband and I had dinner here tonight, expecting something...more.  I had the trout, and he ordered the steak.  They both were good but just not as good as we had expected it to be.  Or maybe we've just had better.  My biggest complaint about both dishes is that it was surprisingly very lemon-y.  At first, I thought that since I had ordered fish, it must have been topped off with lemon juice because even my mashed potatoes tasted sour.  But my husband's entree was lemon-y too.  It was very bizarre.  Anyway, if we are going to pay around $20/person for fish and steak, I think we'll go somewhere else that uses less lemons in their dishes.

The cocktails and the menu are unique and diverse. If you like homemade simple syrup and infused syrups made here as well as aged whiskey in flavored barrels this is the bar menu for you. The beer menu does not disappoint as for the food brunch is amazing and so is happy hour. The dinner menu changes often and is very gastronomic delights and this is a foodies heaven. If you are in Scottsdale, give pig and pickle a try it will not disappoint

Never in my 55 years have I been the recipient of such wonderful service. My 90 year old parents, my 5, 20-some year old children, and my 2 year old grandson had an amazing time at Pig and Pickle tonight. Food was great and service every bit as fabulous. The entire staff went beyond the call of duty to keep our lil 2 year old, who awakened mid meal, happy with toys, ice cream, lollipops, bacon slices, etc.  The friendliest restaurant ever and the duck was DIVINE!! We will definitely return again and again.

One of my rare perfect scores. This place has great food that is made and produced locally. Awesome service everyone is super friendly and accommodating.   Drinks also on point. I had the Cilantragon Margarita. Tequila, tarragon simple, cilantro, lime, sriracha, fresh sour, burlesque bitters #margarita  Fresh baked bread with their own crafted apricot jam, smoked butter and cherry bacon jam is a must try.   Pork belly with sphinx ranch date glaze, farro, pea tendrils, pickled pearls and bourbon maple pecan brittle. Yumm!  Excellent overall.

Looking forward to trying something a bit different on a Friday night in Scottsdale, so we settled on Pig & Pickle. Let me start by first saying the staff was above average, very friendly, attentive and happy to recommend different menu items. We started with 2 small apps, the lamb sliders & tacos. The tacos were very flavorful and easily our favorite of the evening. The lamb sliders looked and smelled promising, but were rather dry. I would give these another shot, perhaps ask to have them medium rare (I wasn't given an option). We decided to split the BLT after reading the reviews, I really wish we hadn't. The pork belly wasn't crispy at all and rather bland. Very disappointing, we should've ordered the Apocalypse Sow. There are so many different restaurant options in Scottsdale, I have to say we left underwhelmed. Maybe it was just an off night.

One of our favorite spots. The Pig & Pickle is always a great dinning experience. While the menu is always evolving, the staple dishes are always awesome.   The P&P is a great spot for a client dinner, a night out with family and friends, or simply for a quick bite.   Don't skip the Pork shoulder tostadas or the Apocalypse Sow burger. Enjoy!

Thought will try this place for Easter Sunday Dinner. Not happy at all. The Service was great & Our server was ever so nice, but the food portions were a disaster. We were left hungry & had to get food on the way home. It's a good place for people on a diet. Lol. The drinks were not good either. Had a Cocktail that said it was with Ginger Tequila & Ginger Honey. There was nothing that tasted Ginger in there, other than the candied slice of ginger garnish. The drinks were in very small glasses. Not seen those glasses any other place. For $9.50, not worth it. Ordered the Marrow bone. There was no marrow. Just the bone. A huge bone, with nothing inside. What a waste of money that was. Had the pear salad, which was a very small plate, but it tasted good. My Husband had the Mussels in Thai Curry sauce. It was just a bowl full of Coconut milk. No flavor, just watery Coconut milk & the Mussels floating in it. My Husband had to order another meal, as he was still Hungry. I have never been to any restaurant in the US that we have not had food leftover. Here we had nothing leftover. We were in need of more food. And this is after we had a Breakfast & Easter lunch at home. And we are generally not big eaters. So you can imagine the size of the portions. Very Disappointed. Certainly won't be going here again. We live about 30 mins away, but still thought it will be worth the drive. Certainly not. I read the reviews on here & decided to try it out, but I am sorry I have to differ. It's nothing like what people have said on here. We spent almost $100 for 3 people & came home Hungry. Don't waste your time going here. There are better places around, cheaper & bigger portions.

Been twice for lunch.  A casual bar-type place in a strip mall is my kind of place, but unfortunately I just don't like Pig & Pickle.  The cocktails are some of the best around, with a great list and they are very well made; so I do recommend going for cocktails and a snack.  The service is hit or miss - we had an outstanding waitress our first trip but a sloth disguised in hipster guy's clothing our second.  Don't eat the pickles unless you also enjoy eating powdered alum, and be aware they like putting those pickles in a lot of their dishes. The "tots" are really hush puppies, and I don't like hush puppies...but I do love tots, so that was a disappointment.  The dump truck salad had greens, carrots, tomatoes and dressing and that was all.  That's fewer ingredients than a Costco salad, and certainly not worthy of the name "dump truck".  All the sandwiches and the quinoa salad I tried tasted flat, probably not seasoned correctly, though it was all cooked and plated perfectly.  Sorry, but I can't adequately describe the bad tasting food other than "flat".  I didn't finish anything but the broccoli soup which was not flat at all - that soup was very, very good.  But soup and cocktails aren't enough to draw me in again or recommend Pig & Pickle for anything more than drinks.

As a working mom, I don't get out as often as I'd like. I was super stoked that my gno time was spent last week at the Pig and Pickle in Scottsdale.  You pull in to a random strip mall (standard for Scottsdale) and take a step into another world. And it's a tasty world for sure! The tostadas were my favorite. Piled high with shredded pork shoulder and married with fresh slaw and mint....these were, in a word....phenom!  For a nice Jewish girl, I'm actually a bit of an expert on pork shoulder and this was really great.  We also had pork belly...which tasted like a porky fois gras on top of seared pineapple.   The shrimp and grits were good, but not amazing. Im not going to lie, I'm from the south and I can be overly particular when it comes to these two items.   Our service was fab, the atmosphere was hip and dim and there was even a football game on. If they had been playing reggae music all night it would have been five star....oh wait...they WERE playing reggae all night. (And good stuff like Natural Mystic, not just Buffalo Soldier courtesy reggae!)  P and P...I will be back!

I'd really like to review the food, but I can't because I've been sitting here for over 30 minutes and I'm still waiting for it to come. No acknowledgment or apologies from any of the waitstaff. There are at least three parties waiting to be seated and more than three empty tables... If you have a lot of time on your hands and a lot of patience, come check it out.  Okay the food finally showed up and it actually was REALY good, I have to admit.... Or maybe it just seemed really good cause I was so starving by the time I finally got it...

I would have had a much better experience if I ordered something else. I was with a few other people and they had already ordered apps which were all fantastic. Especially some sort of pork tostadas that has an Asian flair. Very yummy!   I ordered a Cuban-Esque sandwich but it has SO much horseradish or hot mustard that upon the first bite my tastebuds and sinuses were kaput. It was overwhelming.  I hate sending food back - makes me nervous so instead I just didn't eat. The server never noticed my entire sandwich sitting there untouched either.   We did order desserts. I had a bite of bread pudding and carrot cake. They were phenomenal.   I just can't rate higher with such a flop on my main dish. Maybe next time!

As a foodie I LOVED this place. Bone marrow! Charcuterie, their own pickled eggs...and hard-to-find beers on tap. They grow their own herbs, they source locally, AND the prices were lower than many other restaurants around the Scottsdale area. Oh yes...the breads were amazing!   The wait staff...fun and informative, but SLOW. Like 15-minutes-to-get-a-drink slow. And it wasn't very busy. So that's the only reason it got 4 out of 5 stars. The next time I go back (and I will go back), if the service is faster, I'll up this to 5 stars.

We absolutely love this place. Jen the bartender showed us such personable service along with great bloody Mary's, food is amazing !!.... Burger with duck egg, foi gras and pork belly ... To die for it !!!!! Scott and Tyler amazing team, amazing place ... It's a must !!!!
Food and adventure, and beer combine in a joyous conflux. The flavors, and personalities are such that they provide for a wonderful foray in modern gastronomy

The food is eclectic, original, flavorful and never disappointing. The dump truck salad, the duck confit poutine, the pickled everything...all amazing. The servers are fun and knowledgeable, the bartenders have a heavy hand (who doesn't love that!), they're open late and the atmosphere is laid back. All great things in a restaurant. If you decide to try this place, order their carrot cake for dessert. You'll being sending me a thank you message!

(Lyrics - Harry Chapin/Ugly Kid Joe - Cats In The Cradle) I arrived to this place just the other day I drove here in the usual way But there were plates to serve and bills to pay I came for happy hour and I ordered away And the server was talkin' 'fore I knew it, and as he spoke He'd say "I'm gonna go grab your drinks man" You know I'm gonna go grab drinks  And the pig & pickle in South Scottsdale Little Asian boy and the mood for some food Comfort style from the home that's rad! Restaurant Week, we'll get together then You know we'll have a good time then  Pig & Pickle offers comfort style food right in South Scottsdale.  A little off from the main strip of Oldtown, but that's all good.  I remember this place when it was the Detour Tavern which obviously didn't work out.  The layout is still the same.  Granite bar table on the South end with the patios outside.  Open kitchen on the Northwest side overviewing the dining room.
